loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analie is 35 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Analie has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Daisy is 49 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Daisy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for her boat.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Bala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Bala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Bala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dan Asabe

texts.en:
Dan Asabe is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dan Asabe has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Dan Asabe would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dan Asabe can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Dan Asabe will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Dan Asabe is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
Lydia is a single mother with a boy who is in primary school. She is also the leader of this two-member group named Gold Group. The two are hardworking and determined to make their businesses successful.

This will be Lydia’s fourth loan with Kiva's field partner ID-Ghana; her previous loans were successfully repaid. She is now applying for a 2,400 GHS to be split between the two members. Because she has had an increase in customers, she will use her portion to buy provisions such as soft drinks, soap, biscuits and tomato paste to satisfy her buyers’ needs.

The two women wish to say, “We thank Kiva and ID-Ghana for their positive impacts on our businesses, and we will do our best in the repayment with loyalty.”

loans.use: to buy provisions such as soft drinks, soap, biscuits and tomato paste to satisfy her buyers’ needs.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hajara has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hajara can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Hajara will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hajara is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
The Warna Sari Group has received loans from MUK and can be paid well. Luh, the head of the group, manages her loan wisely. Any repayment of the loan can be done on time under the supervision the head of the group. Luh sold her piglets at a satisfactory price after keeping them for two months. Now she can renovate her house.

Luh is very grateful for the benefits she earned, and she thanks lenders for their support. For electricity and water, Luh spends 200,000 IDR per month.

Now, the Warna Sari Group is receiving their new loan. The group expected an increased amount of loan, but after having an evaluation by MUK’s staff, the group still is receiving the same loan amount.

Luh is head of the group. She already has two sows. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase super-quality feed only. She must protect the health of her sows. She hopes the sows can give birth safely, and the piglets can grow healthy. She sell the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque.

She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

loans.use: to purchase super-quality feed only.

loans.name: Cendana Group

texts.en:
The Cendana Group consists of five entrepreneurs. The leader of Cendana Group is Nurhasanah (standing in the middle). She is 50 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are living at different places and having jobs. 

In order to expand Nurhasanah and her members' businesses, they formed this group and requested a loan from TLM for 8,750,000 IDR. Nurhasanah will use her portion of  the loan on cake ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, vegetables, etc. Other members of the group will use their loans for business expansion. These five women are hoping that with the business assistance provided TLM, they will be able to expand their business in order to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cake ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gladwel

texts.en:
Gladwel is 29 years old and is married with 1 child.
She has had a clothes shop business for 3 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more clothes and hopes this will help her to have more customers to sell her clothes to.
Her hopes and dreams for the future are to go to educate her child to university level

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennilyn sells beverages in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Jennilyn requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a variety of beverages to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beverages to sell

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou is 30 years old and has three children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Jackielou operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years, selling a variety of items.

Jackielou requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as beverages, snack foods, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as beverages, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
This nice woman is 62 years old and her name is Hamest. Hamest has a family but temporally she lives alone since her husband and son are abroad working there and her daughter is married and she lives with her family. Hamest lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region where she started from 1975 till today working at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Hamest graduated Yerevan State University the faculty of Philology. Hamest mentions of her 40 years of pedagogical experience with great pleasure since she likes her pupils very much, who after graduation still keep on visiting their beloved and respected teacher.

Hamest also gives paid private courses of Armenian Language and Literature and on this way she prepares some pupils for their entrance exams. This loan of 690.000 Armenian drams she asks for the purchase of a computer and also professional literature, since she finds very important the occupation of self-development for any pedagogue, no matter of the length of work experience and also the age of the pedagogue.

loans.use: for the purchase of computer and also professional literature since she finds very important the occupation of self-development for any pedagogue

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en: Dara’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Dara makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. Currently he is facing trouble in driving taxi due to its old tires.

That is why Naseem has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR for her husband to buy new tires along with some spare parts to provide better facilities to his customers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some spare parts to provide better facilities to his customers.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, shown in the photo, at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is the mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 48 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is running a cart for transferring goods from one place to another. He makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Now he needs to purchase a larger size wooden cart for delivering more goods at a time.

That is why Naseem has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a larger size wooden cart for delivering more goods at a time.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.en:
Maria Francisca is a mother who has always worked hard to be able to give her children better life opportunities. She is a farmer, growing corn and beans in Agua Azul, a small town located in Campeche, México. Agua Azul has only 295 residents, all of whom live in marginalized conditions and have no access to electricity.

Maria Francisca works during the day at the field, and when she arrives home late at night, most of the time her children want help them with the homework, but the lighting from,the candles make it difficult to study and her children often complain about their eyes.

Maria Francisca want to help their kids to have a better life, and she knows is crucial for them to have more time to study. Additionally, she is a single mother, and as the only person in the house earning money she needs to be able to save money for incidentals.

By purchasing a solar system, she will be able to study with her children at night and also will be able to save $200 pesos per month.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to allow her kids more study time, and help her save money to put toward incidentals.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She maintains her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for a year now and is a well trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day.

She requires some beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. So Naseem contacted Kiva's field partner through brac Pakistan. Brac and their staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan.

She is much thankful to brac Pakistan and Kiva platform.

loans.use: to invest in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bernardita is 49 years old and her four children are currently in school.

Bernardita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy new fishing nets and bamboo.

Bernardita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and bamboo.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, solicita nuevamente un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ya que se avecina la temporada navideña y es una buena oportunidad para poder percibir buenos ingresos, ya que al tener un inventario más surtido atraerá más clientes, María busca poder continuar dándole una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
Las condiciones de vida de María se mantienen pero su condición económica ha mejorado considerablemente con la ayuda de la inversión del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan so that she can buy clothing for women, men and children. The approaching Christmas season is a good time for her to increase her income. She hopes to attract more customers with a greater selection of stock.
María wants to be able to keep providing a good life for her family. María's personal circumstances are stable, her economic situation has improved considerably thanks to the support provided by the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men and children. The approaching Christmas season is a good time to increase her income.

loans.name: Eiby Maricela

texts.es: Eiby, tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltera, vive junto a sus padres en el municipio de La Lima, Cortes. Ella cuenta con su propio negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 1 año, donde ofrece productos como camisas, pantalones de tela y jean para dama y caballero, blusas, faldas y más. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba  ayudarle a su madre a la crianza de cerdos para la venta y a estudiar. Ella solicita la cantidad de 9,000 Lempiras para la Compra de un fardo de ropa de segunda mano para aumentar el inventario y surtir su negocio. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña. Su meta es continuar con el negocio y con las ganancias desea continuar con sus estudios hasta graduarse en la universidad.
texts.en:
Eiby is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the municipality of La Lima, Cortes province. She has had her own business selling clothing for the last year. Eiby offers products such as shirts, cloth pants, and jeans for women and men; plus blouses, skirts and more. Previously, she helped her mother raise pigs to sell and, also, spent her time studying.

Eiby is requesting 9,000 Lempiras to purchase a bundle of second hand clothing in order to augment her inventory and re-supply her business. This investment will help her increase her sales during the Christmas season.

Eiby's goal is to continue her business. And with her earnings she wishes to continue her studies until graduating from the university.

loans.use: buy a bundle of second hand clothing to expand her inventory and sell.

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
I Putu is a farmer and cocoa dealer from Indonesia. He has been granted many loans and done well. He has seldom had difficulties because of the weather, but this year the dry season lasted longer than previously, and the yield from his rice fields was poor.

The problem is that the profits he makes from his farm are split in half between the landowners and he. Fortunately, the land owners realize the difficulties being faced by farmers and are very understanding. I Putu’s cocoa business is also going well this season, so he is able to get by.

I Putu has applied for a 10,000,000 IDR loan through Kiva's field partner MUK. He will use this to buy rice and corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for his fields, plus rent a tractor, pay laborers and use the rest to purchase cocoa.

I Putu will now plant corn, as the rainy season has commenced. He hopes the weather will support him in getting the maximum result from his crops. He plans to save all of his profits in the form of venture capital.

loans.use: to buy rice & corn seeds, fertilizer & insecticides, rent a tractor, pay laborers & buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Nila continúa con su negocio de venta de empanadas (sentada a la derecha, viste malla a rayas horizontales celeste y amarillo). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando insumos de cocina para preparar empanadas, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajo continuamente sin problemas. Actualmente la banca continúa trabajando unida, sus negocios crecieron y pudieron comprar mercadería, materia prima de trabajo, pagar los servicios y arreglar sus ambientes de trabajo. Su negocio de venta de empanadas mejoró en cuanto a  ventas porque pudo terminar toda su producción, también tuvo tiempo para ocuparse de sus hijos porque los insumos le duraron más tiempo, “pude vender por mayor a vendedoras minoristas eso me dio más tiempo para ocuparme de mi familia…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque vende por mayor y menor. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina para vender por mayor. Su sueño es tener una tienda de venta de empanadas, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como aceite, harina, carne, verduras y otros para vender empanadas por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nila solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para vender empanadas por mayor.
texts.en:
Nila continues with her business of selling empanadas (She is seated to the right in the photo, wearing a top with blue and yellow horizontal stripes). She used the loan she obtained to buy cooking supplies to prepare empanadas. She made her payments on time, because she worked constantly and did not experience problems.

Currently the communal bank is continuing to work together. Their revenues have grown. They been able to buy merchandise, raw materials for their work, pay their utilities and fix up their work places.

Nila's business selling empanadas has improved in sales both wholesale and retail as she has been able to complete all her production. She has also had time to take care of her children as her supplies have lasted longer. "I was able to sell wholesale to retailers and this gave me more time to take care of my family", she commented.

Her business is successful as she sells retail and wholesale. The advantage of her business is sales are daily, her disadvantage is the lack of cooking supplies to sell wholesale. Her dream is to have a store selling empanadas. She wants to buy cooking supplies like oil, flour, meat, vegetables and others to sell empanadas wholesale. This is her second loan with the institution in the two years she has worked in this business.

For these reasons Nila is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies to sell empanadas wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients to sell empanadas wholesale.

loans.name: El Buen Triunfo Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario “El Buen Triunfo”, lo conforman res mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes el día a día madrugan para dar inicio a sus actividades económicas que le permitan el crecimiento y mejoramiento de sus familias. Coordinado por Erlinda de 67 años, quien es casada, con un hijo a su responsabilidad y quien por 5ta vez se encuentra solicitando crédito para seguir mejorando su negocio que es una pulpería en su domicilio, ahora invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, galletas, aceite, jugos. Que son los productos de mayor consumo por sus clientes, así podrá mejorar su venta. Josefa es otro miembro de 36 años ella se dedica a la venta de pan de manera ambulante, entre sus productos esta la venta de pico, pan simple, manjar y más. Valeska, de 23 años se dedica a la venta de jugos gaseosas y galletas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, "El Buen Triunfo", is made up of three enterprising and determined women who rise early everyday to begin their economic activities which allow for the growth and improvement of their families. 

They are coordinated by Erlinda, 67, who is married and responsible for a child, for whom she is requesting a loan for the fifth time to continue improving her business. Her business is a small grocery store in her home. She will now invest in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, cookies, oil and juices. They are the products of highest consumption by her customers, and in this way she can improve her sales. 

Josefa is another member of the group. She is 36 years old and works as a street vendor selling bread. She has, among her products for sale, triangle shaped pastries with a grated cheese filling, simple bread, delicious food and more. Valeska, 23, works in the sale of carbonated juices and cookies.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cookies, oil and juices.

loans.name: Eliotropo 2 Group

texts.es: Luisa es quien coordina el grupo Eliotropo 2, ella es una mujer quien es luchadora y trabajadora desde hace varios años y quien se dedica a su superación para ayudar a su familia. Ella es soltera y desde hace 10 años se dedica al bordado de diferentes diseños para poder ser comercializados y los de mayor demanda. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de toallas, toallas de mano, tira bordadas, adornos, estuche para controles y baterías. Las demás socias son Thania de 20 años dedicada a la venta de productos plásticos y Jairo de 43 años quien tiene un taller de vulcanización.
texts.en: Luisa is the coordinator for the group Eliotropo 2. She has been a determined and hard-working woman for many years and is dedicated to succeeding in order to help her family. She is single and for 10 years now has made a living designing different embroidery patterns in order to sell the ones which there is great demand for. She requires the loan to be able to buy towels, hand towels, embroidered bands, decorations, box for controls and batteries. The other members are Thania who is 20 years old and who makes a living selling plastic products, and Jairo who is 43 years old and who has a vulcanization workshop.

loans.use: to buy towels, hand towels, embroidered bands, decorations, box for controls and batteries

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 58 años y vive con su esposa e hijos en el municipio de San Pedro de Uraba. Tiene 7 hijos, 4 hombres y 3 mujeres, quienes han sido la razón de ser de este abnegado hombre. Hace 25 años, este padre decidió comenzar un negocio de cría de ganado y algunos cultivos, lo que le ha permitido proveer por su familia.

El pide hoy un préstamo para comprar más ganado, además de materiales agropecuarios para la mejora de los potreros. Él quiere que su negocio sea exitoso, que mejore sus ventas, aumente sus clientes, que pueda ser más competitivo y que sea sostenible. El sueña con pagar la educación de sus hijos que algún día el negocio les pertenezca a ellos.

Ayude hoy a David a cumplir sus sueños con el préstamo que necesita.
texts.en:
David is 58 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba. He has seven children, 4 boys and 3 girls who have been the reason for being of this selfless man. Twenty five years ago this father decided to begin a business raising cattle and some crops, which allowed him to provide for his family.

Today he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle and agricultural supplies to improve his pastures. He wants his business to be successful, improve his sales and increase his clients so that he can be more competitive and sustainable. His dream is to pay for his children's education and one day have the business belong to them.

Help David today to achieve his dreams with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to buy more cattle as well as agricultural inputs to improve his pastureland.

loans.name: Oscar Heriberto

texts.es:
OSCAR DE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD SOLTERO CON UN HIJO MENOR DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE EN TIEMPO Y FORMA, EL CUAL HA DEMOSTRADO EN CREDITO ANTERIORES DE CUMPLIMIENTO DE PAGO, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA DIA A DIA PARA CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO ES FORMAR A SU HIJO, Y BRINDARLE UN FUTURO MEJOR, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. 
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDADE ECONOMICA EL SERVICIO DE TAXI PRESTADO A LA POBLACION EN GENERAL, EL NEGOCIO LO DESEMPEÑA DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y VIAJES PRIVADOS, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTE HOBRE ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR LLANTAS NUEVAS PARA SU UNIDAD DE TAXI, Y PODER BRINDARLE UN SERVICIO MEJOR A LA POBLACION EN GENERAL QUE SON SUS CLIENTES. OSCAR AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old and has an underage son. He comes from Managua; he is a hard-worker, responsible with his time and conduct, and has proven to honor his payments in previous loans. 

He fights every day to fulfill his dreams and goals, such as providing his child with an education and a better future. Unfortunately they were not able to study and had to work in order to help out with household expenses.

Thanks to a will to succeed he works as a taxicab driver, servicing the community in general, by driving around or through appointment. This man usually works about twelve hours a day offering his services.  

The purpose of the loan is to invest in a working capital and to purchase new tires for his taxicab, so that he may offer a better service to the community, his clients. 

Oscar is grateful for the help Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources and from poor countries, like Nicaragua, in achieving dignified means of employment.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxicab.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
El socio Antenor pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Antenor continúa con su negocio  de agricultura, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso el socio espera poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando y espera que su negocio crezca.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, semillas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Antenor belongs to the communal bank Sayhua de Chichubamba.  The bank is located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  Antenor continues with this agriculture business.  He is a responsible and diligent person.  He hopes to be able to obtain more earnings in order to continue supporting his family.  

Antenor wants to be able to continue working and hopes that his business grows.  He seeks this loan to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds, among other things.  He is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, and seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La Sra. Valentina y su esposo viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare, tienen 53 y 50 años de edad respectivamente, de estado civil concubinos, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican ala actividad de agricultura siembran papa. y papaliza, para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de Colomi, La señora Valentina requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico y compra de productos agroquimicos, debido a que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de insumos agrícolas el mismo que e requiere renovar y mejorar.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, la señora Valentina y su esposo se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, además de poder contar con la ayuda porque con la compra de abono organico y productos agroquimicos podran obtener un mejor ingreso y incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Valentina and her partner live in Cochabamba in the Chapare region. They are 53 and 50 years old respectively; they cohabit and are financially independent. They both work as potato and ulluco farmers, selling their products at the market in the Colomi weekly fair. 

Valentina requires the loan for the purchase of organic fertilizer and agrochemicals, as well as for renovations and improvements, since her savings were invested in farming inputs.  

To conclude, Valentina and her partner are glad to be able to access the loan and count on support, because with the use of organic fertilizer and agrochemicals they will be able to obtain a better income and to increase their family estate, therefore improving their standard of living and providing for their family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemicals to improve production and so obtain a better income for her family.

loans.name: Mie Florianne

texts.fr: Les deux enfants de Floriane sont retournés à l'école cette année sans grande difficulté. Grace au bénéfices de son activité, elle a pu économiser un peu d'argent pour acheter les fournitures scolaires. Le prêt précédent lui a permis d'acheter des shampoings, savons de toilette,  déodorants et dentifrices. Elle a ainsi augmenter ses chiffres de vente à l'occasion de la réouverture des classes. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour encore augmenter son stock de shampoo, de savon, de déodorant et de dentifrice.
texts.en:
Floriane's two children returned to school this year without much difficulty. Thanks to the profit from her business, Floriane was able to save a little money to buy them school supplies. The prior loan permitted her to buy shampoo, bath soap, deodorant and toothpaste. In that way, she was able to grow her turnover when the school term began again.

to further increase her stock of shampoo, soap, deodorant and toothpaste.

loans.use: to further increase her stock of shampoo, soap, deodorant and toothpaste.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
María, es una mujer casada que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, el esposo de María es empleado y le ayuda económicamente también; María de dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, venta de ropa y además a la venta de granos básicos, María dice que este negocio lo aprendió gracias a su mamá y hace siete años, el cual atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 
María solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa, platos y utensilios desechables, granos básicos, pan de barra, etc. en vista que se acerca la temporada navideña y es una buena oportunidad para generar mayores ingresos. María considera que esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar, además podrá fortalece su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
El sueño de María es poder salir adelante junto a su grupo familiar, fortalecer lo más que pueda su negocio para poder darles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a married woman who lives together with her husband and her three children who are economically dependent on her. María's husband is employed and he helps them economically as well. María works selling food products, clothing and also basic grains. María says that she learned about this business thanks to her mother. She has done it for 7 years and she provides her service from 7:00am until 5:00pm. 

María seeks this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing, disposable plates and utensils, basic grains, French bread, etc. in light of the upcoming Chistmas season which is a good opportunity to obtain more income. María thinks that this will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family, moreover, it will strengthen her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. 

María's dream is to be able to get her family ahead and to strengthen her business as much as she can so she can provide university educations to her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, disposable plates and utensils, basic grains, French bread, etc. in light of the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Giovanni Dolores

texts.es:
Giovanni, de 25 años de edad, es un joven trabajador, está acompañado, vive con su pareja en casa de sus padres, aun no tiene hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar. 
 
Giovanni, trabaja como empleado de una empresa de telefonía, su cargo es de vendedor y su lugar de trabajo está muy cerca y el conocer mucho acerca de la venta de celulares, repuestos, reparaciones y accesorios, lo a convertido en un buen vendedor. 

Giovanni, necesita el préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios, ademas ofrecer servicio de reparación.

Los sueños de Giovanni, son poder tener su propio negocio, para que junto a su esposa puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Giovanni, age 25, is a hardworking young man.  He is in a relationship and lives with his partner in his parents’ home.  He doesn’t have any children yet, and his spouse works around the home.

Giovanni works as an employee in a telephone company.  His position is in sales.  His place of work is quite nearby.  He knows a lot about cell phone sales, parts, repairs, and accessories, and he has become a good salesman.

Giovanni needs this loan to be able to start his own business selling cell phones and accessories, in addition to offering repair services.

Giovanni’s dreams are to be able to have his own business so that, together with his wife, they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start his own business selling cell phones and accessories in addition to offering repair services

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo de 51 años es un microempresario habitante de Soledad, él está casado y es padre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, su negocio inició por la recomendación de un amigo residente en la capital del país quien lo llevó a una fábrica de sellos donde elaboran una línea infantil muy utilizada en guarderías para el desarrollo motriz de los niños. En la actualidad Eduardo cuenta con  nueve años  distribuyendo estos sellos en la zona costa del país con muy buenos resultados y su meta es mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar los encargos de sellos de números, letras y formas para guarderías y colegios. Esta financiación le permitirá contar con el capital necesario para continuar en su negocio sin contratiempos y mejorando sus tiempos de entrega.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 51 years old and is a micro-entrepreneur from Soledad.  He is married and is the father of four grown children.  He began his business at the recommendation of a friend who lives in the capital of the country, who took him to a stamp factory where a children's line is made.  It is used a great deal in kindergartens for children's motor development.

Eduardo distributed these stamps for nine years, in the coastal zone of the country, with very good results.  His goal is to improve the quality of life of his family.  For that reason he seeks a loan, a Kiva loan, as an opportunity to link himself to the world of finance through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will buy orders of stamps of numbers, letters and shapes for kindergartens and schools.  This financing will allow him to have the necessary capital to continue in his business with no setbacks and will improve his delivery times.

loans.use: to buy orders of stamps of numbers, letters and shapes for kindergartens and schools.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Justina continua con su  negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia es una mujer responsable ,la socia espera poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a  su familia, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tortas para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, cocoa, mantequilla  entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the Sayhua de Chichubamba communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Justina continues with her business making cakes. She is a responsible person. She hopes to be able to continue working in order to be able to continue supporting her family.

Justina continues making different cakes that are sought for various events. This is the way in which she moves her family forward. She seeks this credit to buy sugar, flour, cocoa and butter, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cocoa and butter, among other things.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 37 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Perla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with five children. Lilibeth is 43 years old and three of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and provide maintenance for her business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and do maintenance for her business.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Chin’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia.

Chin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en:
Chanthol’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthol makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to each safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is a 55-year-old married woman from Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She has six children. Herminda helps her spouse, who is a farmer, in looking after the welfare of their family. While her husband is on the farm, she looks after her sari-sari store business.

She is asking for a loan to expand and increase her inventory. She will use it to buy in bulk soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar, and seasonings.

Herminda is confident that with good management, financial awareness and perseverance, she is on the way to a successful business. It is her dream to give her family a decent home. Once she can save enough, she plans to make improvements to her house to make it bigger and more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en:
Rose Eden is 61 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rose Eden has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rose Eden has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 25 years old and married, with two children, one of whom is in school.

Mary Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Rose has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Phern's Group

texts.en:
Phern’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, in Cambodia.

Phern works as a seller and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has one child in school. She has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines.

Aurea has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gasoline to sell. Aurea has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
Carine is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Carine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Carine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en:
Davy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Davy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is a very energetic woman, who is 32 years old. She is passionate about working and has succeeded in taking her grocery store business forward. She started the business four years ago as a way to keep herself busy, since she has three children who have left her house. Thanks to loans from GDMPC, she succeeded in diversifying the products that she offers, and thus, growing as a businesswoman. Because of this, she trusts faithfully in both organizations.

At this time, Lynn knows that she needs to improve her business, and the only way of doing it is to get another loan from GDMPC. With this loan, she plans to buy large quantities of groceries items, and a display cabinet. Lynn has many goals. She plans to work hard until her business is very progressive.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokha works as factory laborer and a construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 59 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Arcelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Arcelita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kimyern's Group

texts.en: Kimyern’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Kimyern works as an officer and he also does extra work as a driver to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sovanoun's Group

texts.en: Sovanoun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sovanoun works as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina has been a fish dealer for 19 years. She and her husband have been doing this kind of business to generate a living. The couple was blessed with five children and all of them are still studying. Gina sells her fish daily at another municipality.

The couple aims to have continuous improvement of their fish vending business, and that is the reason Gina is asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000. She will use this amount of loan to buy two Styrofoam boxes and 25 kilograms of fish. She's hoping for approval of her requested loan amount, to be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy two styrofoam boxes and 25 kilograms of fish to sell.

loans.name: Poor But Fun Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 56 years old and married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Tâm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Poor but Fun Group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder surtir su negocio comprara faldas, blusas, vestidos, pantalones y ropa interior ya que se avecina una temporada muy buena para las ventas, en la que busca atender a mejor a sus clientes y poder obtener mayores ingresos para continuar dando estabilidad económica a su familia.
Con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su negocio, ha tenido nuevos ingresos, con los cuales ha remodelado su casa y también poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
María is asking for a loan again to be able to stock her business. She will buy skirts, blouses, dresses, pants, and underwear as a good sales period is coming up. She hopes to better attend to her customers and be able to make a better income in order to continue providing financial stability to her family.

With the previous loan she was able to improve her business. She has had new income with which she has remodeled her house as well having been able to provide daily support to her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, pants, and underwear as a good sales period is coming up.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sim works as an officer, and she also does extra work as driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mana's Group

texts.en:
Mana’s group live in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mana works as an officer and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and also to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mao works as an officer and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Funny Farm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Anh is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Anh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Anh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Anh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Funny Farm" group, which consists of four members. With her business profits, Anh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон житель района Джоми. Он женат и имеет детей. Абдурахмону 49 лет. Он простой житель района. Абдурахмон хочет начать новый бизнес и зарабатывать на жизнь. У него имеется не большой магазин. Он хочет перевозить продукт питания на продажу. Абдурахмон мечта иметь собственный магазин с все продуктами. В Будущем планирует расширить свой магазин и увеличить товарооборот. Абдурахон запрашивает кредит для перевоза продукт питания. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему иметь бизнес и постоянный источник доход. Помогите ему начать новый бизнес.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon is a resident of the A. Jomi region. He is married and has children. Abdurahmon is 49 years old, and is a simple resident of the region. He wants to start a new business and earn money to live on. He has a small store, and he wants to transport food products to sell.

Abdurahmon's dream is to have his own store with all types of groceries. In the future, he plans to expand his store and increase his goods in stock. Abdurahmon is requesting a loan to transport food products. The requested loan will help him have a business and a permanent source of income. Help him to start his new business.

loans.use: to buy food products and start a new business.

loans.name: Hồi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồi is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Hồi lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, this job is unstable. The main hardship that Hồi faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Hồi's group, which consists of three members. With her business profits, Hồi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
She is Marcela, aged 54, a new member of CCT at Silang, Cavite branch. She is happily married to Teodulo who is also into buy and sell, farmer and a driver. The couple both work hard to feed their family and save for their senior years. She is glad that she learned about KIVA through CCT that supports small business men like her.

She trusts that you could again lend her funds in the amount of Php 11000 to pay for different kinds of local fruits like papaya, "guyabano" (sour sop) which has gained popularity because of its many benefits to the body. Her requested amount will surely help grow her fruit business. 

Marcela wishes for her fruit business to flourish and buy a delivery car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of fruit s to sell.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is maize farmer from Magajin Aska village. As a member of Babban Gona, Magaji is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ngula

texts.en:
Ngula is a married mother of one child, who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokorn’s Group members live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokorn works as officer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and teacher to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tsabango Group

texts.en:
Tusha is 23 years old. She is single with 1 child.

Tusha owns a grocery store. She would like to use this loan to buy more groceries to stock up her business. She has 2 family members that helps her with the day to day activities of the business. She started her business as a way of earning a living. The profits from his business will help her live a better life.

Tusha plans to keep her business vibrant so as to make good profits and also hopes to open a bigger shop in future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: 29 летняя Махбуба из района Джоми. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. По причине, что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Махбуба не стало ждать отправки денег мужа, и решила зарабатывать самостоятельно. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку и скорее начать зарабатывать. У нее имеется старая швейная машинка, но она уже устарела. Новая машинка стоит дорога, а У Махбубы нет сумма денег для купли швейной машинки. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
29-year-old Mahbuba is from the A. Jomi region. She is married and has one baby. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, because he was not able to find suitable work within the country. Mahbuba was not able to wait for her husband to send money, and has decided to earn money on her own.

Mahbuba wants to buy a new sewing machine so she can start earning money soon. She has an old sewing machine, but it's already worn out. A new sewing machine is expensive, and Mahbuba doesn't have the amount of money she would need to buy one. For this reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and start a new business.

loans.name: Maivy

texts.en:
Maivy is a farmer from the town of New Village Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three dependents.  She also raises hogs for supplemental income. She has been in the farming business for 4 years now. This is the main source of her income.

Maivy is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and feed and supplements for pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus augment her harvest and yield. As well, her pigs will grow well, assuring her of good sales in 4 months.

In the future, Maivy hopes to make her farming business more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feeds supplements for pigs

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marieta is 39 years old and has two children are still in school.

Marieta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Marieta has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Jolanna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jolanna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Jolanna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for her boat.

Jolanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Blanqueta

texts.en:
Blanqueta is a married woman, 58 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Blanqueta has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Blanqueta requested a PHP 35000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fresh vegetables to sell to her local market.

Blanqueta has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fresh vegetables to sell to her local market

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Jenely has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jenely would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam, a 29 years old married guy who is known among his friends and family of his creativity and ‎shyness. Three years ago Wisam convinced his brother to partner with him and open and artistic ‎business making mosaic art since they have that creativity sense in the family, they started at ‎home then opened a small workshop then now they moved into a shop where they display all their ‎work from mosaic and expanded it to include clay art and pottery work. Opening the business in a ‎tourism area in Madaba has helped the business to move on and expand, since their work is more ‎attractive to the tourists. ‎
On a personal level, His business has also helped him to build his own home and get married to ‎start a family of his own. Now Wisam is applying for a loan to expand the display area by ‎redecorating the shop and later on he is planning of taking over the next door shop as an ‎expansion.‎

loans.use: to expand the display area of his mosaics shop by ‎redecorating the area.

loans.name: Njoki

texts.en:
Njoki is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Njoki operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

Bou makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

texts.en:
Rothana’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, in Cambodia.

Rothana works as a seller and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mustafah

texts.en:
Mustafah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mustafah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustafah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mustafah can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mustafah will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mustafah is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 52 years old and single. Milagros works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Milagros has been in this business for 29 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geline is 33 years old and has two children are still in school.

Geline has a fishing business in the Philippines. Geline requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and maintenance for her business.

Geline has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:

Marife has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marife would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 38 years old and married with nine children.

Mylene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceriers.

Mylene has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mylene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceriers

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
With intensive and maximum care, Ni Luh can improve the outcome from her cocoa farm.

Cocoa is harvested approximately every two weeks, and in each harvest, Ni Luh got results of 35 kg of dry beans. Cocoa beans will be dried for two days to get full sun. Price per kg is currently around 30,000 IDR. Within one month of Ni Luh harvesting two times, the total gross income is 2,100,000 IDR.

She is very happy with the results she gets. Her hard work paid off. Ni Luh is increasingly eager to pursue agriculture.

With the new loan, Ni Luh and the members of the Pudak Sari Wangi group will buy fertilizer and pesticide to ensure maximum results from their garden. Ni Luh will use her loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and a new farming tool. She is planning to increase the yield from her cocoa. The group said they're thankful to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting their effort, and it led them to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and a new farming tool.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The group makes their payments. During the loan periods, they can manage the business well. Maintaining pigs for pig barbeques is less costly than raising them. They can be fed with a traditional feed and can be sold after two months.

Ni Putu was very happy because her plans ran as she expected. She kept them for two months and sold them to the other breeder in her village. All the profits are to be used as capital for her chili garden.

With the success of her pig barbeque program, Ni Putu continues her business as a piglet seller. Now, she has a sow. Her piglets are of good quality because she keeps them well and gives them nutritious feed and vitamins. She also became an example to other breeders, not only in her group, but in her village, as well.

With the same loan amount, Ni Putu will use her loan to purchase superior quality feed and renovate the cage. Now, Ni Putu and her husband have a chili garden. With the profit she earns, she plans to plant other crops in her garden, such as eggplant and cassava. She hopes her plan can run well.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed and renovate the pig cage.

loans.name: Cricia

texts.en:
Cricia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cricia is 33 years old and has five children are still in school.

Cricia has a buy and sell shrimp business in the Philippines. Cricia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shrimp to sell to her customers.

Cricia has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
A resident in Banteay Meanchey Province, Hun is 50 years old and she is married with six children, two of whom depend on her. She is growing rice and working for others for a fee to support the family’s living. Drought is the main challenge to her rice growing business.

Hun now is in the first cycle with VisionFund and is leading a group member to apply for a loan to save the farming business. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer, to boost crop yields. She hopes that this loan will enable her to get abundant rice yields, to expand her business, and to improve living condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields, to expand her rice growing business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosa Daniela

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora de 18 años de edad, que se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, además de la distribución de verduras, la cual realiza desde hace 4 años. Ella habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace muchos años, junto a su abuela de 83 años de edad, a la que brinda todo su apoyo. El techo de la vivienda donde vive Rosa está deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera y de esta manera mejorar el techo de su vivienda evitan su continuo deterioro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working woman who is 18-years old. She makes her living raising and selling pigs. In addition, she has been distributing vegetables for the last four years.
For many years, Rosa has lived with her 83-year old grandmother in a home that is humble but their own. She gives her grandmother her full support.
The roof of their home is deteriorating, which is why Rosa is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will use the loan to purchase galvanized sheet metal, nails and wood so she can make improvements to her home's roof and prevent it from deteriorating further.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, nails and wood so she can improve her home's roof and prevent it from deteriorating further.

loans.name: San Martin De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE YANAHUARA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Yuri es una persona trabajadora que desea salir adelante, el se dedica a brindar servicios de mozo en una quinta (lugar donde se vende comida y bebidas tradicionales) muy importante de su localidad. Con este trabajo duro y sacrificado quiere un mejor futuro  y sus sueños es tener un negocio propio de alimentos donde el pueda tener más oportunidades de progresar.
El socio solicito el crédito para comprar zapatos y camisa para su uso, ya que es un requerimiento en su trabajo.
Los socios que salen adjuntos en la fotografía grupal pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios están contentos y agradecidos por el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The members belong to the San Martin de Yanahuara communal bank, which is located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Yuri is one of the members and is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead. He works as a waiter in a very important "quinta" [a place where traditional food and drinks are sold] in his neighborhood. Through this hard, taxing work he wants a better future. His dream is to have his own food business to have more opportunities to progress.

Yuri is applying for the loan to purchase shoes and a shirt for his own use since they are a requirement for his job.

The members who are added on in the photograph asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their jobs.

The members are happy and grateful for the loan offered by KIVA investors.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and a shirt.

loans.name: Rachny's Group

texts.en:
Rachny’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Rachny labors both in a factory and as a construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
