Thea’s group lives in a rural village in Cambodia's Phnom Penh province. Thea works as an officer, factory laborer and soldier to support her family.

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Janelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Janelle works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janelle is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Janelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha’s group live in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jailane

texts.en:
She is 34 years old, married and has five children. She is a resident of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She availed a loan from Gata Daku MPC for additional capital for her sari-sari store.

Her future plan is to extend her business in order to gain more profits and to sustain the needs of their children.

loans.use: To purchase goods and grocery items as additional stock.

loans.name: Nyota Kinyamwezi Group

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has three schooling children.

She has been running a food-vending business famously known as a "mama lishe" for six years. She works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restore the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe food store.

She dreams of expanding her business into a restaurant.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, Nyota Kinyamwezi, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore out-of-stock items in her mama lishe food store.

loans.name: Andrew Baine

texts.en:
Andrew is a man from Kamwenge, Uganda. He has become a Hofokam borrower requesting for a loan facility of 2,000,000shs to buy more cows to sell. He is a married father and takes care of his six children and his wife. He started this business mainly to increase his household income since he is the only one capable of earning to take care of the family.

With the little extra money he gets from farming, Andrew is unable to buy more cows for the coming festive season.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a widowed mother of four and lives in her own house with solar energy but no piped water. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. 
Bahati is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Bahati is requesting a loan of 8000 Kes. to purchase a solar panel. She also aspires to buy a cooler box to preserve her groceries.

Bahati says her greatest monthly expense is medication for her mother and joined Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson a married man with children is requesting a loan to buy fish to sell. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he grows cocoa, which is the major economic activity for people in this area and he operates a stall where he sells fish and cassava flour in the market.

He acquired starting capital from the cocoa business and has no regrets about starting his business because he has been able to achieve a lot through paying school fees for the children and starting up the building of his residential house.

Edson dreams of formalizing his marriage through introducing his wife by paying dowry and wedding her, plus completing his house, though he lacks enough capital to do so.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis moved to Nairobi 18 years ago in search of a better life for himself, his wife and their three children. He settled in Mukuru Kwa Reuben, where he has established several income-generating businesses such as 18 rental units. One of the challenges Willis faces in his business is high turnover of the tenants, owing to lack of toilet amenities in his premises. His tenants often use neighborhood toilets which are not easily accessible, particularly at night.

Willis is determined to change this situation for his tenants. He desires to restore cleanliness at his plot and also provide an accessible sanitary toilet option for his tenants. In the long run, it will be a solution to the high turnover rate among tenants. He is therefore looking for financing to acquire one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas is a resident of Nakuwadde-Lubya and an innovative and hardworking lady who is business-minded. She operates a restaurant and retail shop and sells different food stuffs in one of the biggest markets in Kampala.

Evas has a dream of expanding her business, most especially boosting up the restaurant in Nakuwadde. However, capital is her limiting factor. It is upon that background that she has approached UGAFODE for a loan facility of UGX3,000,000, and she is grateful that it will help her meet her goals if she receives this amount.

Pictured is Evas and her husband in the shop.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food to boost restaurant sales

loans.name: Tirta Kusuma Group

texts.en:
The Tirta Kusuma group was able to pay off their loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeded in maintaining their pigs. Beside being controlled by the Field Officer, they also were visited by the Vet regularly. That’s why the pigs grew well, but the group is a little bit disapointed because the price for pigs is really low this month in their area. This month, most of the breeders sold their pigs, which makes the price low. But they keep up their spirit to manage the business.

I Gusti Nyoman, as the head, is responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintained three pigs for fattening and sold out. Although this period she hasn’t earned a satisfactory profit, she will still continue the business and expects another loan from MUK.

This is the fourth loan for Tirta Kusuma group. One member couldn't attend the meeting. They borrowed a new loan to continue the business. Although the last period their pigs weren't sold for a good price, they still keep up their spirit to run this business. They hope this period will be better. The vet suggested they give the pigs more nutrious feed and vitamins.

I Gusti Nyoman will use her loan to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed. She hopes she can earn more profit this time and will use all the profit for savings.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feeds.

loans.name: Nera

texts.en:
Nera is 43 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. Nera works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nera has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Nera would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 51 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y reside junto a su esposa y un nieto en una comunidad de Villanueva, Cortes. El inició con un negocio de pulpería para vender productos alimenticios, pero hace 3 años decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y perfumería, esta mercadería la vende en su casa. Está solicitando la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como ser ropa, sandalias, zapatos y perfumes. El ha invertido varios prestamos para su negocio. Con el actual conseguirá aumentar sus ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de la familia, y podrá lograr su meta de comprar un vehículo para el trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. He has two children and lives with his wife and grandson in a community in Villanueva, Cortes. He opened a grocery store in order to sell food, but he decided three years ago to dedicate himself to selling clothing, shoes and perfume. He sells the merchandise from his home.

He is requesting 10,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of merchandise to supply his business such as clothing, sandals, shoes, and perfumes. He has invested several loans into his business. He will use this loan to increase earnings to cover the needs of his family, and to be able to reach his goal of buying a vehicle for the work.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, and clothing to supply his business in order to make sales.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 46 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Clara works very hard to provide for them.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Clara has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lorline

texts.en:
Lorline is 55 years old and married with two children.

Lorline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Lorline has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from direct selling.

Lorline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Mwanajuma has operated a coconut and cashew nuts business for over six years now, selling to the buyers at Mombasa market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more coconut and cashew nuts supplies for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut and cashew nuts supplies for resale

loans.name: Apu Condorsencca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CONDORSENCCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Perpetua tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda .Es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a cultivar tubérculos productos como papa, zanahorias y yuca. Con esta actividad sale adelante y desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y junto con su familia progresar.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar abono y semillas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.
Los socios están contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito otorgado y aseguran que eso les impulsa más en su diario vivir.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank Apu Condorsencca. This bank is located in the Paucartambo district belonging to the Paucartambo province and Cusco department.

Perpetua is a 58 year old widow. She is an entrepreneur dedicated to growing root crops such as potatoes, carrots, and yuca. She is getting ahead with her work and she wants to have a better quality of life and progress along with her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

The other members work in businesses such as animal sales, livestock, grocery stores, and agriculture.

The members are happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for granted loans and attest that motivates them most in their daily lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, 34, is a vegetable trader. She is married and has been blessed with three children whose ages are between 15 and 3 years old. Dina sells carrots, pumpkin, celery, chayote, scallions, etc. at a local market. Once a week Dina restocks her selling supplies from local farmers. She has to provide IDR 1,500,000 to buy those things and will get a profit of about 300,000 to 400,000 IDR. This business profit has helped her to support her family income including schooling expenses of two children.

Last month, Dina used her business capital for her children's tuition fees. Therefore she ran out of capital. This situation has led her to apply for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 1,750,000. She will spend the loan on 50 kg of carrots, chayote and so on.

loans.use: to pay for 50 kg of carrots, chayote, scallions and so on

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en:
Daisy Mae is 30 years old and has two children. With one of her children in school, Daisy Mae works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Daisy Mae has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nheb's Group

texts.en: Nheb’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nheb makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Seinoun's Group

texts.en: Seinoun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seinoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yam's Group

texts.en: Yam’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yam makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en: Phea’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tình's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tình is 56 years old and is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for five years. Tình lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

In 2011, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tình is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group. Tình has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Tình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, Tình hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a farmer within his local community. He is 60 years old and married, with two children. Arthur is a responsible father to his two children and three grandchildren, and a loving husband to his wife.

He has been doing his farming business for 45 years. According to Arthur, he devotes most of his time doing farming activities to be able to have a plentiful harvest.

Arthur would like to have continuous growth of his farming business. That's the reason why he's asking for financial assistance, amounting to PHP 15,000. He will use this loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide. He is hoping to avail himself of his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for continuous improvement of his rice-farming business.

loans.name: Mary Gane

texts.en:
Mary Gane is a 38-year-old married woman from Silanga, Tangub City. She has two children. Mary Gane helps her spouse, who is a mason/carpenter, in looking after the welfare of their family. While her husband works, she looks after her sari-sari store business.

She is asking for a loan to expand and increase her inventory. She will use it to buy in bulk soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings. Mary Gane is confident that with good management, financial awareness and perseverance, she is on the way to a successful business. It is her dream to give her family a decent home. Once she can save enough, she plans to make improvements in her house to make it bigger and more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase milk,sugar, soft drinks, canned goods etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 35 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care, and other groceries.

Edna has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal  product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Marjorie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Donna Ivy

texts.en:
Donna Ivy is 30 years old, with three children. With two children in school, Donna Ivy works very hard to provide for them.

Donna Ivy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Donna Ivy has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Donna Ivy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 48 years old and married with nine children. Six of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Arlyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

Arlyn has been raising ducks for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emma has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fruits to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 60 years old now.

Erlinda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of vegetable to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Sub Group B

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader, and she is 32 years old. She is married with two children aged four and seven years.

The group is called Twisungane Sub Group B; Twisungane means “Solidarity” in English. The members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to make more profits and hence have a better future.

Claudine is a tailor and has been running this business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tailoring materials which include fabric and threads in order to make more finished clothes and make more profits.

With the profits from the business, she would like to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials and hence make many clothes to sell.

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh is 62 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising pigs for eight years. Minh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. In addition, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Minh faces is a lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of Minh's Group, which consists of five members. With her business profit, Minh hopes to build a new house, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 38 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Lorena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, hot dogs, sausage, bamboo sticks and other ingredients for her food production business.

Lorena has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, hot dogs, sausage, bamboo sticks and other ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Pich is a 45-year-old married mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice and fishing. They earn about USD11 per day and can save about USD6 each day for future needs. Pest is the main challenge to her rice farming business.

This is the second time for her with VisionFund; past loan has enabled her to improve her living condition. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy a water pumping machine and organic fertilizer to improve farmland. She hopes to get more rice yields to keep improving living standard and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine and organic fertilizer to improve farmland and send her children to school. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lidis Ester

texts.es: Lidis es una mujer de 42 años que sufrió una situación de desplazamiento en compañía de su familia; su cónyuge y sus tres hijas de 23, 20 y 17 años.  Ella se incorporó a un programa de desplazados y fue capacitada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el oficio de Panadería para que nuevamente rehiciera su vida, sin embargo posteriormente tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar al SENA y estudiar algo más a fin con sus intereses y tomo clases de modistería y hoy en día cuenta con 15 años de experienciaen este arte. Ella habita con su familia en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y en esta localidad se encuentra su clientela,conformada en su gran mayoría por vecinos, amigos, conocidos y familiares. Su taller está ubicado en su vivienda y su horario de atención es todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Ella confecciona ropa a la medida y también ofrece servicio de clínica de ropa. Lidis realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas, hilos, botones y cremalleras, necesarias en la elaboración de las prendas de vestir. La meta de Lidis es ampliar sus confecciones y ofrecer un excelente porvenir a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Lidis is a 42 year old woman. She, along with her husband and three daughters aged 23, 20, 17 suffered a displacement situation. She joined a program for the displaced and was trained in the bakery trade by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she could start a new life. However, later she took the opportunity of joining Sena [National Service of Learning] to study something more in line with her interests. She took dressmaking classes and today she has more than 15 years experience in this art.

She lives with her family in a neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad and she finds her customers here. They are mostly neighbors, friends, acquaintances and relatives.

Her workshop is located in her home and she works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She makes clothing to fit and also offers her services to provide alterations.

Lidis has made an application for a Kiva loan, as a way to link to the world of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers which are necessary when making clothing. Lidis’s goal is to expand her creations and offer an excellent future to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Brenda Noemy

texts.es: Brenda es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la crianza de conejos, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de sacar adelante a su familia con ese apoyo. Ella tiene 18 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus padres y su hermano. Con mucho esfuerzo Brenda, ha mejorado su vivienda, pero el techo de esta se encuentra deteriorado, por lo anterior ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: clavos, alambre, madera, entre otros materiales para mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Brenda is a young entrepreneur who has worked raising rabbits for two years. She feels happy that she can help her family succeed with her work.

She is 18 years old and lives in a house on her property together with her parents and her brother. With a lot of effort, Brenda has improved her home, but the roof is deteriorating.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase nails, wire, wood, and other materials to improve the roof of her home.

loans.use: to purchase nails, wire, wood, and other materials to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Mosoq Allpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Kelly es una persona trabajadora y dedicada, ella es psicóloga y trabaja en una institución educativa.la socia  tiene 29 años y las ganas de seguir adelante aportando sus conocimientos. El sueño de la socia es tener un consultorio  propio donde pueda brindar su experiencia y conocimientos a sus pacientes de mejor manera.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar cursos de capacitación de psicología. 

La socia que esta atrás de la fotografía de cabello rojo es tímida y no quiso salir en la toma de imagen Y la otra socia que esta adjunta a la fotografía grupal pidió permiso para llegar tarde a su reunión por eso se le tomo la imagen después.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de computadoras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurante.
Los socios están contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA porque confían en ellos.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Mosoq Allpa" communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Member Kelly is a hardworking and dedicated person.  She is a psychologist and works at an educational institution.  She is 29 years old and her desire to move forward contributes to her expertise.  Her dream is to have her own office where she could better provide her patients with her experience and knowledge.
She requests this loan to pay for training courses in psychology.  

The red-headed member in the back of the photo is shy and did not want to appear in the picture, and the member whose photo is attached to the group photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting and was therefore photographed afterwards.
The other members make a living from their businesses in clothing sales, computer sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.  The members are happy and thankful for KIVA's investors because they believe in them.

loans.use: to pay for training courses in psychology

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florencia is 52 years old.

Florencia has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marinil

texts.en:
Marinil is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Marinil works very hard to provide for them.

Marinil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marinil has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marinil would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olinda, vive con sus hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de su comunidad y dependen económicamente de ella, Olinda se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos naturales; este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su mamá pero luego ella se independizo y ahora ya tiene 7 años de atender su propio negocio y lo hace de Lunes a Sábado de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. 
Olinda solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollo, verduras, azúcar, platos, utensilios, leña, gas propano, etc., esto le ayudara a poder aprovechar la temporada navideña por ende generara mayores ingresos que le ayudaran a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
El sueño de Olinda es poder alcanzar una vida más estable para su familia, poder ampliar su negocio y darles estudios superiores a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olinda lives with her children who are studying in the community school and who are financially dependent on her. Olinda makes a living selling food and natural soft drinks. She learned the trade thanks to her mom but later became independent. She has now been looking after her own business for seven years and she does it from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. 

Olinda is requesting the loan to invest in buying chicken, vegetables, sugar, plates, utensils, firewood, propane gas, etc. She is doing so to be able to take advantage of the Christmas season. And, as a result she will generate a larger income that will help her give a better quality of life to her children.

Olinda’s dream is to be able to reach a more stable life for her family and to expand her business and give her children higher education.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, sugar, plates, utensils, firewood, propane gas, etc. This will help her take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 42, is a married woman who is blessed with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in Tbaung Khmum province where she and her husband grow cassava. They have made a living this way for 24 years. Touch also sells some grocery items for additional income.

This will be the second cycle for her with VisionFund, and her past loan has enabled her to own a plot of farmland and send her children to school. She is the leader of her group of two members, and will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve her crop yields. The loan portion left over will be used to buy school supplies for her school-aged children.

She hopes to generate more income to build a new house and to keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields so that she can build a new house and keep her children in school.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 36 years old and married with five children. With all five children in school, Melita works very hard to provide for them.

Melita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Melita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Melita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Johan Jesús

texts.es: Johan es un joven de 27 años que decidió continuar con la microempresa de su padre, él realiza curvas de acometidas para redes eléctricas, cuyo proceso consiste en el corte y doblaje de tubos en PVC, los cuales quedan listos para su distribución a ferreterías del municipio de Barranquilla. Johan hace 7 años asumió la administración del negocio de su padre con óptimos resultados y en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar tubos plásticos para realizar su producción sin contratiempos. Con esta inversión obtendrá descuentos por volúmenes en compras y sus utilidades serán mucho mayores. Él es soltero y sus proyectos a futuro son remodelar la vivienda de sus padres y competir con calidad, precio y buen servicio.
texts.en:
Johan is a 27 year old youth who decided to continue his father’s microenterprise. He makes tubing for power supply connections. The process consists of cutting and bending PVC pipes which are ready for distribution to the Barranquilla municipality hardware stores.

Seven years ago Johan took over the management of the business from his father with excellent results. Currently he is making a Kiva loan application as a way to link himself to the world of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

He will buy plastic tubes so that his production will go smoothly. He will use this investment to obtain volume discounts on purchases so his profits will be much higher. He is single and his future projects are to remodel his parents’ house and compete with quality, price, and good service.

loans.use: to buy plastic tubes

loans.name: Morina

texts.en:
Morina is 31 years old and married with six children. With four of her children in school, Morina works very hard to provide for her family.

Morina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Morina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Morina would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y nuevamente solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de maíz y leña para la temporada de verano, de esta manera ahorra en la adquisición de materia prima y podrá seguir trabajando.
Con el crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente Juana pudo reconstruir una ramada donde ella tiene su tortillería. Las condiciones de vida de Juana y la estabilidad económica del negocio se mantienen, ya que ahora vende más tortillas y eso le ha ayudado a cubrir gastos personales y ha podido ayudarle al esposo en los gastos de medicina para su salud.
texts.en:
Juana works making tortillas. She is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and firewood for the summer season, so she can save on purchasing primary materials and continue working.

With her previous loan, Juana was able to rebuild a shelter where she makes her tortillas. Juana's living conditions and the financial state of her business remain stable, since she is selling more tortillas, which has helped her cover her personal coasts and help her husband with the costs of medicines for his health.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for the summer season, so she can save on purchasing primary materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 41 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Elizabeth has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Los Angeles De Huayllacocha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LOS ANGELES DE HUAYLLACOCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia María es una socia trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de granos y tubérculos actividad que lo realiza en el mercado y en las ferias que se realizan por su localidad, con esta actividad aporta en su hogar.la socia tiene 45 años y 4 hijos con quienes sale adelante para un mejor futuro.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar maíz y papa al por mayor, para venderlo luego por kilos.

la socia que esta adjunta en la fotografía grupal pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de estudios.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.
Los socios están contentos y agradecidos por el crédito que le otorgaron los inversionistas de KIVA y se comprometen a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “VIRGEN DE LOS ANGELES DE HUAYLLACOCHA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Huarocondo, which belongs to the province of Anta, Cusco department.

María is a hard-working member who works selling grains and root vegetables. She does this in the markets in her locality and with this activity she supports her household. She is 45 years old and has four children who she is getting ahead for a better future.

María is requesting the loan to buy corn and potatoes wholesale to later sell by the kilogram.

The member who has her photo attached to the group photo asked permission to arrive late due to her studies.

The other members work in businesses selling animals, raising livestock, a grocery store and agriculture.

The members are happy and grateful for the loan granted them by the lenders at Kiva and promise to pay their installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn and potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming coconuts. Jean is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell for her business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Julio se dedica a su negocio de transportista, el trabaja en una empresa privada dando servicio en todo el departamento del Cusco. El socio desea independizarse y trabajar con su vehículo para poder tener mejores ingresos.
El socio solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos para su vehículo como llantas y aceite de carro, así podrá brindar mejor su servicio.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

Los socios están agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ellos y ayudarles para llegar a sus metas.
texts.en:
The Inmaculada Concepcion de Pacca community bank is located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Julio is a member of the community bank and works in transportation. He works at a private business providing service for the entire department of Cusco. He wants to become independent and work with his vehicle in order to have a better income.

He is requesting this loan to purchase parts for his vehicle like tires and motor oil so he will be able to provide better service.

The other group members work selling food, farming, selling groceries, and selling animals. They are grateful to the Kiva lenders for continuing to trust them and help them achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase tires and motor oil.

loans.name: Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She has operated a food stall selling fish sauce for more than 10 years. Hoa lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to make fish sauce for sale. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Smile group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make fish sauce for sale

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other snack foods.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other snack foods.

loans.name: Rezzy Mae

texts.en:
Rezzy Mae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rezzy Mae is 26 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rezzy Mae has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rezzy Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and materials for the boat repair.

Rezzy Mae has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and materials for the boat repair.

loans.name: Claudia Maribel

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer admirable que vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, además de dos hermanas. Ella cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, la cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, además gracias a la cantidad de clientes que buscan sus productos. La pared de su vivienda, se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que ella ha decidido reconstruirla, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para construir la pared de su vivienda de bajareque y hacer otras mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Claudia is an admirable woman who lives with her life partner and her two children aged 7 and 2, and also with two of her sisters. She owns a store that sells household staples. This allows her to get her family ahead with a great deal of effort and dedication, and also thanks to the numerous customers who seek her products. The wall of her house is in a rundown state, which is why she has decided to rebuild it. That's the reason she requests a loan from FUSAI so that she can build the wall of her wattle and daub house and do other home improvements.

loans.use: to build the wall of her wattle and daub house and do other home improvements.

loans.name: Mouserat

texts.en:
Mouserat is 59 years old and married with four adult-age children from Pagadian City. She is a rice farmer; that is her primary source of income. She has been into this type of business for a long time, even before she got married.

She has expanded her rice farming and has produced bulk rice grains. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC through the loan program intended for farmers like her.

The amount that she borrowed shall be used to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tabassum

texts.en:
Tabassum is a 45-year-old woman and mother to three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home, as she is a responsible housewife.

Her husband provides services by painting buildings, shops and houses. In this regard, her husband is in need of some painting-related inventory, such as paints of different colors, brushes, distemper, etc., so as to increase his orders. For this reason, Tabassum contacted the Kiva program through BRAC Pakistan for a loan.

Tabassum is very much thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's painting buiness.

loans.name: Yoneila

texts.es: Yoneila es una microempresaria de 56 años que habita en compañía de su familia en un barrio al Sur de Barranquilla, ella vende prendas de vestir y accesorios, actividad que inició hace 15 años  y sus principales clientes son sus amigos, vecinos y referidos. Todos los días de la semana promueve ventas directamente en las residencias de sus clientes, ella maneja un variado surtido de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. La temporada decembrina es la de mayor demanda del año y para cubrir los requerimientos de sus clientes, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar nuevas colecciones de ropa: blusas, vestidos, jeans, bermudas y demás. Su meta a futuro es tener un almacén y terminar de remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en: Yoneila is a microentrepreneur. She's 56 years old and lives with her family in a neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla. She sells garments and accessories, a business she started 15 years ago. Her main customers are her friends, neighbors and referrals. She makes sales directly at her customers' homes every day of the week. She sells a diverse assortment of women's, men's and children's apparel. December is the season with the highest demand of the year and, as a way to meet her customers' orders, she requested a Kiva loan. It's an opportunity for her to have a link to the financial community of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can purchase new collections of clothing: blouses, dresses, jeans, bermudas and etc. Her goal for the future is to own a grocery store and finish remodeling her house.

loans.use: to purchase new collections of clothes: blouses, dresses, jeans, bermudas, etc.

loans.name: Riverside Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ann. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a member of Riverside Young Mothers’ Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She operates a grocery store, where she sells fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, cabbages, carrots, oranges and kale. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to her grocery shop so as to meet her customers' demands. This will enable her to earn more income that will help her provide basic needs for her family such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her grocery store and meet customer demand to gain more income to provide for her family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Merlyn Cy

texts.en:
Merlyn Cy is a farmer from Pagadian city. She is 57 years old, married, with three children of school age.

She avails various loans from Paglaum MPC to head up the next cropping season.

She avails a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Morning Star Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Florence. She is 32 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children. She is a member of Morning Star Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014, and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She does maize, beans and millet farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds. This will enable her improve on production hence more income.

She will use the anticipated income to pay the education fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds that will increase production hence more income to pay education fees for her children.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
NAZIA is 35-year-old lady; she is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband owns a workshop where he provides services to maintain cars; he is professional in his techniques and can easily fix cars in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the fix. A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, due to the relocation, some important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

NAZIA requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to compensate against this loss. He will buy repairing tools, spare parts, tires, break shoes, etc for his car repairing workshop.

She wants to provide a better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase.

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy car repairing tools, spare parts, tires and break shoes for her husband's workshop.

loans.name: Hermes Manuel

texts.es:
Hermes con 41 años de edad,de estado civil padre soltero,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su menor hijo, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto comerciales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor,resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación se encuentra en espigas florales y buen estado fitosanitario,contando a la fecha con 4 hectáreas,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 06 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.

Hermes es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firma sólo.
texts.en:
Hermes is a 41-year-old single father. He lives in his own rustic house with his minor son in
in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. He has very good business and work references from area residents. Locals work primarily in agriculture, business, and ranching.

Hermes works in agriculture, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee, which is resistant to diseases and infestations. His plantation, currently 4 hectares, is flowering and healthy. He has six years of industry experience. In addition, he raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and others) and grows basic food crops (yucca, bananas, taro).

The purpose of the loan is to invest in maintaining and growing one hectare of coffee in production, ensuring good production in the 2016 season. This will be reflected in a greater volume of sales and thus a higher income and better quality of life for himself and his family.

Hermes is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. Sole signatory.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining and growing one hectare of coffee in production.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vergenia is 57 years old and has three children who are still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Vergenia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Vergenia has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson wants to thank Kiva for the previous loan, which helped him purchase more medicine for his clinic. This helped him provide affordable and quality healthcare, hence more income. He used the income to provide for his family's basic needs, as well as paying education fees for his children.

He is borrowing an additional Kiva loan to purchase additional medical supplies to continue offering quality medical services to his patients. This will enable him earn more income to continue supporting his children's education.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the continuous financial support. He promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the clinic, leading to more income to pay education fees for his children.

loans.name: Sardalkan

texts.ru: Сардалкан, 44 года, не замужем, есть сын. У Сардалкан высшее образование, она работает в школе преподавателем. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Сардалкан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 8 овец, лощадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сардалкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличение поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sardalkan is 44 years old, not married, and has a son. Sardalkan has a post-secondary education, and she works in a school as an instructor. As an additional source of income for her family, she raises animals, which she began doing 8 years ago. Thanks to Sardalkan's very hard work, she now has 2 cows, 8 sheep, and a horse. Her monthly profit is 11,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Sardalkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 105,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase the size of her herd. She plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Dieujuste

texts.fr: Dieujuste a 48 ans. Marié, il est père de trois enfants. Il a mis sur pied une petite pharmacie dans son quartier. Cela fait déjà huit ans qu’il tient ce petit commerce. Il demande ce prêt afin de pouvoir acheter un nouveau stock de médicaments.
texts.en: Dieujuste is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. He launched a small pharmacy in his neighborhood. He has been running it for eight years already. He is requesting this loan in order to restock medications.

loans.use: to restock medications.

loans.name: Kenzhebu

texts.ru: Кенжебу, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем младших классов в школе. Также Кенжебу в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодня есть 6 коров, 16 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Кенжебу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Кенжебу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kenzhebu is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a college education and teaches primary school. To earn supplementary income she also raises livestock. Thanks to her hard work she now has six cows and 16 sheep. With the goal of further developing her business she contacted Bai Tushum Bank asking for a 70,000 som (KGS) loan to buy calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy some calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ulpat

texts.ru: Улпат погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Улпат на сегодняшний день имеет 6 коров, 7 овец. На 1,54 Га выращивает арбузы, кукурузу, огурцы. Ежемесячная прибыль Улпат составляет 7,800 сом (KGS). Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и разведения. Доходы от кредита Улпат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Ulpat repaid her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is grateful to Kiva and all those who helped with the financing. Ulpat today owns six cows and seven sheep. She grows watermelon, corn, and cucumbers on 1.54 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 7,800 som (KGS). She is coming to Bai Tushum Bank again for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to invest income from the loan into further development of the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and expanding her herd.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат, 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, около 7 лет работает в Войсковой части. Ежемесячная заработная плата около 12,000 сом (KGS). Нурзат решила отремонтировать и утеплить ее дом. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух пластиковых окон и двери. Данные мероприятия позволят сэкономить на оплате за отопление и позаботиться о здоровье ее еще маленьких детей. В ближайших планах Нурзат – приобрести столь необходимый для ее семьи автомобиль.
texts.en: Nurzat is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She has a college education and has worked for the military for around seven years. Her monthly income is about 12,000 som (KGS). Nurzat decided to remodel and improve her house. She contacted Bai Tushum Bank for a 30,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two plastic windows and doors. This will allow her to save money on heating and keep her children healthy. Her future plans include obtaining a much needed car for her family.

loans.use: to buy two plastic windows and doors in order to insulate her house.

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингул, 42 года, вдова, 3 детей. У Эркингул средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи уже 10 лет занимается торговлей, начинала с продажи плетенных изделий, но после смерти мужа, перепрофилировала торговлю на национальную резиновую обувь (галоши) и тапочки. Есть товар в обороте на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). Эркингул решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en:
Erkingul is 42 years old, a widow, and the mother of three. She has finished technical college. Her neighbors speak very hghly of her. As a main source of income for her family, Erkingul has been working as a vendor for 10 years. She started by selling wicker items, but after her husband passed away she changed her line of business and started selling traditional galoshes (rubber shoes) and slippers. She maintains a stock of merchandise worth 150,000 KGS. 

Erkingul has decided to develop her business and applied to the Bai Tushum Bank for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to increase her sales volume. The revenues from this loan will allow her to improve her family's life conditions and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to increase the turnover of rubber shoes and slippers in her shop.

loans.name: Kam's Group

texts.en:
Kam is 26 years old. She is married and has three dependent sons, one of whom is in school, and two of whom are under school age. She lives in Tbaung Khmum Province, where cassava and rice have been grown as the main source of income for eight years. 

Sometimes Kam works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Weeds, which overgrow on her cassava farmland, often cause her cassava crop to produce lower-than-expected outputs. 

Kam has decided to lead a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizer. She hopes that her cassava crop will return abundant yields, so that she can keep sending her children to school and upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 23-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He drives his rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very heavily populated area. A while ago he was involved in a road accident. He was looking for passengers by standing beside the road when a speedy car collapsed his rickshaw from behind. He did not suffer any fractures, but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged, and is now in need of replacement. 

Samina's husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw body, but he is short by some amount. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy a new body for his auto rickshaw.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband so he can compensate against his accidental lost.

loans.name: Journalyn

texts.en:
Journalyn wants to fulfill her dreams by sending her younger sibling to school to finish a degree. 

It is now a new school year, and Journalyn is in need of an amount of money to pay the school fees of her younger sibling. 

Journalyn has big dreams of helping her family and her siblings as well. This is the reason why she works hard on her chosen business.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her younger sibling.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting.  She is earning a good income. Thelma has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Thelma has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Thelma hopes to purchase another piece of land to cultivate rice that will potentially add additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 56 years old and married with four children. Vicky works very hard to provide for them.

Vicky runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, coffee, sugar, spices, milk, and other snack foods.

Vicky has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Vicky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, coffee, sugar, spices, milk, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, drinks, eggs, candles, shampoo and other snack foods.

Amalia has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Amalia aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nenge Ngunenge S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in this photo is Diana. She is 24 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand and has so far benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

Diana engages in poultry keeping and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more poultry so as to expand her poultry farming business. This will enable her to meet the rising demands for eggs and chicken in her locality, hence providing her with an increased income. She will therefore be better able to cater for her family’s expenses, such as education fees, food and clothing.

Diana is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is a married woman living with her husband and their three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013, and has benefited from enterprise development training.

Hellena operates a vegetable selling business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to her business. This will help her to meet her customers' demands, and hopefully earn more income to provide food and clothing for her family.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to add stock to her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.ru: Айтбубу, 56 лет, замужем, есть 3 сына и дочь. У Айтбубу среднее образование, уже 15 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Супруг предоставляет услуги пассажирских перевозок. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айтбубу на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет чуть больше 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Айтбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 нетелей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Aitbubu is 56 years old, married, and has three sons and a daughter. She has a secondary education and has been earning the primary income for her family for the past 15 years by raising livestock. Her husband is a taxi driver. Thanks to her tireless work she now owns two cows and two sheep. Her monthly income is over 25,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Aitbubu asked Bai Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy three heifers. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her livestock herd and saving for improvements to the family's housing.

loans.use: to buy three heifers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 35 лет, вдова, 3 детей. Образование- высшее, работает учителем в школе. Также уже 7 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулзады имеется 3 коровы, 12 овец. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи и вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulzada is 35 years old, a widow and has three children. She has a college education and is now a school teacher. She has also raised livestock for seven years, and currently owns three cows and 12 sheep. She is asking Bai Tushum bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy four heifers to expand her herd. Income from use of the loan will allow her to improve her family's wellbeing and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase four heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount and to help bolster her income

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married lady blessed with 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She operates a cereals shop where she sells things like rice and beans. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock for her cereal shop so she can meet her customers’ demands. She hopes this will increase her income which she will use to pay for education fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her cereals shop to meet customers' demands and generate more income to pay for education fees for her children.

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 22 years old and married with four children. She has had her retail business selling fish for three years, and is planning to hire more workers in the future.  

Hương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her income is lower than the national average, and moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. Hương has no collateral because she can't get a loan from banks or credit institutions. The main hardship she faces is lack of capital.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in order to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution so far. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hương is a reputable person in her community, and the leader of her solidarity group. With her profits, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Khushbaht

texts.en:
Khushbaht was born in Tajikistan. He is a very smart and hardworking man. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. 

Khushbaht is a student of the 4th course. He studies well, and he learns politics. He also works after class as a mechanic, because he must feed his family. 

Khushbaht is asking for a loan of 2,300 TJS to pay for his university tuition. He works and studies hard for the well-being of his future. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Suriaya

texts.en:
Suriaya is 40 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Suriaya and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work from her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Suriaya wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her elder daughter so that she can generate income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Suriaya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new Juki sewing machine for her daughter. She wants to save so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Suriaya thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for her daughter so she can also contribute to their monthly income.

loans.name: Ngaeka Mwaeka W.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John. He is thirty five years old, married, and a father of two children. He is a member of Ngaeka Mwaeka W.G which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

He does vegetable farming. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will consequently increase his produce and therefore increase his income. He will use the anticipated income to pay education fees for his children.

John is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to increase produce and generate additional income to pay education fees for his children.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 43-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets and materials for boat repair.

Elsie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran, aged 47, has been involved in an embroidered cloth-selling business for about 10 years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market and then sells it to the people of her local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

Winter is coming soon, and she wants to buy clothes for the new season.

Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season. She will be taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales.
