Sughran hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. 

She thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of winter season clothing that she can resell from her home.

loans.name: Love The Sea Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, and moreover her region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. She has no collateral because she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

Hồng has had a retail business selling dry food for 6 years. She is a reputable person in the community and is the leader of her solidarity group. The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In 2011, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 4 loans from them.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She is planning to hire more workers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 62-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonila has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and materials for boat repair. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and married with four children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and other snack foods.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Alicia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 52-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in their household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruit. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or need for medical treatment for her children.

Naseem hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and that she will save a reasonable amount soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pig-pens.

Julieta has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and to repair her pig-pens.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, maize, beans and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the loan of 21,000 KES to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice and cereals. Her business goal is to have a well stocked shop within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Kathrina

texts.en:
Kathrina is 27 years old and married with two children. Kathrina works very hard to provide for them.

Kathrina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and personal care products to sell.

Kathrina has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Kathrina would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rodella works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products retailing business in the Philippines. Rodella is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of personal care products to sell.

Rodella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.fr: Rosenie, 35 ans, est divorcée. Elle a un enfant qui est régulièrement scolarisé. Pour payer la scolarisation de son enfant et répondre aux autres besoins quotidiens. Elle revend des sandales. Elle souhaite agrandir cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Rosenie is thirty-five years old and divorced. She has one child who attends school regularly. She works selling sandals and uses her earnings to pay for the education of her child and provide for their other day-to-day expenses.

Rosenie would like to expand her business so she has requested this loan to increase her stock levels.

loans.use: to increase her stock levels of sandals.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo was born in 1973. He is the married parent of 3 children. Rahmatullo’s wife is Tahmina. She is a very kind woman and she always helps her husband with all things. Rahmatullo has been busy with business for more than 15 years. He buys food items in bulk and retails them to a food shop which is situated near the house they live in. Rahmatullo has a great experience in this field and periodically renews the assortment of his goods. Rahmatullo always tries for the well-being of his children. Now, he is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition of his son as his son is a student in the first year. Rahmatullo and his son await your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Janine

texts.fr: Janine est âgée de 29 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux 2 enfants à charge. Ses enfants sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle tient une petite épicerie où elle revend des produits alimentaires variés. Elle Prend les crédits à chaque fois qu’elle a besoin d’augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Janine is twenty-nine years old and lives with her partner. She has two children in her care and they both attend school regularly. She runs a small grocer's stall selling a selection of food products.

Janine works with the field partner and their loans whenever she needs to increase her stock levels.

loans.use: to increase her stock levels of food products.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr: Helene a 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui commence à peine sa scolarisation. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques. C’est ainsi qu’elle se débrouille pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle a demandé ce prêt pour acheter un stock de lotion de beauté.
texts.en:
Helene is thirty-three years old and married. She has one child who has just started attending school. She works selling cosmetic products and uses her earnings to take care of her family.

Helene has requested this loan to increase her stock levels of beauty creams and lotions.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beauty creams and lotions.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Lucienne, 46 ans, est revendeuse de sucreries et de boissons alcoolisées depuis sept ans. Son rêve et de faire progresser son activité. Elle a demandé ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de sucreries. A l’avenir, elle compte ouvrir un compte d’épargne.
texts.en:
Lucienne is forty-six years old and has been selling sweets and alcoholic drinks for seven years. Her dream is to expand and improve her business.

Lucienne has requested this loan to buy sacks of sweets. In the future she would like to be able to open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweets for sale.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.fr: Mirlande est propriétaire d’une petite épicerie à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires, des sucreries, des boissons alcoolisées et non alcoolisées. Elle veut prendre ce prêt pour ajouter des sacs de sucre à son épicerie.
texts.en:
Mirlande runs a small grocery store from her home. She sells food products, sweets, soft drinks and alcoholic drinks.

Mirlande has requested this loan so she can buy sacks of sugar to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique a 52 ans. C’est une commerçante qui a plus de 15 ans d’expériences à son actif. Elle a commencé dans le petit commerce depuis qu’elle était adolescente. Aujourd’hui, elle tient un petit commerce de sucreries. Cela lui permet de gagner un peu d’argent pour prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monique is fifty-two years old. She has been a retailer for more than fifteen years. She began selling items when she was still a teenager.

Today, Monique runs a stall selling sweets. This enables her to earn a small amount of money to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock levels of sweets.

loans.name: Ana

texts.fr:
Ana is 55 years old, married and has four children.

Ana is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana would like to save money to expand her business.
texts.en:
Ana is 55 years old, married and has four children.

Ana is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Othelia

texts.fr: Othelia, 43 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des lessives. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle prend des microcrédits qu’elle rembourse toujours correctement. Pour présent crédit, elle va l’utiliser pour acheter produits de lessive.
texts.en:
Othelia is forty-three years old and married. She has three children and sells cosmetic products and washing detergents.

To avoid running out of stock, Othelia takes loans which she always repays correctly and on time. She will use this loan to buy washing detergents.

loans.use: to buy washing detergents.

loans.name: Rose Manette Benoit

texts.fr: Manette est commerçante. Elle revend des boissons diverses et aussi des produits cosmétiques. Grace à cette activité, elle trouve de quoi aider son mari à prendre soin de leurs deux enfants. La famille trouve de quoi manger sans difficulté. Elle demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Manette is a retailer. She sells various types of drinks and cosmetic products. Thanks to this business, she is able to help her husband take care of their two children. The family are able to provide enough for them to eat without any problems.

Manette is requesting this loan to increase her stock of cosmetic products.

loans.use: to increase her stock levels of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une veuve femme  âgée de 29 ans qui vit avec deux enfants à charge. Abla est une revendeuse de condiments résidant à TRokoin. Abla s’approvisionne de ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bassines de piment et des paniers de tomates fraîches en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour pouvoir bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla is twenty-nine years old, widowed and has two children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells food ingredients. She buys her stock three times a month from the market and makes her sales from a stall in front of her home.

Abla is requesting this loan to buy bowls of chillies and baskets of fresh tomatoes to increase her earnings. This will enable her to pay for the schooling of her children and provide for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 9 bowls of chillies and 6 baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: 63 летный дехканин района Джоми, Рахмон. Он ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. Его семья тоже занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Его жена занимается растениеводством. Ей помогает Рахмон. Рахмон отец четверых детей. Его дети взрослые и воспитанные, они уважают и помогают родителям. Рахмон более 30 лет занимается растениеводством.  Он имеет большой земельный участок. Рахмон радуется, когда собирает богатый и качественный урожай. Он хочет, чтобы жители принимали здоровый урожай. Рахмон просит кредит для купли минеральных удобрений. Он хочет обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Рахмон надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahmon is a 63-year-old "dehkan" farmer from the A. Jomi region. He is a responsible and hard-working person. His family also does agricultural work. His wife grows crops, and Rahmon helps her. Rahmon has four children. His children are adults and well brought up, so they respect and help their parents. Rahmon has been a farmer for more than 30 years. He has a large plot of land.

It makes Rahmon very happy when he gathers a rich and good-quality harvest. He wants all local residents to receive a good harvest. Rahmon is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. He wants to cultivate his harvest with the mineral fertilizers. Rahmon hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Barotali

texts.ru: Баротали житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 55 лет, Он хороший муж и справедливый отец. Баротали 15 лет  занимается животноводством и параллельно занимается шофером камаза, перевозит товар. У Баротали есть сын, который в данный момент является студентом.  Баротали делает все возможное, чтобы его сын получил хорошее образование и нашел хорошую работу. Однако в этом году оплатить за учебу сына у Баротали не хватило средств. Надеясь на Вашу доброту и отзывчивость, Баротали обратился к Вам за помощью и надеется, что его запрос не останется не одобренным.
texts.en: Barotali is a resident of the city of Tursunzoda. He is 55 years old, a good husband and a fair father. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years and also works as a Kamaz truck driver, transporting goods. Barotali has a son who is a university student. Barotali is doing everything he can to ensure that his son receives a good education and finds a good job. However, he doesn't have enough money to pay his son's tuition this year. He is hoping for your kindness and generosity and is turning to you for some support. He hopes that his request will be approved.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Vuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuong is a Thai ethnic woman. She joined in the program of M7-MFI five years ago. She currently lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of her family and save a small amount. She wants to invest in her children’s education such as paying for their education fees but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have a better learning condition, bringing them a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 55-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with five children and the youngest child is 15 years old. Her husband is a traffic enforcer while Lucia is engaged in a direct selling business. Lucia wishes to improve this business for her children. She wants them to finish their studies in the future. Thus, she is requesting an amount to help her operate her business continuously. She will use the money for additional capital. She will buy products such as cosmetics, beauty soap, fragrances, lotion, and home care products; such as bathroom cleaner, laundry soap and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy products such as cosmetics, beauty soap, fragrances, lotion, and home care products such as bathroom cleaner, laundry soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 41-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Clarin, Bohol. She is married and the mother of five children; they are 15, 11, 9, 6 and 4 years old. Her husband is a tricycle driver while Nilda runs a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been doing this for two years. Nilda has become proficient in this business and she eagerly wants to continue this business.

The problem is, there are times that her capital is used for other emergency needs such as school fees and bills. For this reason, she needs a loan amount to buy commodities needed for her store. She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice. Thus, Nilda wants, in the future, to enhance her store business for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 44 years old and has nine children. Zosima is widowed and four of her children are still in school.

Zosima is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Zosima requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Zosima has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a woman in her 46th year. She is from Clarin, Bohol, married and has five children. Her oldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is below 10 years old. Her husband is a construction worker while Sylvia is engaged in selling food to their community. She has been doing this business for four years to earn a living. Sylvia and her husband work together to provide enough food for the family.

She is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, noodles, cooking oil and food seasoning. In the future, she wishes to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, noodles, cooking oil and food seasoning

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano con 28 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 08 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, ademas se dedica frutales.

Adriano es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa,a trabajado dos créditos de S/.1000,s/.1500 los cuáles se realizaron con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Adriano, 28 years old and married, lives in a rustic material house of his own along with his wife and his children in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, country of Peru. He has both very good personal and work references by the inhabitants of the area. The people of this town are mostly in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Adriano makes a living in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, with an experience in this line of work of 8 years. He will use the loan that will be granted to him in agricultural work, applications and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers, and manual labor for his crop yields. This way, it will help him in the physiological, morphological, and productive improvement of his crops, as well as having a timely harvest. Therefore, he will have a higher production, a better product quality, which is why he will have no trouble selling his product. He also grows fruit.

Adriano is a reactivated partner for Edpyme Alternativa. He has worked two loans of 1,000 and 1,500 nuevos soles which were conducted with timely payments.

loans.use: in agricultural work, applications and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers, and manual labor for his crop yields.

loans.name: Madhabi's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the right hand side of the photograph is Madhabi. She is an energetic lady and a farmer by profession who works 8 hours a day to earn her living and educate her two sons. She cultivates seasonal vegetables on her small piece of land and she has gained expertise in farming vegetables by being in the profession for the last 10 years. Her husband helps her in the field.

Madhabi, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase seeds, pesticides, organic manures and fertilizers. She will then sell the yield to the market and individuals at wholesale and retail rates and gain a profit amount, which will help her in gaining financial stability and thus upgrade her living standards.

Madhabi is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, organic manures and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kanchan's Group

texts.en:
Kanchan, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a married lady with a daughter in her care. She hails from a village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. Being an artistic woman, from childhood she had an interest in arts and crafts. She used to make oil paintings, paper crafts, and clay statues when she was small. After her marriage, she turned her interest into her profession. She is engaged in making handicraft items like clay statues and soft toys. She supplements her household income by selling her products in a nearby town market.

Kanchan, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase cotton, colorful fabrics, thread, wool, clay, and paint brushes in bulk to increase her volume of output and get a higher return on investment.

Kanchan is eagerly awaiting for your generous help and support.

loans.use: to purchase cotton, colorful fabrics, thread, wool, clay, and paint brushes in bulk.

loans.name: Sushama's Group

texts.en:
Sushama is the lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a small village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. She sells cow's milk for her living and her husband works as an auto rickshaw driver to meet the daily household expenses and pay the school fees of their two daughters. Within this limited income and numerous liabilities, Sushama could not build a hygienic toilet at her home. She and her family trek a long distance to relieve themselves at odd hours, which is not at all safe from a health and safety point of view.

Therefore, Sushama along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it. This loan amount can save her from harmful contagious diseases and promote cleanliness in society.

She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a clean, well equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it.

loans.name: Tapaswini's Group

texts.en:
Tapaswini is a lady with strong willpower and determination, standing in the middle of the photograph. Life was never easy for her. As a humble resident of a small village in Sonepur, Odisha, India, she has endured poverty since her childhood. Her husband works as a grocer in a nearby shop and is responsible for taking care of a family of six. The lack of finances tied the hands of Tapaswini to build a toilet in her house. The absence of a toilet in her house and near her locality compels Tapaswini to walk a long distance to isolated areas to relieve herself. She is tired of following this unsanitary practice.

Therefore, Tapaswini along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean toilet, install a commode and incorporate steel water pipes in it. Access to a toilet will enhance Tapaswini's convenience, safety and hygiene.

Tapaswini is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a clean toilet, install a commode and incorporate steel water pipes in it.

loans.name: Asakara's Group

texts.en:
Asakara is a simple and enterprising lady standing on the extreme right hand side in the photograph. She is married and a blessed mother of two sons and a daughter who is an infant .She is a humble resident of an interior tribal village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. The household income of Asakara is very low. For that reason, she does not have access to a toilet at her home and she is bound to depend upon open fields in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice feasible and safe, as she finds herself open to contagious diseases, animal and insect bites and crimes.

Therefore, Asakara along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it. Access to a toilet will enhance Asakara's convenience, safety and hygiene.

Asakara is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it

loans.name: Lilia Irene

texts.es:
Lilia con 63 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 20 años. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos en mejora de su casa.De esta manera le facilitará a vivir en condiciones óptimas.

Lilia es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the Cayalti district of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru. The locals here mostly work in farming, trade and cattle-raising. Lilia receives good personal and professional references.

Lilia works raising and selling billy goats. She has more than 20 years' experience in this trade. She is applying for a loan in order to carry out repairs in her home. This will allow her to live in the best possible conditions.

Lilia is a new borrower at Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to carry out repairs in her home.

loans.name: Norbil

texts.es:
Norbil con 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cinco hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Norbil es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, no se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
Norbil, aged 29, lives with his wife and five children in the Callayuc district of Cutervo province in Peru's Cajamarca region. He has excellent personal and work references from local residents. The people of the region work mostly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

He works in agriculture, cultivating coffee, and has 10 years' experience in the field. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the maintenance of his farm, which will increase his income.

Norbil is a new client at Edpyme Alternativa, and is unbanked.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo con 57 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera,vive en casa propia, junto a su hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona, Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de la venta de chupetes y refrescos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 6 años, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de un termo para la venta de sus refrescos y chupetes. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Consuelo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 5 préstamos el último a sido de S/.2,000.00 el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Consuelo, aged 57, is a single mother, who lives with her daughter in her own home in the Cayaltí district, which is in the Chiclayo province of Peru's Lambayeque region. She enjoys good personal and work references from local residents. The people of this region work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Consuelo sells popsicles and soft drinks, and has more than 6 years' experience in the field. She is requesting a loan to buy a cooler for selling drinks and popsicles. In this way she hopes to expand her business, increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Consuelo is a return borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. She has had 5 loans, and paid back the last loan (for 2000 Peruvian Soles) promptly.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for selling soft drinks and popsicles.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa con 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, así como cuyes,pavos,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 08 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento para éstos. De esta manera le facilitará a seguir trabajando y así mismo mejorar sus ingresos.

María Teresa es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 37 years old and lives with her children in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, of the Lambayeque department of Peru. The locals here work in farming, trade and cattle-raising. Maria receives good personal and professional references.

Maria works raising and selling pigs, guinea pigs, turkeys and more. She has eight years' experience. She is applying for this loan in order to buy pigs and feed for these same pigs. This will allow her to continue working and increase her income.

Maria is a repeat borrower at Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for these same pigs.

loans.name: Ana Blanca

texts.es: Doña, Ana Blanca de 24 años de edad, Madre soltera, de origen humilde tiene una hija de 3 años de edad que tuvo a los 21 años con una persona que no supo valorar el potencial que tenia ya que en reiteradas ocasiones el esposo le decía que ella solo se tenía que dedicar a cuidar a su hija, esta situación llevo a doña Ana a tomar la decisión de separarse ya que truncaba sus sueños y aspiraciones.  cuenta la señora que a los 2 años de edad el padre la dejo huérfana y fue la madre quien con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a doña Ana, culmino sus estudios en la escuela de Achocalla para posteriormente estudiar una profesión técnica de TÉCNICO MEDIO EN COCINA Y ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS, estos conocimientos la impulsaron a emprender un negocio que la cliente ha denominado VENTA DE PLATOS A LA LEÑA, para este cometido la señora cuenta con un espacio físico que le dejo su padre antes de morir, además de hornos, cocina y otras herramientas. Doña Ana indica que necesita el préstamo para readecuar el espacio físico para la venta de platos a la leña tales como Pollo a la Leña, Chancho a la Leña, Conejo a la Leña y Llama a la Leña, estos ingresos ayudaran a la señora a mejorar su calidad de vida y a demostrar que ella sin ayuda del esposo  puede salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Blanca is 24 years old. She is a single mother and has humble origins. She has a three-year-old daughter, whom she gave birth to when she was 21 years old. Unfortunately, the father did not understand his daughter's worth and told Ana to raise the child on her own. This situation encouraged Ana to leave the father, who was preventing her from achieving her dreams and aspirations.

Ana herself was abandoned by her father and raised through a lot of hard work by her mother. Ana finished her education at Achocalla school and went on to study cookery and event management. This knowledge led to Ana opening a business, called "Venta de Platos a la Leña". Ana has premises left to her by her father before his death. She also has ovens, cookers and other tools.

Ana says that she needs a loan in order to organise her premises better to sell dishes such as "pollo a la leña", and "llama a la leña" (chicken and llama dishes). The income that will result from this loan will help Ana to improve her quality of life and prove that she can move forward without the help of her husband.

loans.use: to organise her premises better to offer dishes to diners using a better system, and to earn a higher income for her daughters.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 65 años es un hombre que a pesar de su avanzada edad es muy vital y emprendedor, él inició su negocio hace 14 años, cuando vio la oportunidad de vender comidas en la nevada de los buses que transitan en el municipio de Soledad.  Diariamente a partir de las 6 a.m. Juan tiene listos para la venta empanadas, arepas, deditos y todo tipo de picada, así como jugos naturales y bebidas carbonatadas, él permanece en jornada continua hasta las 4 p.m. esta rutina la realiza de lunes a domingo y así logra responder a los gastos de su hogar. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar harina, queso, carnes, aceite, aderezos y vitina para incrementar sus inventarios y lograr incrementar su producción. El sueño de prosperidad de Juan es tener un local y poder ayudar con la crianza de sus nietos.
texts.en: Juan is a 65-year-old man who, despite his old age, is very lively and entrepreneurial. He started his business 14 years ago when he saw the opportunity to sell food in the bus terminal in the municipality of Soledad. Everyday at 6 a.m. Juan is ready to sell various types of stuffed bread [empanadas, arepas, and deditos] and all types of picada [traditional Colombian dish consisting of meat cut into small pieces], as well as natural juices and carbonated drinks. He works continuously until 4 p.m. He does this from Monday to Sunday, which allows him to pay for his home expenses. Recently he applied for a loan, a Credikiva, in order to receive financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy flour, cheese, meats, oil, seasonings, and semolina. By increasing his inventories, he will be able to increase production. Juan’s dream for the future is to have his own business site and be able to help raise his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, meats, oil, seasonings, and semolina in order to increase his inventories.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es: Leocadio de 42 años vive en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras y desde hace 15 años  se dedica a la siembra de Café y Maíz. Con esta actividad ha logrado dar a su familia el sustento necesario y sobre todo a sus cinco hijos la posibilidad de accesar a la educación que el no tuvo. Su esposa Maria contribuye también a los gastos del hogar con el cultivo de hortalizas por lo cual debe levantarse muy temprano por la mañana a realizar las labores domésticas, pero debido a que en la comunidad donde ellos viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica esta labor se le dificulta ya que tiene que iluminarse con velas o lámparas a base de querosén las cuales son perjudiciales para la  salud, por esta razón  Leocadio ha decidido solicitar financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema solar que le brindara los beneficios que la energía solar ofrece.
texts.en: Leocadio is 42 years old. He lives in the community of Intibucá, Honduras, and for 15 years he has planted coffee and corn. With this activity, he has been able to give his family the support they need and above all, give his five children the possibility of accessing the education he didn't have. Hiss wife Maria also contributes to the household expenses by growing vegetables, for which she gets up very early to do the housework. Because of the community where they live, there is no access to electricity and this work is very difficult, since she has to use candles or kerosene lamps, which are unhealthy, For this reason, Leocadio has decided to ask Soluz Honduras for a loan to buy a solar power system which will bring all of the benefits that solar power offers.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system, which will improve the living conditions in his home and help with his daily labor.

loans.name: Ricart

texts.es:
Ricart con 50 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive junto a su esposa y su hijo, en el distrito de Querecotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,leche,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 08 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de productos para vender en su bodega como son atún,galletas,azúcar,arroz, fideos,etc. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas,pavos,cuyes,etc, para posteriormente ofrecerlos en el mercado de si distrito.

Ricart es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado cinco créditos los cuáles los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Ricart, aged 50, lives with his wife and son in the Querecotillo area of Cutervo province in Peru's Cajamarca region. He enjoys excellent personal and work references from local residents. The people of this region work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

He sells essential groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, etc., and has 8 years' experience in this field. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for selling in his grocery store such as tuna, biscuits, sugar, rice, noodles, etc. He also raises smaller animals such as chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs for sale in the local market.

Ricart is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. He has received five loans, all of which have been promptly repaid.

loans.use: to buy supplies for selling in his grocery store such as tuna, biscuits, sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su esposo en una de las localidades de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella cuenta con una pequeña pulpería desde hace 36 años en su casa, donde ofrece productos como venta de maíz, frijoles, harina, refrescos, pan, huevos, azúcar, café,  productos de aseo, golosinas, condimentos y otros. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para su familia el cual ha mantenido mediante la inversion de varios prestamos. Ella solicita la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras que invertirá en la compra de más productos de la canasta básica para surtir su negocio como granos básicos, azúcar, harina, pan, huevos, aceite, refrescos, churros, productos de limpieza y otros. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio en vista que las ventas aumentan para la temporada de navidad, y así obtendrá mejores ingresos. Su meta es mejorar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Alicia is 56 years old. She has 3 children and she lives with her husband i none of the localities of  Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has had a small store in her home for 36 years. She sells products such as corn, beans, flour, beverages, bread, eggs, sugar, coffee, cleaning products, candies, condiments and more. This business is the source of income for her family and she has maintained it through the investment of several loans. She is asking for the amount of 21,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in buying more staple products to stock her business, such as basic grains, sugar, flour, bread, eggs, oil, beverages, churros, cleaning products and more. This will help her to improve her business because sales increase for the Christmas season and this way, she will obtain better income. Her goal is to improve her business and her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, flour, bread, eggs, oil, beverages, churros, cleaning products and more to sell.

loans.name: Jose Arnold

texts.es: José, de 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y 2 hijos, reside en una de las aldeas de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Él se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de café, el cual realiza en su terreno. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Él solicita el segundo ciclo en ODEF y es por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras que va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y en pago de limpieza para darle mejor mantenimiento a su finca de café. Esto le ayudara a obtener una buena cosecha, aumentar su producto y mejorar sus ingresos. Tiene como meta la compra de más terreno para cultivo y continuar cultivando granos básicos y cafe a fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 26 years old. He is in a common law marriage with his wife and has 2 children. He lives in one of the towns of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For 10 years, he has grown coffee, which he does on his land. He has always worked as a farmer, growing basic grains such as corn and beans. He is in his second cycle in ODEF and he is asking for the amount of 5,000 Lempiras, which he is going to invest in buying fertilizer and in paying for clearing the land to give his coffee farm good maintenance. This will help him to obtain a good harvest, increase his yield and improve his income. His goal is to buy more land to plant and continue growing basic grains and coffee in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for complete maintenance of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 48 años  vive en la comunidad de Copan, Honduras con su esposa y cuatro hijos; se dedica al cultivo de café y maíz desde hace 28 años y a diario lucha por salir adelante y hacer crecer su negocio ya que una de sus aspiraciones es poder llegar a tener una bodega de compra y venta de café. Y de esa manera brindar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida, pero debido a la falta de energía eléctrica en su comunidad él solicita a Soluz Honduras financiamiento para la compra de un sistema solar el cual vendrá a mejorar las condiciones actuales  en su hogar ya que no tendrá que continuar usando velas o lámparas a base de querosén las cuales dañan la salud de su familia y también podrá tener acceso a mantener cargado su celular.
texts.en: Pablo, 48 years old, lives in the community of Copan, Honduras with his wife and four children. He has worked cultivating coffee and corn for 28 years and daily struggles to get ahead and grow his business since one of his aspirations is to be able to have a store buying and selling coffee, and so to offer his family a better standard of life. But, due to the lack of electricity in his community, he asks Soluz Honduras for a loan to purchase a solar power system which will bring better conditions to his home since he won't have to continue using candles or kerosene lamps which damage the family's health and he will also be able to have access to keep his cell phone charged.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system which will improve the standard of living for his household and will help him in his daily work.

loans.name: Santos Dionicio

texts.es:
Santos, 48 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tienen 3 hijos.

Santos, se dedica a trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz y frijoles, tiene un camión en el cual trabaja en la temporada de verano haciendo viajes y halando materiales de construcción, ganado, recolectando cosechas de maguey, entre otros, para todos estos trabajos no tiene un horario estable.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera, porque en su terreno tiene bastante pasto para engordarla, actualmente tiene dos terneras pero quiere comprar más, porque cuando estén paridas tendrá un ingreso extras con la venta de los derivados extraídos de ella.

Santos, sueña con que sus hijos tengan toda la educación que el no pudo, desea también poder seguir día a día trabajando duro para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Santos, 48 years old, went to school up to the third grade, is married, his wife takes care of the household tasks, and they have 3 children.

Santos works the land, cultivating corn and beans, he has a truck in which he works in the summers making trips and hauling construction materials, livestock, collecting maguey harvests and others, for all of these jobs he doesn't have a set schedule.

Santos needs the loan to purchase a calf because his land has enough grass to fatten it, currently he has two calves but he wants to purchase another because when they give birth, he will have extra income with the sale of the products taken from them.

Santos dreams of his children having all the education he wasn't able to have, he also wants to be able to continue working hard day by day so that his family doesn't lack anything.

loans.use: to purchase a calf because his land has enough grass to fatten it.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y junto a ella tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

José, se dedica a laborar como jornalero en una finca de café, su trabajo es bastante estable e inicia a trabajar a las 5:00 a.m. sus principales funciones son; sacar el café que está en sacos, luego lo tiran al piso en los patios para secarlo, luego le pasan el rastrillo para esparcirlo y luego lo guardan en sacos nuevamente para ponerlo dentro de las bodegas.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas para aplicarlos a una plantación de café que él posee, la cual está aparte de la finca que cuida. 

José, sueña con poder darle a su hijo la educación necesaria para que se supere académicamente y también desea poder realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, para reparar el techo.
texts.en:
José, 33 years old, went to school up to the fifth grade, is married, his wife takes care of the household tasks, and with her he has a 2-year-old son.

José works as a laborer on a coffee farm, his work is sufficiently stable and he starts working at 5:00 am and his primary jobs are: take out the coffee that is in sacks, then put it on the patios to dry it, then rake it to spread it and then store it in the sacks again to put it in the storehouses.

José needs the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply to a coffee crop that he has, which is part of the farm he cares for.

José dreams of being able to give his son the education necessary for him to improve academically and also he wants to be able to make improvements on his house to repair the roof.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply them to the crop of coffee that he has.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Danlys Fabricio

texts.es: Danlys, de 21 años de edad, está soltero,  vive con sus padres en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Cuenta con un taller de mecánica donde ofrece los servicios de reparación de motocicletas, autos y venta de repuestos. El taller lo tiene instalado en su casa y funciona  desde hace 3 años. Él solicita la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de piezas y repuestos para su negocio como ser empaques, parches, grasas, balineras, friccions, hules, filtros, lubricantes, y otros repuestos para vender y reparar motocicletas y autos. Con esta inversión planea hacer crecer su negocio y brindar el servicio completo a sus clientes. Su meta es que su negocio crezca y que sea más estable para poder apoyar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Danlys, 21, is single and he lives with his parents in a village of Nueva Frontera, in Santa Barbara. He has a mechanic shop where he offers his services repairing motorcycles and cars, as well as selling repair parts. He set up the shop at home and has been doing this work for three years now.

He is applying for a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of spare parts and replacements for motorcycles and cars, including gaskets, patches, lubricants, ball bearings, rubber parts, brake pads and more to sell and to use in repairing motorcycles and cars.

With this investment, Danlys is planning to expand his business and offer complete service to his clients. His goal is to see the business grow and become more stable, so that he may be able to give support to his family and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and replacements for reselling and for repairing motorcycles and cars.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 43 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Analie works very hard to provide for them. Analie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Analie has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food, soap and other groceries. In the future, Analie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Best Repayment Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phơ is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She has worked in agriculture raising cow for more than 10 years.
Phơ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Phơ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Phơ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phơ has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Best repayment" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Phơ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase a baby cow to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia is a woman who is 61 years old. She is from Lower Tiparak, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur, a widow and has seven children. Zenia is engaged in a business of Sari-sari store in her community. She has been doing this business for 8 years to earn a living. She is also a farmer and she works hard in order to sustain the needs of their children.

She is asking for a loan from GDMPC amount of PHP 15,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari store. Zenia wishes to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to improve their living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase goods or grocery items to sell

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old and married with four children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marites has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marites aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 51 years old and has five children. Josie is married and has one child still in school.

Josie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Josie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josie has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice and raising livestock businesses in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Terry's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 52 years old and married with three children.

Erma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Erma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vehicle transportation.

Erma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Fulani Gimba village. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Isiyaku can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isiyaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Isiyaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en: Nern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: María Dorila

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, no estudio porque desde que era una niña se dedicó a los oficios del hogar, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tienen dos hijos.

María, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar todos los quehaceres del hogar, para luego dedicarse a los oficios de sastrería porque ella aprendió cuando tenía 13 años de edad este oficio; anteriormente ella le ayudaba a una vecina a reparar daños en la ropa, pero luego aprendió a la perfección y hoy se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes para el centro escolar de la comunidad. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos, para engordarlos y hacer que se reproduzcan, porque tiene un lugar cerca de su casa para poder tenerlos.

María, sueña con tener más trabajo como sastre y hacer más grande su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 48, didn't go to school because, since she was young, she dedicated herself to housework. She is married. Her husband is dedicated to farming and together they have two children.

María has been dedicated to housework since she was young. She has to get up very early to perform all her housework and then dedicate herself to the duties of the tailor shop because she learned this job when she was 13 years old. Previously she helped a neighbor repair damage to clothing but then she learned to perfection and today she is dedicated to making uniforms for the central community school.

María needs the loan to buy two pigs to fatten and breed them because she has a place near her house where she can keep them.

María dreams of having more work as a tailor and of making her house bigger and giving herself a better quality of life.

loans.use: para comprar dos cerdos, para engordarlos y hacer que se reproduzcan.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que junto a su esposo Juan se ha dedicado al cultivo de café y maíz desde hace 10 años en la comunidad de Copan, Honduras. Su objetivo principal es poder dar a sus   cuatro hijos la oportunidad de culminar una carrera universitaria. Por ello lucha a diario haciendo crecer su negocio y poder  así brindarles las mejores condiciones posibles, pero debido a que en la comunidad donde ella vive no tiene acceso a energía eléctrica, Rosa ha decidido solicitar a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para la compra de un Sistema Solar y de esa manera ya no tendrá que iluminarse con velas y ocote, además le  ayudara a  que  sus hijos puedan estudiar por las noches y realizar sus tareas escolares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old. She is an enterprising woman. She and her husband, Juan, have been growing coffee and corn for ten years in the community of Copan, Honduras.

Her main objective is to be able to give her four children the opportunity to complete a college degree. Therefore, she fights every day growing her business so she can provide the best possible conditions.

Because the community where she lives does not have access to electricity, Rosa has decided to ask for a loan from Soluz Honduras so she can buy a solar energy system, and thus no longer need to use candles and ocote pine for illumination. This will also help her children study and do their homework in the evenings.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system which will improve the living conditions of her family and help her children do their homework from school in the evenings

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 60 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Gladys will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nissah

texts.en:
Nissah is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nissah is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Nissah has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Nissah has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nissah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Nora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Doña Digna, tiene 59 años de edad, es una madre soltera, vive junto a su madre y una hija en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Ella tiene su propio negocio de costura donde ofrece los servicios de fabricación de ropa para niños, niñas, hace colas para niñas y también reparación de ropa en general. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años en su casa. Ella solicita la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras que invertirá en la compra de telas y otros materiales para la confección de prendas y vender. Su fin es confeccionar mayor cantidad de prendas y salir a vender a otros lugares para ampliar su mercado. Su sueño es poner su propia microempresa de confección de ropa en algún local o establecerlo bien en su casa.
texts.en: Digna, 59, is a single mother. She lives with her mother and a daughter in the town of Lima, Cortes. She has her own sewing business where she offers clothing making services for boys and girls. She makes bottoms for girls and also repairs clothing in general. She has performed this work for seven years from her home. She is requesting the quantity of 10,000 Lempiras that she will invest in the purchase of fabric and other materials to make clothing to sell. Her goal is to make a greater quantity of clothing and to go out and sell in other places to expand her market. Her dream is to start her own small business making clothing in a shop or to establish it well in her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows coffee, maize, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals.

Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She has three children.

She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge as transport.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more firewood. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 48 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of the children are in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Remedios requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a feed and rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice and feed to resell.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice and feed to resell.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lelita is 36 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lelita has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her tricycle and pay for maintenance for her business.

Lelita has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her tricycle and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan, de 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y 4 hijos en una aldea que pertenece al sector de Cofradía Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol, y hace 6 años decidió cultivar plátano, papaya y sandias, lo cual le ha sido rentable. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado 6 préstamos anteriores para mantener el cultivo, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, limpieza de sus cultivos y mangueras para un sistema de riego. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de producción y aumentar sus ingresos. Su meta es la compra de un vehículo para trasportar la producción y brindarles mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in a village that belongs to the sector of Cofradía Cortes.

He has always worked growing corn and beans. Six years ago he decided to plant bananas, papayas, and watermelon which has been profitable. He sells this production in the local market.

He has asked for six previous loans in order to maintain his crops. Currently he is asking for another 20,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, to clean his crops, and hoses for an irrigation system.

This investment will help improve the quality of production and increase his income. His goal is to buy a vehicle to transport the production and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, clean his crops and to buy hoses for an irrigation system

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven de 26  años de edad es casado y tiene un hijo de cinco años. Trabaja desde hace siete años como técnico en maquinas en una empresa donde comercializan el aluminio.
Cuando cursaba el segundo año de primaria le detectaron miopía en ambos ojos por lo que siempre ha utilizado anteojos, hace cuatro meses una afección ocular afectó la estructura de su cornea de redonda a cónica, el especialista le comenta  que pude ser de nacimiento y de no atenderse podría llegar a perder la vista totalmente. Sus recursos económicos son insuficientes para solventar una cirugía que necesita.
texts.en:
He is 26 years old and married. He has a five year old son. He has been working for seven years as a machine technician for a company that sells aluminum. When he was in the second grade they diagnosed myopia in both eyes. Therefore, he has always used glasses. Four months ago an eye condition changed the structure of his cornea from round to conical.

The specialist told him that it could be from birth, and not tending to it could lead to a total loss of vision. He does not have enough financial resources to pay for the surgery that he needs.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Rebati's Group

texts.en:
Rebati is an enterprising and industrious lady standing to the right in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. She is a divorcee and she single-handedly takes care of her three daughters.

She has been engaged in the activity of making plates, bowls, spoons and other utensils from brass for the last three years and then she sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes, mainly for serving food, and sometimes are used while performing rituals. She makes different types and sizes of plates and bowls, depending upon the demand of her customers.

Rebati has a plan to expand her business by producing greater quantities of her products, for which she needs machinery with which she can make the plates more frequently and quickly.

Rebati, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR for expanding her business. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase materials like a furnace and coal and brass in bulk from a wholesaler.

She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time and she is confident that she will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase a furnace and materials like coal and brass in bulk from a wholesaler.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one year. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as break down of the motorcycle.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 54, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alicia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 53 years old now.

Rosario has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Rosario requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 63-year-old widow with ten children.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosario requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosario has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Rosario aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Richelle

texts.en:
Ma. Richelle is 63 years old, single, and has one child. Ma. Richelle works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Richelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

Ma. Richelle has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una señora casada de 72 años de edad, la jubilaron hace varios años y en ocasiones cuida a sus nietos. Hace meses le diagnosticaron cataratas, cambio la graduación de sus anteojos por que ya no veía bien, por las noches ve destellos de luz lo cual se le extraño por que antes esto no pasaba.
El único tratamiento posible es la cirugía, con la cual mejoraría su calidad la vida, porque debido a sus cataratas dejo de cocinar y realizar  otras labores domesticas ya que no puede valerse por si sola.
texts.en:
She is 72 years old and married. She retired several years ago, and at times she takes care of her grandchildren. Months ago they diagnosed her with cataracts. They changed the prescription of her glasses because she no longer sees well. At night she sees flashes of light. This was strange to her because it did not happen before.

The only treatment is surgery, which will improve her quality of life. Because of her cataracts she has stopped cooking and doing the domestic chores. She is no longer able to get by on her own.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un señor de 49 años que padece de cataratas. Trabaja en un taller automotriz desde hace trece años como mecánico. Recientemente tuvo un accidente laboral lastimándose el antebrazo del lado derecho, en todo el tiempo que tiene trabajando nunca le había ocurrido algo semejante, por lo que quieren despedirlo y piensa que es por la cataratas que le diagnosticaron. El necesita urgentemente una cirugía para recuperar su vista ya que si lo despidieran le resultaría difícil conseguir un nuevo trabajo por su edad.
texts.en:
