He is 49 years old, and he has cataracts. He has worked as a mechanic in an auto shop for 13 years. He recently had a work accident that injured his right forearm. Nothing like this has ever happened to him in the whole time he has been working.

They want to fire him, and he thinks it is because he was diagnosed with cataracts. He urgently needs surgery to recover his sight. If they fire him it will be difficult to get a new job because of his age.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge - the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing and expanding a boutique business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru: На фотке снята Исмат. Ему 52 лет. Он опытный и честный дехканин. Исмат из района Джоми. Он отец четверых детей. Его дети заботливые и активные. Они помогает папе на работе. Жена Исмата занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она зарабатывает и поддерживает мужа. Сам Исмат занимается растениеводством. Он больше времени проводит на земле, потому что растениеводство является единственным деятельности и источником дохода. Исмат собирает капусту и репа. Он хочет посадить картофель. После сбора урожай он готовить землю к новому посеву урожай. Ему нужно минеральных удобрений для обработки почву. Исмат просит кредит для купли семена урожай и качественные удобрение. Он ждет поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
The man in the photo is Ismat. He is 52 and an experienced and honest farmer. He is from the Jomi region and the father of four caring and active children who help their father with his work. His wife works sewing women's clothing, earning money to support her husband. Ismat himself works in agriculture. He spends most of his time on the land, because agriculture is his only business and source of income.

Ismat is harvesting cabbage and turnips, and wants to plant potatoes. After gathering his crops he will prepare the land for a new planting. He needs mineral fertilizers to improve the soil. He is requesting a loan to buy seed potatoes and quality fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a go-getter.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 28,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and has one child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a motorcycle transportation business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will buy land. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Segundo Urbano

texts.es:
Segundo con 25 años, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en las diferentes labores agrícolas de su cultivo,para la compra de abonos. De esta manera logrará incrementar el rendimiento de su finca, así mismo logrará mejores ingresos.

Segundo es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa y no se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
Segundo is 25 years old. He is in a common law relationship. He lives with his partner and their children in the district of Pomahuaca, in the Jaén province, in the Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The people of this town are mostly devoted to working in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, with more than ten years experience in the field. He is asking for a loan to invest in various types of agricultural work for his crops, and for buying fertilizer. In this way he will be able to increase the performance of his farm, and will also have higher profits.

Segundo is a new customer to Edpyme Alternative and does not have other bank accounts.

loans.use: to invest in various types of agricultural work for his crops and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is 24 years old and single with one children. Carla works very hard to provide for her child.

Carla runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Carla requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods, etc.

In the future, Carla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 29 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Violeta has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Violeta has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Innayat

texts.en:
Innayat is a housewife who has been working hard to help both ends meet. She is running a crockery shop by herself to feed her six children and help them live a better life than she led. All of her children are school-going, so that is also one reason she is working hard.

For a few months, her inventory has been becoming shorter due to the demands of her customers, and that is why she applied for a loan amount of 50,000 PKR. She wants to gain back her business and run the wheel of her family expenses.

Innayat has applied for the loan from Kiva through BRAC Pakistan. She is obliged towards the team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her crockery shop.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 61 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been in this business for 38 years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven casado  de 37 años de edad, su ocupación es chofer de un transporte de carga. Esta preocupado por su esposa debido a que necesita una cirugía refractiva por la miopía que padece la cual se le desarrollo después del embarazo de su ultimo hijo.
Por medio del seguro social han prolongado la cirugía en varias ocasiones por lo que ha optado en buscar atención medica privada para poder tratar a su esposa, sin embargo el tratamiento sobrepasa su presupuesto, ya que el es el único sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
He is 37 years old and married. He is a cargo transport driver by occupation. He is worried about his wife because she needs refractive surgery. She has myopia, which developed after her pregnancy with their last child.

Social security has postponed the surgery on several occasions. Therefore, he has chosen to seek private medical attention in order to treat his wife. However, the treatment exceeds his budget because he is the sole support of his family.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina used her prior loan to partially renovate her boarding house. To further improve her boarding house, she requested another loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for construction materials and labor. This loan will help add value to her boarding house and attract more boarders. 

Justina hopes her youngest child finishes college as education is a pathway for a better life. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from God.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation and maintenance of their boarding house.

loans.name: Hilibrando

texts.es:
Hilibrando con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de arroz,de variedad Capirona,con una experiencia en el rubro con más de 14 años. Adicionalmente se desempeña como soldador,cuenta con un pequeño taller de carpintería metálica. Solicita préstamo para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Hilibrando es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Hilibrando, 42, is married. He lives in his own house made of rustic material alongside his partner and their children in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaen, department of Lambayeque, Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The majority of residents of this town are dedicated to farming, trade and cattle.

He is dedicated to farming, specifically growing rice of the Capirona variety, with more than 14 years experience in the field. Additionally, he works as a welder. He has a small metal shop. He is requesting a loan for fertilizer expenses and maintenance of his rice crop. In this way, he will be able to acquire an acceptable profit that will improve his quality of life.

HIlibrando is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer costs and maintenance of his rice crop.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida was born in 1965. Shohida is married and has four children who are adults. She lives with her family in the north of Tajikistan. She is a kind and responsible woman.

Shohida has been busy with a farming business for more than 30 years. She grows a variety of vegetables and crops. Shohida makes two sowings each year.

She is going to plant new seeds, but she does not have the money to buy the necessary things. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing.

loans.name: Veronica Yadira

texts.es:
Verónica con 38 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería y para la compra de un local comercial.

Verónica es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Verónica, 38, is married and lives in a house with her partner and their children in the district of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque province in Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The residents of this town are dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock for the most part.

She is dedicated to selling clothing, with more than ten years experience in this role. Additionally, she is dedicated to raising and selling animals. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and to buy a shop.

Verónica is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and buy a shop.

loans.name: Sita Group

texts.en:
Sita Group started in the year 2015 at Kumerpata village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. These are 10 active, self-dependent women with an intention for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihood.

All the members of concerned group have their own profession and business. Urbashi is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing fifth from the left-hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 37 years old and living with her small family of her husband and two children.

She has been engaged in a grocery business in her own home for the last 10 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible, so she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to take a loan for the expansion of her business.

Urbashi planned to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion to save money for the purchase of another house and to provide a better education to her children.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different income generation activities like vegetable vending, goat rearing and selling, a milk business, a popped rice business, a paddy business, a general store, etc. With this loan, they all hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Lili's Group

texts.en:
Lili is the lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She lives with her husband, two daughters and a son in a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. She sells green leafy vegetables for her living, and her husband works as a butcher to meet the daily household expenses.

Within this limited income and numerous liabilities, Lili could not build a hygienic toilet at her home. She and her family have to walk a long distance to relieve themselves at odd hours at isolated places, which is not at all safe from a health, hygiene and safety point of view.

Therefore, Lili, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped, hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it. This loan amount can save her from harmful communicable diseases, increase her safety and promote cleanliness in the society.

She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support, as she is in dire need of it.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped, hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman, and she has one child. She describes herself to be honest.

Rachel operates a retail business where she sells motorcycle spare parts. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals.

Rachel will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years.

This is Rachel's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa con 30 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera,vive en casa familiar, junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en un zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 1 año aproximadamente. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para estos, los cuáles engordará para las fiestas que se acercan, de esta forma obtendrá un mayor ingreso. Las perspectivas del mercado son buenas ya que la población de Zaña está creciendo y existe mayor demanda.

Carmen Rosa es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior de S/.1000 cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 30 years old. She is single mother and lives in the family house with her son, in the District of Zaña, Chiclayo Province, Department of Lambayeque, in the country of Peru, in a rural area. She has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The people of this town are mostly devoted to working in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She has been devoted for about a year to the activity of raising and selling pigs and has experience in the field. She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and feed for them, fattening them for the coming holidays, so she can obtain a higher income. Market prospects are good as the Zaña population is growing and demand is increasing.

Carmen Rosa is a repeat customer for Edpyme Alternative, with a previous loan of 1,000 PEN paid on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for these pigs

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a well-stocked shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ardena

texts.en:
Ardena is 46 years old and single. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

Ardena requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilou Refil

texts.en:
Marilou Refil is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou Refil is 36 years old, and her three children are still in school.

Marilou Refil has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilou Refil requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fishing nets, gasoline for her boats and other materials for her business.

Marilou Refil has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, gasoline for her boats and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a single woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marife is 24 years old now.

Marife has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Marife has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 31 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Chona has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from personal care products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 32 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Rhea works very hard to provide for them.

Rhea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rhea has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old, ambitious school owner who started a community school in the year 2011. Her aim is to contribute to the literacy rate of her community and make education available to more students than are currently enrolled in schools.

She is running this school with the support of her younger brother shown in photo. There are 134 students in her school, more than 40 percent of whom are females.

Due to a lack of financial resources, she could not repair her school building and buy new furniture. Trying to accommodate the students, she has requested a loan worth PKR 60,000. This will not only help her improve the school building, it will also provide comfortable furniture for her students.

loans.use: to repair her school building and to buy new furniture.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells handbags and shoes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Isaiah will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags and shoes. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be joyful.

She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

Her business goal is to open a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Carmen Nora

texts.es:
Carmen Nora con 30 años de edad ,de estado civil madre soltera,vive en casa propia,junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Morropón,provincia de Piura,departamento de Piura,país Perú.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales (chanchos, pavos, pollos) y venta del mismo,con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 2 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de tamales. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo,compra de aves de corral (pavos, chanchos entre otros y unificar crédito de Caja Piura).El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido al crecimiento económico de la zona

Carmen Nora es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Carmen Nora, 30, is married and a single mother. She lives in her own house along with her two children in the district of Morropon, in the Piura province, Piura department, Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The residents of this town are dedicated to farming, trade and livestock, for the most part.

She is dedicated to raising animals (pigs, turkey, chicken) and to selling the same and has experience in this role for more than two years. Additionally, she is dedicated to selling tamales. She is requesting a loan of working capital to buy poultry (turkey), pigs, among others and to tie up credit from Caja Piura. The market presents good prospects due to the economic growth of the area.

Carmen Nora is a new member with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy poultry (turkey), pigs, among others and to tie up credit from Caja Piura.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, condiments, and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, condiments, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and has three children. Mary is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 64 years old now.

Magdalena has a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with five children. Maribeth is 42 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maribeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc.

Maribeth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rogelia is 61 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Rogelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional equipment such as new fishing nets and tackle.

Rogelia has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment such as new fishing nets and tackle.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 59 years old, married, and has five children.

Ma. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is a single woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginita is 49 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Virginita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing nets and tackle.

Virginita has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fishing nets and tackle.

loans.name: Vevirle

texts.en:
Vevirle is 37 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Vevirle works very hard to provide for them.

Vevirle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Vevirle has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Vevirle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a divorced woman and has no kids. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Rukia operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned transportation and competition as challenges in the business. Rukia dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Bastari's Group

texts.en:
Bastari is a lady with intellect and innocence. She is standing to the extreme left-hand side in the photograph. Life has been harsh for her. A humble resident of a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India, she has underwent poverty since her childhood.

Her husband works as a farmer with a limited land holding and is responsible to take care of a family of six. Lack of finances tied the hands of Bastari to build a toilet in her house. The absence of a toilet in her house and near her locality compels Bastari to walk a long distance to isolated areas to relieve herself. She is tired of following this unsanitary practice and feels the risk of hampering her health.

Therefore, Bastari, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it. Access to a toilet will enhance Bastari's convenience, safety and hygiene.

Bastari is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a clean toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sairendri's Group

texts.en:
Sairendri is the lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She is a dutiful lady engaged in poultry farming and hails from a village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. She is married and is a blessed mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband is a carpenter in the same village. The couple works really hard to earn a living for the family.

After fulfilling all the needs of the family, Sairendri is left with hardly any savings to build a toilet in her house. Absence of a toilet makes her face numerous difficulties like walking long distances at odd hours, hampering her privacy and safety.

Sairendri, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean toilet, attach all necessary sanitary fittings, and install a commode. Access to a toilet will enhance Sairendri's convenience, safety, and hygiene.

Sairendri is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean toilet, attach all necessary sanitary fittings, and install a commode.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de condiments et de céréales, Ayélé achète ses marchandises au marché et les revendent à sa devanture de son domicile. Ayélé s’approvisionne de ses denrées alimentaires trois fois par mois au marché. Ayélé désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile et des sacs du haricot.  Ayélé profitera du bénéfice pour bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé is a foodstuff and cereal re-seller who buys her wares at the market and re-sells them in her neighbourhood. She goes to the market three times a month to stock up on provisions, and is looking for a loan to buy sacks of rice, tubs of oil and sacks of beans. Ayélé will use the profits to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 tubs of oil and 2 sacks of beans

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1994. She is studying at the Tajik State University. She is studying by correspondence. She is studying very well.

She is married. In her free time, she deals with animal husbandry, mainly keeping cows and calves. She buys young calves and fattens them over a certain amount of time, then resells them at the cattle market. She wants to get a good income with buying and selling cattle.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her university tuition so that she can continue with her education. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS with this aim. She hopes she can reach her goal with your help and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a friendly young woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband helps her with managing the business.

All the money that she earns goes to provide her family with all necessary things, and she is not in a position to save any money for another long-term goal. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her corn plants because she wants to develop her agriculture activity. Part of the loan will also go toward paying for labor. This will allow her to make sure all the work is done well.

She wants additional income, and that’s why she needs to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 with this aim. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new sowing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her bicycle transport business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Olvid

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Olvid works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Olvid is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Olvid has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Mawussi est un homme célibataire avec un enfant à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Mawussi a un atelier de traitement de texte dans lequel il revend des articles scolaires, informatiques et fait aussi des photocopies à ses clients. Mawussi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de feuilles rames et des cartouches d’encre. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Mawussi pourra bien concrétiser ses rêves, aider son enfant dans son éducation et ainsi développer son activité.
texts.en: Mawussi is 38 years old and has no partner. He lives in Tokoin with one child living in his care. He has a word processing workshop where he resells scholarly and IT-related articles and also makes photocopies for his clients. Mawussi is looking for a loan to buy boxes of paper and ink cartridges. With his profits, Mawussi will be able to realise his dreams, help with his child's education and thus develop his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 ink cartridges and 3 boxes of paper

loans.name: Dhanalaxmi Group

texts.en:
This group is started in the year 2015 at Ghodabandh village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. These are 10 active, self-dependent women with an intention for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihood.

All the members of concerned group have their own profession and business. Ketaki is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and for the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing at the back row, the second person from the right-hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 41 years old and lives with her small family of her husband and only one son.

She has been engaged with a grocery business in her own home for the last 12 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through the concerned business she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible, so she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to take a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion to save money for the purchase of another house and to provide a better education to her son.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, animal trading, a milk business, a popped rice business, a paddy business, a general store, etc. They all hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Baidehi's Group

texts.en:
The humble and curious looking lady standing in the middle of the photograph is Baidehi. She resides in a remote village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.She is a widow. Life has become challenging for her after her husband's demise. She is engaged in a tailoring business to earn a living and take responsibility of her only daughter.

She does not have access to a toilet at her home due to her limited source of funds. Depending upon the open field for defecation and urination has a lot of danger. She feels that her privacy is getting hampered and feels unsafe about this practice.

Therefore, Baidehi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean, well-equipped toilet. This loan amount can save her from harmful contagious diseases and increase her safety and hygiene.

She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support, and is confident that she will be able to repay the loan within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: to build a clean, well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 34 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Marites has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

Marites has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments, thread, and other materials needed in  her business

loans.name: Marsela

texts.en:
Marsela is a 48-year-old woman and is married to her husband, Yeskiel, a 58-year-old man. They have two children who are married already.

To manage their living needs, Yeskiel runs a bricks business. Even so, Marsela owns a seaweed business. She is an energetic and hardworking woman. She prefers to spend the days by doing something useful for her family. She has been involved in this for years. Marsela loves this business, since it allows her to generate more income and support her husband, as well as manage their living needs.

She has planned to replace the old ropes with the new ones. She needs 210 meters of rope to tie the seaweed seedlings on the water surface at the beach. Therefore, when a neighbor informed her about the loan product provided by Kiva through TLM, she then joined in the existing group loan and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000.

She hopes she can receive the loan to buy ropes for her business improvement.

loans.use: to buy new ropes for her seaweed seedlings to replace the old ones.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a very energetic woman, who is 39 years old. She is passionate about working and has succeeded in taking her grocery store business forward. She started the business four years ago as a way to keep herself busy, since her three children have left her house. 

Thanks to loans from GDMPC, she succeeded in diversifying the products that she offers and thus, growing as a businesswoman. Because of this, she trusts faithfully in both organizations. 

At this time, Marisa knows that she needs to improve her business and the only way of doing it, is to get another loan from GDMPC. With this loan, she plans to buy large quantities of grocery items. Marisa has many goals. She plans to work hard until her business is more progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 44 years old and a housewife who has been working hard to make both ends meet. She has been running a crockery shop for 25 years by herself to feed her seven children and help them live a better life than she led.  From a few months ago her inventory is not meeting the demand of her customers, and that is why she applied for the loan amount of 50,000 PKR so as to gain back her business and run the wheel of her family expenses. All of her children are school-going, so that is also one reason she is working hard. Parveen has applied for the loan from Kiva  through Brac Pakistan. She is obliged towards the Team and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her crockery shop.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jijali (0084) Group

texts.fr:
Nema est membre du groupe Jijali, marié et mère de  5 enfants âgé de 2 à 12 ans,  ses trois filles fréquentent l’école, elle-même est analphabète, elle réside  au Mali avec son mari, elle est âgé de 32 ans, c’est elle qui a la main sur la corde du porc sur la photo. Elle fait l’élevage porcine et il y a 6 ans de cela, Les rêves et les espoirs de  Nema est d’avoir plus d’argent pour augmenter son activité, enfin  de tirer plus de bénéfice pour survenir aux besoins de la familiale. Par manque de moyen financier elle fait recours au RMCR depuis 4 ans pour pouvoir mener à bien son activité c’est une femme crédible
. Elle s’approvisionne et vends ses porcs dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone, village voisins. Elle  gagne comme bénéfice 15 000 FCFA par mois. Le prêt apportera une amélioration pour sa famille dans : la santé, et la nourriture.
texts.en: Nema, aged 32, is a member of the Jijali group. She is married with 5 children, aged between 2 and 12. Her 3 daughters attend school; she herself, however, cannot read or write. She lives in Mali with her husband, and is pictured on the right-hand side of the photo holding the pig's rope-leash. Nema has been rearing pigs for 6 years. She dreams of having more money in order to grow her business and finally make enough profit to meet the needs of her family. Lacking sufficient financial resources, she has been using RMCR's services for 4 years to help run her business and is very trustworthy. She buys and sells her pigs at weekly fairs in the neighbouring villages of her area. She makes a profit of 15,000 FCFA per month. A loan will bring about an an improvement in her family's health and diet.

loans.use: to rear pigs for resale

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años y una hija de 4 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos.
Él es cómico, divertido y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ caracterizado por reunir a la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera y el comercio informal, dónde se realiza la fiesta del gran poder patrono de los comerciantes.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de su producción de calzados y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos de mujer, actividad que realiza todo el proceso productivo en su taller ubicado en su casa, cuenta con moldes, una máquina de coser industrial, hilos de todo tipo y herramientas, “los materiales de confección son tan importante como el proceso productivo…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque sus zapatos son de buena calidad. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos y en ocasiones pedidos por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de zapatos para que su esposa venda, el desea comprar material de trabajo como cuero, suelas, tacos, pegamento y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para fabricar zapatos artesanales.
texts.en:
47-year old Jose is married and has two sons aged 6 and 8 and a daughter aged 4. He runs a shoe-making business. Jose is funny, entertaining, and very hardworking. His business is located in the Max Paredes area where much of the local manufacturing production and informal trading takes place. It is also home of the Gran Poder festival.

Jose has a dark complexion, short black hair, and is of medium stature. His mother language is Aymará which he speaks with his family, but he also speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. His wife sells the shoes he makes, and his children attend school. They live in a rented room made of bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The house has water, electricity, and a sewer system.

Jose makes women's shoes from scratch in his workshop located in his house. He has shoe forms, an industrial sewing machine, all kinds of thread, and tools. He points out that the materials he uses are as important as the production process. Jose's business is successful because the shoes are of good quality. The advantages of his business are the fact that he has regular customers and occasionally bulk orders. The disadvantage is the lack of shoe-making supplies.

Jose's greatest wish is to open a shoe store where his wife can work.

With the loan money he wishes to buy supplies such as leather, soles, heels, glue etc. This is his first loan with the institution in the six years he has been involved in this work making shoes.

loans.use: buy supplies such as leather, soles, heels, glue etc. for making shoes

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man and has one child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his vehicle. He has been involved in this business for ten years. Charles describes his biggest business challenge to be vehicle break down. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to service his vehicle. His business goal is to have more vehicles for transport within five years. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and his previous loans were all repaid successfully. Charles will use the anticipated profits to improve his life.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, flour, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

Sabina will use the 30,000 Kes. loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y su menor hija de 4 años de edad,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, 1 hectárea de plantación está en el tercer año de producción y 1 hectárea está para primer año de producción, tiene entre cinco y tres años de edad,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace ya 9 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca), así mismo trabaja como ayudante en carpintería. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1,5 hectáreas de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.

Raúl es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Raúl is 29 years old and in a common-law relationship.  He lives in his own rustic home with his partner and his 4-year-old daughter in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru.  He has a lot of good personal and work references from the residents of the area.  The people from this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.  

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee.  To date, he has 2 hectares of Catimor variety, resistant to diseases and infestations.  One hectare of the plantation is in its third year of production and one hectare is in its first year.  His crops are between 5 and 3 years old, and he already has 9 years of experience in the field.  He also makes a living raising small animals (hens, guinea pigs, among other animals) and growing basic food crops (yucca, plantains, and taro), as well as working as an assistant to a carpenter.  The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the maintenance and cultivation of 1.5 hectares of cafe in production, ensuring good production for the 2016 season.  This will mean a larger volume of sales and more income that he can use to improve the standard of living for himself and his family.  

Raúl is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.  He and his partner are signing together.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance and cultivation of 1.5 hectares of coffee in production.

loans.name: Kisseke

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Kisseke est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Kisseke vit à Tokoin et vend des objets en plastiques à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant pour  gagner son revenu. Kisseke s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander des unités de bassines en plastiques et de gobelets en vue de bien revendre et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et avoir un épanouissement.
texts.en:
Kisseke, age 34, is the married mother of four children. She lives in Tokoin where she practices her activity of selling plastic wares from her home and as an itinerant vendor around neighboring districts. She buys merchandise twice a month at the market.

Kisseke is seeking this loan to buy plastic tubs and cups to sell. With her revenue, she will help her husband to provide for their children's education and ensure that they thrive.

loans.use: to buy 40 plastic tubs and 10 cups.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, who is in her early 50's, is married with four children, of whom two are grown up and two are still in school. She has been running a couple of projects, a retail shop and selling charcoal, for ten years now. She works from 6 AM to 8 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Judith’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase both her businesses and has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy the out of stock items in the shop inventory. She dreams of building a house. Judith will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy the out of stock items in the shop inventory

loans.name: Dúo El Tabacal Group

texts.es: Dúo el Tabacal Doña Reina Marili  es casada tiene 30 años de edad, es propietaria de un negocio de nutrición ella tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad  de los cuales estudia 1 su negocio se llama club de nutrición Herbalife ella inicio su proyecto a raiz de la obesidad y ella quiso cambiar sus hábitos alimenticios y el producto fue muy bueno por lo que decidió poner un club de nutrición  hace 5 años su mayoría de clientes son damas y también da clases de aeróbicos  sus metas son: mejorar la calidad de vida, mejorar los ingresos económicos, alimentar la producción, ofrecer variedad de productos. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a fape y kiva agradece a dios por darle la oportunidad de poder mejorar los hábitos alimentación de muchas personas y mejorar su autoestima. Es por ello que solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería como alimentos dietéticos.
texts.en:
This pair of women is called El Tabacal Group. One of the members is Sra. Reina Marili who is 30 years old and married. She is the owner of a nutrition business. She has two children aged 6 and 3, one of whom attends school. Her business is called the Herbalife Nutrition Club.

Reina started her business because of a problem with obesity; she wanted to change her eating habits. She found that this product was very good so she decided to start a nutrition club five years ago. Most of her clients are women. She also runs aerobics classes.

Reina's goals are to improve her standard of living, increase her income, grow the number of customers, and offer a wider variety of products. This is her first loan with Fape and Kiva, and she thanks God for giving her this opportunity to improve the eating habits of many people and her own self-esteem. For these reasons she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as diet food products.

loans.use: buy diet food products

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Saidi, who is in his early 40s and married, he has three school-going children. He has been selling fish for 27 years now. He works from 5am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Saidi’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of fish for his butcher business and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of his group. He used the profits from his business to repay his loan, pay school fees to his children, and build his own house.

He will use this loan to reconstruct his butcher to match competitive standards. He dreams of opening a fish-selling butcher business at the city centre. Saidi will share this loan with his loan group MUNDULI B, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of fish and to reconstruct his butcher business.

loans.name: Segundo Alejandro

texts.es:
Segundo Alejandro con 32 años, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos de 12,9 años de edad, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 08 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Segundo Alejandro es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, Firma con su cónyugue.
texts.en:
Segundo Alejandro is 32 years old and in a common-law relationship.  He lives in his own rustic home with his partner and his 9 and 12-year-old children in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru.  He has a lot of good personal and work references from the residents of the area.  The people from this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.  

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with 8 years of experience in the field.  He will use the loan that he will receive for agricultural tasks, such as the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and labor for his harvest. This will lead to the physiological, morphologic and productive improvement of his crop. He will also have a timely harvest, and as a result will have greater production and a better quality product, so that he will have no problem selling his product.

Segundo Alejandro is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.  He and his partner are signing together.

loans.use: to carry out agricultural tasks, such as the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and pay for labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Diekadi Group

texts.fr:
Moussa, il est celui qui est assis et tient la corne du bélier  sur la photo,aimant les enfants et gentil avec eux,Il fait  le commerce ovin, âgé de 65 ans, il habite au Mali  et père de 6 enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 10 ans  à 29 ans .son épouse   est une ménagère.
Moussa  exerce ce métier il y a 10 ans et travaille avec le RMCR depuis deux ans sans problème signalé, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité.
Il sollicite un prêt  subséquent   pour  accroitre ses activités de commerce ovin, il lui  servira à  l’auto suffisante de la famille: santé, école, nourriture. Ses activités peuvent lui apporté un revenus  de 15000 FCFA par mois.
Dans l’avenir il veut être  un grand  commerçant des ovins et faire l’exportation des animaux dans les pays voisin.
texts.en:
Moussa is sitting down, holding the ram's horn in the photo. He loves children and is kind to them. He sells sheep and goats. He is 65 and lives in Mali with his wife and six children aged between 10 and 29. His wife is a housekeeper.

Moussa has been working in this business for 10 years and has collaborated with the RMCR for two years without any problems. He buys his stock and resells his animals at the local markets.

He requests a new loan to expand his business. The loan will enable his family to become self-sufficient: health care, school, food. His business can bring in up to 15000 FCFA a month.

In the future, he wants to become an important sheep and goats tradesman and to export his animals to the neighbouring countries.

loans.use: to buy ovines for his commerce, he buys and resells the animals.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México hay una comunidad cuyos habitantes son muy trabajadores y amables, su calidez humana los identifica sobre las demás localidades. De igual modo, tienen tradiciones muy arraigadas, sobre todo las fiestas religiosas en donde se realizan quemas de fuegos pirotécnicos, bailes, comidas y en general todos los habitantes conviven fraternalmente. 
   Don J. Carmen es un hombre que sobresale por su actitud entusiasta, también es muy respetuoso y, ante todo, alegre. Está casado con la señora Rosa María y juntos han formado una familia integrada por cuatro hijos de los cuales tres continúan con sus estudios. 
   Desde hace más de nueve abrió una vulcanizadora que es un establecimiento donde se reparan los neumáticos o llantas de los automóviles. La iniciativa surgió ya que adquirió la experiencia necesaria laborando en el taller de un familiar, después logró poner su propio negocio. Con el préstamo de VFMéxico pudo comprar la herramienta suficiente para brindar un servicio de excelente calidad a sus clientes. Con el nuevo apoyo cubrirá el costo de una compresora pues actualmente realiza los cortes de forma manual.
   Su esfuerzo le ha representado ganar varios clientes; su negocio, al ser estable, le permitió contratar a una persona quien le ayuda de forma significativa. "El sol sale para todos y yo tengo mis propios clientes seguros" comentó al referirse a la competencia. Su sueño más grande es comprar un terreno en donde construya un taller más grande.
    Los demás integrantes del grupo son Ana María quien invertirá en la compra de cerdos para su cría; Juan, en un cibercafé; Cristina y Teodora, en una taquería; José Juan  y Francisco, en tortillas; María Elena, en una tienda de abarrotes; Ana María F., en zapatos y Nancy, en blancos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Ana María quien porta un gorro; Don J Carmen es quien viste la playera color negro.
texts.en:
There is a community in Mexico whose inhabitants are very hard-working, kind people. Their warmth makes them stand out from other communities. They also have very rooted traditions, especially their religious holidays where they display fireworks, dances, food and, in general, everyone lives in a spirit of brotherhood.

J. Carmen is a man who stands out for his enthusiasm and respectfulness, as well as his cheerfulness. He is married to Rosa Maria and they have a family comprised of four children, three of whom still attend school.

Over nine years ago he opened a vulcanization business which is where automobile tires are repaired. The initiative came about after he acquired experience working in a family workshop. Afterwards he opened his own business. With a loan through VFMexico he was able to buy enough tools to provide excellent quality services ot his customers. With the new loan he plans to cover the cost of a compressor, since he now does the cutting by hand.

Through his efforts he has attracted many different customers. Since his business is stable he has been able to hire people who help him significantly. "The sun comes up for everyone and I have my own fixed customers" he says regarding his competition. His greatest goal is to buy land to build a larger workshop.

The other members of the group are Ana Maria who will buy pigs to raise; Juan, who will invest in a cybercafe; Cristina and Teodora in a taco stand; Jose Juan and Francisco in a tortilla stand; Maria Elena in a grocery store; Ana Maria F in shoes and Nancy in white goods.

*The photo was taken at Ana María's business. She is wearing a hat. J. Carmen is the one in a black polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy a small compressor.

loans.name: Pheny

texts.en:
Pheny is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Leonidas Fernando

texts.es:
Leonidas con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,provincia de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café , a la fecha tiene 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción, actividad lo realiza hace 3 años en terreno propio en el Caserío El Arenal del Distrito Santo Tomas. Su producto lo comercializa en Distrito Santo Tomas a compradores mayorista de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores como (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos) siendo estos para la venta y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, pitucas, menestras) siendo estos para su consumo; cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mayor y mejor producción, obteniendo un mayor volumen de ventas reflejado en mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Leonidas es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 34 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his partner and their three young children in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has a lot of good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The people from this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. 

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. To date, he has 1 hectare of the Catimor variety.  His plantation is three years old and in its second year of production.  He has been growing coffee for 3 years on his own land in Caserío El Arenal in the district of Santo Tomas.  He sells his crop to wholesale buyers in the Santo Tomas district.  He also makes a living raising small animals (hens, guinea pigs, among other animals) and growing basic food crops for consumption (yucca, taro, and legumes).  He has a lot of experience in his field.  The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the maintenance and cultivation of a hectares of cafe in production, ensuring good production for the 2016 season. This will mean a larger volume of sales and more income that he can use to improve the standard of living for himself and his family. 

Leonidas is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. He and his partner are signing together.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of a hectare of coffee, ensuring a good 2016 season.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 53 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Delia has a bakery business in the Philippines. Ma. Delia requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery business.

Ma. Delia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Ma. Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Babita's Group

texts.en:
Babita is a strong minded woman, standing to the lefthand side in the photograph. She is a divorcee and hails from a village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.

Having experienced and moved ahead of the atrocities in life, one thing she has learned and continuously strives for is financial independence. She wants to grab the most accessible opportunity to reach her goal. She describes herself as a caring mother of her six year old daughter.

Babita has engaged in stitching and embroidering clothes for the last two years. She runs her business from her home and has a good number of loyal customers for the quality service she delivers to her clientele base. She makes beautiful embroideries, using colorful thread on fabrics, and is quite happy with her business and the respect she gets from her customers.

Babita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase colorful thread and wool in bulk and repair her old sewing machine so that she can increase her efficiency and deliver more and better to her customers at the required time.

Babita is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase colorful thread and wool in bulk and repair her old sewing machine.

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiku

texts.en: Hannah is a retired teacher who is currently venturing into farming. The high cost of cooking fuel has driven her to obtain a renewable source of energy.  She learnt about Takamoto Biogas through a friend and got interested in their loan repayment schedule. With this loan she will be able to save on the cost of fuel and use the savings to pay for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean renewable cooking.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: This is Annah, a mother of four, from Kericho county. She has been keeping cows for the last 10 years. She is happy rearing cows and this is her personal interest. The proceeds from milk production assist her in taking care of her household and paying for her children's school fees. She wants to improve her breed of cows and with a Kiva loan she will be able to buy one cow.

loans.use: to pay for one high-breed cow.

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is 22 years old and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small business of selling beauty products. He always tries to establish his businesses through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced into the market are very high in demand and expensive as well. This is why his wife Anam has requested for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He will use the full amount for his business so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial creams, hair colors, make-over kits, lipsticks and nail polishes for reselling. She hopes that through this amount, her husband would be empowered to enhance the business.

Anam is thankful to Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Don Oswaldo tiene más de cinco años de estar recibiendo el apoyo de Kiva, se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz, tomate y otros, el área donde cosecha don Oswaldo es un área que se presta para esta actividad y tiene unos paisajes muy hermosos. En sus pagos ha sido responsable y puntuales,  buen record de pago. Don Oswaldo trabaja mucho junto a su esposa porque quiere que sus hijos tengan estudio y se lleguen a graduar para tener así mejores oportunidades en la vida. Agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo que le brindan. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abonos para el cultivo de verduras.
texts.en:
Oswaldo has been receiving support from Kiva for more than 5 years.  He makes a living growing coffee, corn, tomatoes, and other crops.  The area where he grows his crops is good for agriculture and it has very beautiful scenery.  He has been responsible and punctual with his payments and has a good payment record.  

Oswaldo and his wife work a lot because they want their children to study and to be able to graduate so that they can have better opportunities in life.  He thanks lenders for their support.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds and manure to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Superación Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Superación Doña Yaneth tiene 22 años de edad es madres soltera tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de los cuales 1 estudia ella es propietaria de un negocio de miselanea ella solicita su credito para poder invertir en comprar producto de temporada navideña sus clientes son: sus vecionos, amigos y personas de su alrededor  ella inicio vendiendo jugos, luego sus ganancias fueron mejor con miselanea. Sus metas son: mejorar la calidad de vida, alimentar la producción, mejorar los ingresos económicos, fortalecer el negocio, pagar los estudios de sus hijos, alimentar la producción,  ha tenido 4 prestamos con fape los cuales le han ayudado a hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 22, is a member of the Grupo Solidario Superacion Group. She is a single mother with two children, ages 6 and 4, one of whom attends school. She runs a variety store and is requesting a loan to buy Christmas products. Her customers are neighbors, friends and people in her community.

She started out selling juices but was able to earn more profit selling various products. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase production and income, strengthen the business, and pay for her children's education.

She has had four loans through FAPE which have helped her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy Christmas products to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Integrado por cuatro mujeres unidas por un fuerte lazo de amistad, La Esperanza es un grupo originario del Estado de México. A diferencia de otras comunidades aledañas, la suya cuenta con los servicios necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida. Las fiestas tradicionales son consideradas un rasgo distintivo entre los habitantes que ven condensados los festejos el día 2 de febrero cuando celebran la Candelaria. Dicha celebración religiosa reúne a propios y extraños para disfrutar de la música, el baile y las comidas tradicionales.
   Doña Vero es una persona querida y respetada por sus compañeros debido a su carácter alegre, amable y entusiasta. Siempre se esfuerza por el bienestar de su familia, en este momento está comprometida con la educación preparatoria de su hija ya que quiere que se dedique a lo que más le apasione. Para alcanzar sus metas se dedica a la cría de conejos gracias a uno de sus hijos quien tuvo la iniciativa de adquirir una pareja de estos animales primero para su consumo y después para comercializar. La actividad ha generado resultados favorables y ahora cuenta con 60 ejemplares dentro de los corrales que construyó junto a su casa.
   Hoy en día cuenta con una clientela  formal la cual conoce el tiempo estimado de cría y acuden hasta la casa de Vero una vez que los conejos alcanzan su desarrollo ideal. Normalmente tiene de 8 a 10 clientes por semana pero en temporadas especiales las ventas se incrementan debido a la demanda, por ejemplo en Navidad y Año Nuevo. "Mi único desafío es que el precio del alimento varía mucho y debo ajustar mis propios precios” comentó. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y seguir con el apoyo escolar a su hija quien desea cursar comunicación. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Sara quien invertirá en borregos; María de los Ángeles, en comida típica y Eugenia, en un taller de costura.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el taller de costura de Eugenia quien porta lentes; Vero es quien se encuentra sentada.
texts.en:
