Formed by four women with strong ties of friendship, the Esperanza group comes from the state of Mexico. Their own community differs from nearby communities in that theirs has the necessary services to improve their standard of living. The traditional fiestas are considered a distinctive feature of the local inhabitants who celebrate the Candelaria on February 2nd. This celebration is attended by local people and strangers who come together to enjoy music, dancing, and traditional food.

Sra. Vero is loved and respected by her friends because of her lively, friendly, and enthusiastic character. She works hard always for the wellbeing of her family. She is currently involved with the education of her daughter as she wishes her to take courses that she really enjoys. In order to reach her goals Vero earns her living raising rabbits thanks to one of her daughters who took the initiative of acquiring a pair of rabbits, primarily for food but later for sale. The plan turned out well and now Vero has sixty rabbits in pens next to her house.

Today she has regular customers who know how long it takes to raise rabbits and come to her house once they have reached the ideal stage of development. Normally she has eight or ten customers a week, but at certain times of the year sales increase--for example at Christmas and New Years. She says that her biggest challenge is that the cost of feed varies greatly so she has to adjust prices. Her goals are to improve her house and to continue supporting her daughter who wishes to study communication.

The other members of the group are Sara who wishes to buy lambs, María de los Ángeles who sells traditional food, and Eugenia who is a seamstress.

The photograph was taken in Eugenia's workshop. Eugenia is wearing glasses; Vero is sitting down.

loans.use: buy rabbits

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as dedicated. 

Regina operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

She will use the 30,000 Kes. loan to buy stocks of rice for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to buy additional stock.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy more stock of cereals. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Loleni

texts.en:
This is Loleni, a 53-year-old from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a driver. The couple faces challenges in a developing economy, but they remain steadfast that all will be well as they approach their senior years.

She is thankful that she has a small general store which has helped to support her family for the last seven years. To grow her store, she is in need of funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to increase her inventory of grocery items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, beverages and toiletries to sell. With the increasing population in their town, she is more than happy to serve them with essential food and household items.

Loleni wishes to expand her house and grow her mini-store into a big grocery store someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old, married with six children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from direct selling.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Alh. Yahaya

texts.en:
Alh. Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Yahaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Alh. Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Yahaya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alh. Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bijaylaxmi Group

texts.en:
This group started in the year 2015 at Kandhabrahmani village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are nine active, self-dependent women, with the intention of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Jhuni is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing as the fourth person from the righthand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 40 years old and living with her small family: her husband and two children.

Jhuni has been engaged in the spice business in her own home for the last 10 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 9,500 INR.

Her opinion is that, from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible, so she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

Jhuni planned to purchase turmeric, cardamom, cumin, cloves, red chilis, coriander, ginger, onions, garlic, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to purchase another house and to provide better education to her children.

The other eight members of the group are also smart at their profession and also actively engaged with different businesses like dairy, vegetable vending, seasonal businesses, and goat rearing and selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase turmeric, cardamom, cumin, cloves, red chilis, coriander, ginger, onions, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
From Takeo Province, 33-year-old Sreypov is married and blessed with a dependent son under school age. She earns a living through growing rice and working for a garment factory. She earns about USD 12 per day and can save about USD 3 each day after daily expenses.

Sreypov has been with VisionFund for two cycles already, and past loans have enabled her to meet family needs in a timely manner. She is now requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes to get abundant yields to upgrade their standard of living and to send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so as to send her son to school.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 44 ans, Yawa est une femme qui vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Habitant à Tokoin, Yawa prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Yawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire. Pour commander le sac de maïs et des tas de condiments, Yawa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa, age 44, is married with four dependent children and she lives in Tokoin. Yawa makes a dough called Akpan that she sells in front of her home in an attempt to make good profits. She buys ingredients three times per month at the market.

Yawa is seeking this loan to buy sacks of maize and bunches of condiments. This should bolster her income and allow her to help her husband to provide for their children.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of maize and 2 bunches of condiments.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve, Afi est une femme qui vit à Tonkin avec trois enfants à charge. Agée de 55 ans, Afi achète et revend les poules deux fois par mois au marché. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de poules afin de bien revendre et pouvoir mieux répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Afi is a widow and she lives in Tonkin with three dependent children. She is 55, and she buys and sells hens twice a month at the market. Afi requests this loan to order hens so that she can make good sales and better satisfy her customers' needs. This will give her considerable financial independence to help her children to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy 30 hens.

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en: Sony’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sony makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Wendnonglem-Nooma Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata est mariée. Elle est dans le tricotage et cela fait quelques années qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter de tissus de draps pour tricoté en plus de ça elle veut acheter aussi des pagnes pour vendre. Fatoumata fait tricote très ses draps et aussi vend les pagnes de qualité ce qui fait marcher son activité. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes et de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. c'est ça 1ère fois de prendre le prêt mais elle prend l'engagement de respecter les dates de remboursements.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is married. She works in the knitting trade and she has been working in this business for some years. She needs a loan to buy bed sheet fabric for knitting, and in addition she would like to buy pagnes for resale. Fatoumata knits her sheets and also sell good quality pagnes, which is why her business is doing well. After sales, she will have a profit which will enable her to save some money, to take care of her family and also to continue her business. This is the first time she has taken out a loan, but she has promised to respect the date of repayment.
.

loans.use: to buy bed sheet fabric to knit and pagne suits for  550 000 Fcfa for resale.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Ghania, who is in her early 40's, is married with two schooling children. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now. She works from 9 am to 9 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy supportive working tools in her salon and she has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now doing great. She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in a business and pay school fees.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock working materials and to buy a new hair dryer. She dreams of transforming her business into a retail and wholesale store. Ghania will share this loan with her loan group Imani, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock working materials and to buy a new hair dryer.

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is in her early forties and married with two school-going children. She has been selling charcoal for seven years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily, and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the sacks of charcoal in her store. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with this loan, and she appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now doing great. She used her profit to take care of her family, repay the loan, reinvest in her business and pay school fees.

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock sacks of charcoal at her store. She dreams of transforming her business into a retail and wholesale store.

Mwanaidi will share this loan with her loan group Uhuru, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es: Dúo Kairos Diana de 29 años es madre soltera y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace más de 10 años, su negocio ha sido el sustento de su familia pues con él ha logrado salir adelante. Diana solicita un crédito de temporada para abastecer su local y comprar ropa pues es la temporada que más se vende. Diana espera esta temporada tener grandes ganancias y así poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para los estudios de sus hijos, de un nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Diana from Dúo Kairos is the 29-year-old single mother of three young children.  She has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for more than 10 years.  Her business has supported her family and allowed her to move ahead.  

Diana is requesting a seasonal loan to stock her store and buy clothing since this is the season when it sells the best.  Diana hopes that her profits will be big this season so that she can bring in enough income for the education of her children for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: La Casa Azul Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
La Casa Azul es un grupo originario del Estado de México integrado por personas muy responsables y trabajadoras quienes decidieron fortalecer sus negocios. Los préstamos han sido de gran ayuda ya que  gradualmente han mejorado su calidad de vida.
   Todos quieren y respetan su comunidad pues es muy tranquila y muchos de sus habitantes aún conservan la lengua mazahua, además de las fiestas tradicionales. Pero si algo distingue a la región son sus grandes extensiones de tierra donde cultivan nopales cuya preparación es muy diversa. 
   Hortencia es una de las integrantes más amables, este es su primer préstamo con VFMéxico y está entusiasmada pues desea mejorar su actividad considerablemente. Siempre mantiene un gran espíritu emprendedor y confianza en sí misma lo que la ha llevado a tener buenas satisfacciones. 
   Horte, como le dicen sus conocidos, abrió una tienda de abarrotes desde hace dos años con el objetivo de aportar ingresos en su hogar donde actualmente vive con su madre y una hermana. Parte fundamental para emprender este negocio fue que desafortunadamente su mamá enfermó y necesitaba realizar una actividad que le permitiera cuidar de ella y obtener buenas ganancias al mismo tiempo. Así pues, con ayuda de una pequeña lona y una mesa colocadas fuera de su casa inició vendiendo solamente dulces; afortunadamente el negocio rindió frutos y tiempo después construyó un local donde exhibe todo tipo de productos. 
   Aunque tiene competencia sabe que con base en una excelente atención, precios accesibles y un gran surtido puede aumentar el número de sus clientes. Con la oportunidad de este préstamo comprará productos enlatados, refrescos, leche, azúcar siendo éstos los productos que más vende. “Vienen fechas muy importantes y espero que mis ganancias aumenten pues con eso podría ampliar mi tienda, y lo más importante es que seguiría con el tratamiento de mi mamá” comentó muy contenta. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son: Santos quien invertirá en adornos navideños; Hermelinda, en jitomates y Apolonia, en trastes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Horte quien viste playera color azul.
texts.en:
The community bank La Casa Azul is from Mexico and comprised of very responsible, hard-working people who decided to strengthen their businesses. The loans have been of great help since the members gradually have improved their quality of life.

They all love and respect their community which is very peaceful. Many of the locals still speak the Mazahua language and celebrate traditional feasts. But if anything distinguishes the region it is the great extensions of land where prickly pears are prepared in different ways.

Hortencia is one of the kindest members and this is her first loan through VFMexico. She is excited because she wants to improve her business considerably. She always has a great entrepreneurial spirit and confidence in herself which has given her great satisfaction.

Horte, as she is known by acquaintances, opened her grocery store two years ago with the goal of contributing her income to the household where she currently lives with her mother and a sister. A fundamental part of starting this business was the unfortunate illness of her mother which meant the business had to allow Horte to care for her and earn a good living at the same time. Therefore, with a small awning and a table outside her home she started selling sweets. Fortunately the business took off and some time later she was able to build a shop where she displays her products.

Even though she faces competition Horte knows that through excellent customer service, low prices and a wide variety of goods she can attract more customers. She will use this loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, milk and sugar which are the most popular products. "Very important holidays are near and I hope to increase my profits to expand my store. The most important thing is to be able to continue with my mother's treatment.", she says cheerfully.

The other members of the group are: Santos who will invest in Christmas ornaments; Hermelinda, in tomatoes and Apolonia, in kitchen utensils.

"The photo was taken at Horte's store. She is wearing a blue polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Juliet is 40 years old and has five children are still in school.

Juliet has a bakery shop business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business.

Juliet has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old, single young man from Zarqaa city. His father is retired where he earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Ali is a student at the university, where he studies Marketing. He wants to take the degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

He applied for a loan will help him to pay the university fees for the semester. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to to achieve his dreams

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the semester and take a BA degree in Marketing

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 35-year-old married woman. She used to work as a secretary for a company, but then thought of starting her own business to earn a better income to help her husband in supporting her three kids.

Layla used the money she saved from her work and opened a beauty salon. Using her connections she was able to furnish the salon with the basic equipment at a good price.

Now that her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan in order to replace the old tools with new ones. She also plans to add a section for manicures to better serve the ladies at her salon.

loans.use: to replace her old tools with new ones and to add a section for manicures to better serve the ladies at her salon.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Thaer is a twenty-four-year-old single man living in Mafraq. He’s studying political science to get his bachelor's degree and is in his third year of study to become a public sector employee. His role model in life is his father, who works in public security. Thaer needs the loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and grows kale, maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Akouwa est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Akouwa est une revendeuse de friperies et du charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Akouwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits de friperies et des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre puis de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Akouwa is married with two dependent and she lives in Tokoin. Akouwa sells secondhand clothing and charcoal. She stocks up twice each month at the market and sells her goods in the neighbouring districts. To have a good amount of stock and optimize her profit, Akouwa requests this loan to order units of secondhand clothing, and sacks of charcoal hoping to make good sales and to satisfy her customers' numerous demands. This will enable her to make a profit and to help her children in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy 24 units of secondhand clothing, and four sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata est une veuve femme âgée de 36 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Avec cinq enfants à charge, Fatoumata est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Fatoumata désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des bidons d’huile en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a 36-year-old widow who lives in Tokoin with 5 dependent children. She sells food products that she buys twice a month at the market. She conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor around neighboring districts.

Fatoumata is seeking this loan to buy jugs of oil to sell and bolster her income. This will allow her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 4 jugs of oil.

loans.name: Michatha (B) Organic Farming And Environmental Shg Group

texts.en: The lady raising her hand in the photo is Esther, a member of Michatha (B) Organic Farming and Environmental SHG. She is thirty-two years old and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She keeps poultry as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to run the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chicks, which will help increase her income. This will assist her to cater for her family's needs, such as food and  school fees for her schoolgoing child. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, which will help increase her income.

loans.name: Elicile

texts.fr: Elicile a 35 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants à charge.  Pour trouver de quoi faire vivre sa famille, elle revend des produits alimentaires. Elle installe son stand de marchandises sous la galerie de son domicile. Elle a beaucoup de clients dans le voisinage. Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter des boites de beurre et des gallons d’huile.
texts.en: Elicile is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has two dependent children. In order to support her family, she sells groceries. She opened a stand to sell her products on the covered porch at her home. She has many clients in the neighborhood. With this loan, she will buy boxes of butter and gallons of oil.

loans.use: buy boxes of butter and gallons of oil.

loans.name: Suleyma Vanessa

texts.es: La venta de prendas de vestir le ha permitido a Suleyma sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que cada día pone todo su esfuerzo para que sus ganancias sean mejores. Ella tiene 22 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida que se dedica a la albañilería y su hijo de 1 año de edad, que es su mayor alegría. Suleyma desea construir una pared en su vivienda, ya que las paredes de esta se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared en su vivienda que le brinde mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
The sale of garments has allowed Suleyma to raise her family, which is why each day she makes every effort to ensure that her profits improve. She is 22 years old and lives with her life partner who works in masonry, and her one year old son, who is her greatest joy.

Suleyma wants to build a wall in her home, because the walls are damaged, so she is requesting a laon through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, to build a wall in her home that will give her more security.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, to build a wall in her home that will give her more security.

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his late 30's and married, has two schooling children. He has been a tailor for eight years now. Working from 8 am to 9 pm daily, he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Emmanuel’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans, all of which have been repaid, to buy sewing equipment. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profits to repay his loan, reinvest in his sewing business, cover household expenses and pay school fees to his children.

Emmanuel will use this loan to buy sewing products and the best materials for making the latest styles of suits and dresses. He dreams of building his own house and expanding his business.

Emmanuel will share this loan with his group Kipawa, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products and the best materials for making the latest styles of suits.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en: Guzal was born in 1986. She is married and has three children aged ten, nine and four. She lives together with her family. She started working in farming four years ago. During these four years she has farmed and made a good income. She loves animals and therefore works in animal husbandry too. She has been raising livestock for more than four years. She buys young calves and fattens them over a certain period of time, then resells them at the cattle market. She has been working in this sphere since she was a child and has mastered her trade to the highest level. Her husband works in construction. She wants the loan for payment of rent. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS with this aim. She hopes with your help and mercy she can achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the rental of land.

loans.name: Elwin

texts.en: Elwin, who is 34 years old, is a single entrepreneur from Aurora, Zamboaga del Sur. He makes a living by operating a transportation business, which he started 5 years ago. He now earns 8,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Elwin is borrowing 30,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to obtain accessories and tires and to pay for the permit for running the business. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and Elwin hopes to expand his business and settle down.

loans.use: to purchase pair of tires.

loans.name: Cristie Lyn

texts.en:
Cristie Lyn is a farmer from Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with no children. She has been in the farming business for three years now. This is the main source of her income. She also raises hogs for supplemental income.

Cristie Lyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and feed supplement for her pigs.

With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus augment her harvest and yield. As well, her pigs will grow well, assuring her of good sales in four months.

In the future, Cristie Lyn hopes to make her farming business more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase feed supplement for pigs.

loans.name: Yèrèdon Group

texts.fr:
Sounkalo  est un  membre du groupe  yèrèdon, il est celui qui tient la corne du Bélier sur la photo,. Il fait  l’embouche ovine, âgé de 35 ans, il habite au Mali  et père de 9 enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 2ans  à 16 ans dont(3) trois  fréquente l’école, son épouse   est une ménagère.
Il  exerce ce métier il y a 10 ans et travaille avec le RMCR depuis six ans pas de problème signalé pour ses remboursements antérieures, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité.
Il sollicite un prêt  subséquent  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et   accroitre son activité d’embouche ovine, et les bénéfices tirés de l’activité lui  permettront de prendre  en charge sa famille (santé, éducation, nourriture). Il rêve d’être automne et être utile pour sa famille en particulier mais aussi pour sa communauté en generale.
texts.en:
Sounkalo is a member of the Yèrèdon group, in the photo he is holding the ram's horn. He is a livestock farmer, he fattens up sheep and goats. He is 35 and lives in Mali. He has nine children who are between two and 16 years old. Three of them go to school. His wife is a housewife.

He has been in this trade for 10 years and has been working with the RMCR for six years. No problems with the previous repayments have been noted. He buys his animals at the local markets and sells them at the same place.

He requests a new loan to increase his working capital and expand his sheep and goat fattening business. The profits that he will make will enable him to provide for his family (healthcare, education, food) He dreams of becoming autonomous and useful to his family in particular but also to his community in general.

loans.use: to buy sheep, feed them, and resell them.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Marieta works hard to support her family.

She has a passenger tricycle business in the Philippines. Marieta is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

loans.name: Rataayinga Group

texts.fr: Rabièta est mariée. Elle est dans la vente des produits de la pharmacopée et cela fait quelques années qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des racines pour la préparation des tisanes afin de vendre. Dans son quartier elle est la seule à pratiquer ça ce qui fait que la vente de ses produits marche bien et en plus de cela, elle propose des produits de qualité et très efficace à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. C'est ça première fois mais elle prend l'engagement de respecter les dates de remboursement.
texts.en:
Rabièta is married. She sells materia medica (remedy) products and has been doing this for a few years. She needs to buy roots to make and sell herbal tea.

She is the only person in her neighborhood working in this domain, and therefore the products are selling well. In addition, she offers her clients effective, quality products.

The profits from her sales help her add to her savings, take care of her family, and continue her business. This is her first loan, but she is committed to meeting the repayment dates.

loans.use: buy roots to make herbal tea for 175,000 FCFA.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 51 years old. She lives in a wooden house with with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her three other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2001, Kong was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field, and to extend her lending business.

Thanks to the loan, Kong will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her, so she can keep making beautiful, traditional, hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Zarzamora Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
En el Estado de México es común ubicar comunidades que mantengan  orígenes prehispánicos siendo la cultura mazahua una de las más extendidas en la entidad. Las personas que habitan dicha región se caracterizan por ser amables, responsables, trabajadores y muy alegres. La mayoría se dedica al cultivo de maíz y durante todo el año cuidan y fortalecen la tierra que generosamente les brinda los productos que consideran ancestrales. 
   De allí es originario el grupo Zarzamora cuyo nombre fue elegido por los integrantes pues este pequeño fruto es muy tradicional en la comunidad.  En su lengua materna, la mazahua, se dice “Ro Gu” comentaron. 
   Don Juan es un hombre que condensa todas las cualidades de su comunidad pues es trabajador, amigable, entusiasta y portador de un gran espíritu emprendedor. "Cuando algo se quiere se puede lograr con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo" son las palabras que utilizó como lema. Junto a su esposa Verónica, con quien ha compartido su vida desde hace 21 años, ha formado una familia con seis niños los cuales estudian en distintos grados educativos. De igual forma, se siente muy orgulloso de su hija quien se encuentra estudiando una carrera en contabilidad. 
   Dedicado a la cría de ganado ovino desde hace 10 años, se ha posicionado como uno de los mejores en su comunidad. El proceso de cría dura aproximadamente seis meses y sus clientes principales suelen ser las personas dedicadas a cocinar el platillo tradicional de la región: la barbacoa. Asimismo, trabaja durante todo el año en el cultivo de maíz y avena para por un lado tener el alimento para los animales y por el otro comerciar entre sus vecinos. Don Juan comentó “me gusta mucho mi actividad porque mientras yo trabajo en el campo, mi esposa se encarga de cuidar a los animales y formamos una familia más unida”.
   Con los préstamos adquiridos con VFMéxico ha podido invertir en sus negocios y con ello construyó su casa y un corral más grande para su actividad. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Julia, Daniel, Hilaria y Raúl quienes invertirán en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín municipal, Don Juan viste camisa azul.
texts.en:
In the state of Mexico it is common to find communities that maintain pre-hispanic origins. The Mazahua culture is one of the most extensive of these. The people in that region are characterized as being friendly, responsible, hardworking and very happy. The majority work growing corn, and throughout the year they care for and fortify the soil that generously provides them products they consider to be ancestral.

The Zarzamora [blackberry] group originates from there. Its name was chosen by its members because this small fruit is very traditional in the community. In their native tongue, Mazahua, blackberry is called "Ro Gu."

Juan is a man in whom all the qualities of the community are condensed, as he is hardworking, friendly, enthusiastic, and embodies a great entrepreneurial spirit. "When you want something you can obtain it with great effort and work," are words he uses as a motto. He has shared life with his wife Veronica for 21 years. They have created a family with six children, who attend school in different grades. In that vein, he is very proud of his daughter who is pursuing a degree in accounting.

For 10 years Juan has worked raising sheep. He has positioned himself as one of the best in his community. The sheep raising process lasts approximately six months, and his principal clients tend to be people dedicated to cooking the traditional dish of the region: barbecue. He also works throughout the year growing corn and oats, so that on the one hand he has food for the animals, and on the other, food to trade with his neighbors.

Juan adds "I really like my job because while I work in the fields, my wife takes care of the animals, and we form a more unified family." With the loans acquired through VFMexico he has been able to invest in his businesses and thereafter construct his house and a bigger barn for his work.

The other members of the group are María Julia, Daniel, Hilaria and Raúl, who will invest in sheep.
*The photograph was taken in the municipal garden. Juan is wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy sheep and hay.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Hapa Kazi Tu Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her mid 30's, is single with three schooling children. She has been a food vendor for three months now. She works from 6 am day to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Maria requested her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock the out-of-stock items, buy cooking oil and to add to the sacks of charcoal and rice for her business.

She dreams of opening a restaurant in a near future.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group HAPA KAZI TU, which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock out-of-stock items, buy cooking oil and to add to the sacks of charcoal and rice for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soda and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Stephen will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soda, flour and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soda, flour and other items.

loans.name: Noneta

texts.en:
Noneta is 36 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Noneta requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nenita has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Meet Maher from Hebron city. He is single and has no children. He requested a loan from ACAD to buy some livestock in order to start his own business. In the past, his family used to raise livestock and trade in them. Due to some hard circumstances they stopped the business, and now Maher wants to reopen the business, as he has a lot of experience in this field.

Maher has a disability that challenges his business. But he insists to start this business to improve his standard of living. His main goal for the future is the sustainability of his business. Maher says that there are two main challenges that his business faces. The first one is the fluctuation of livestock prices; the other challenge is the high price of sheep fodder.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep to start his business.

loans.name: Ana Edith

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil casada su esposo es chofer por lo general viaja y está fuera de casa, tienen 4 hijos Alberto de 23, Darío de 19, Wilmer de 17 y Katherine de 12 años edad estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas del sector, es muy alegre, trabajadora  hace más de veinte años vende cosméticos, ropa, también pinta figuras, realiza manualidades, utiliza mucha creatividad  busca la manera para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. Ana necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería surtir su negocio en el que se ocupa las tardes, comprara  materia prima para sus artesanías las que realiza en la noches, con el dinero que generaría de ganancia podría seguir cubriendo los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos, su mayor sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a driver who is usually on the road away from home. They have four children who attend state funded school in the area: Alberto, 23, Dario, 19, Wilmer, 17 and Katherine, who is 12. Ana is very cheerful, and has worked for more than twenty years selling cosmetics and clothing, and she also paints figures and makes crafts. She is very creative in the way she tries to support her children so that they do not lack for anything.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business which she runs in the afternoons. She will buy materials for her crafts which she makes at night, and the money she generates from the profit could continue to cover the costs of food and education for her children. Her biggest dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise and raw material for her crafts.

loans.name: Top Sab Group

texts.en:
Patrick Leo (at the back, extreme left) is a businessman who is practicing produce buying after the resettlement from the LRA insurgence. This helps him to provide a livelihood and basic needs for his school-going children and relatives.

He buys produce from neighboring villages and sells it to other agricultural produce dealers in Lira town.

Patrick Leo has applied for a loan of 700,000 from UGAFODE MICROFINANCE (MDI) to support him in the business. He will buy stock of corn, beans and millet for trade.

He is so grateful to Ugafode and Kiva funders for the assistance. The extra members are members of the group who are saving with the group and waiting to get the loan in the next cycle.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize and beans for trade.

loans.name: Peter Gathundi

texts.en:
Peter is an electrician and also a farmer. He has three cows and is able to make a lot of cow dung, which he uses on his farm for farming, and shares some with neighbours.

He would want to have a biogas system so he can use his cow dung for renewable energy, and also to cut the high cost of cooking fuel and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean renewable cooking.

loans.name: Familia R Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México existe una comunidad de origen mazahua cuyos habitantes son personas muy trabajadoras y entregadas al bienestar de su familia. De igual forma se sienten muy orgullosos ya que mantienen su lengua materna y algunas tradiciones importantes donde realizan bailes y convivencias entre todo el pueblo.  En tanto que su actividad económica principal es el cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales.
   Un ejemplo de estos habitantes es la pareja formada por el matrimonio de Don Gregorio y Doña Zenaida quienes son personas muy alegres, trabajadoras y respetuosas. Esta pareja se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la elaboración de artesanías con resina. En un inicio Gregorio sólo era empleado pero gracias a sus habilidades pudo abrir su propio taller e instruir a su esposa en tan noble actividad.
  De igual forma, seis de sus nueve hijos decidieron seguir sus pasos y actualmente se dedican al oficio de tiempo completo involucrando a sus respectivas parejas. En el taller todos los días se puede observar a la familia crear figuras con base en moldes traídos desde la capital; así pues, realizan elefantes, búhos, cruces, lapiceros, sólo por mencionar algunas piezas. Una vez que la mercancía está lista, Don Gregorio y sus hijos viajan hasta distintas partes de la república para ofrecer sus artesanías y regresan sólo cuando terminar de vender todas las figuras. Existen temporadas en donde la demanda es tal que no les permiten elaborar diseños nuevos pero que sin duda se satisfacen al saber que los clientes están complacidos.
   Por otra parte todos se encuentran muy agradecidos con la oportunidad del préstamo de VFMéxico pues les ha permitido desarrollar el negocio a un nuevo nivel y así mejorar su calidad de vida, en esta ocasión utilizarán el crédito para comprar algunas figuras extra para así tener más variedad de mercancía y completar su propia producción.
texts.en:
In the state of Mexico there is a Mazahua community whose residents are very hardworking and dedicated to their families' wellbeing. They are also very proud because they maintain their mother tongue and some important traditions in which they have dances and get-togethers with the whole town. Their main economic activity is growing corn and raising animals.

One example of the residents is the married couple Gregorio and Zenaida. They are cheerful, hardworking and respectful. For more than 15 years, they have made figurines out of resin. At first, Gregorio was just an employee, but thanks to his abilities, he was able to open his own workshop and teach his wife this noble activity.

In addition, six of their nine children decided to follow in their footsteps and now they work at the trade full time, involving their respective spouses. In the workshop the family can be seen everyday creating figurines based on molds brought from the capital. They make elephants, owls, crosses, and pencil holders, just to mention a few pieces. Once the merchandise is ready, Gregorio and his children travel to different parts of the republic to offer their handmade crafts and they come back only when they finish selling all of the figurines. There are times when the demand is such that they can't make new designs but without a doubt they are satisfied to know that their customers are pleased. They are also very grateful for the opportunity of the loan from VFMéxico. It has allowed them to develop their business to a new level and improve their quality of life. At this time, they will use the loan to buy some extra figurines in order to a larger variety and they will also use it to help complete their own production.

loans.use: to buy and make figurines made from resin.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Helder

texts.es:
Helder con 51 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera,vive casa familiar,junto a sus padres y su hijo,en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se de dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a vender sus cervezas y gaseosas,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 3 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en su negocio en la compra de una mayor cantidad de cajas de cervezas,de paquetes de gaseosas así como para realizar algunos arreglos en su local.

Helder es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Helder is 51 years old and a single mother. She lives in her home with parents and her son in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, and department of Lambayeque, in Perú. 

She has very good references, both personal and work-related, through the people of the area. The residents of this locality mostly work in agriculture, business, and by raising livestock.

Helder works by selling her beers and carbonated drinks. She has more than 3 years' experience in this line of business. 

She is seeking a loan in order to invest in her business so that she can buy more boxes of beer and packages of carbonated drinks, and thus be able to make some improvements to her store. 

Helder is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para invertir en su negocio en la compra de una mayor cantidad de cajas de cervezas,de paquetes de gaseosas así como para realizar algunos arreglos en su local.

loans.name: Enecilia

texts.en:
Enecilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines.

Enecilia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional firewood to resell.

She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Enecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to resell.

loans.name: Kadahoka Group

texts.fr:
Freddy  fait partie du groupe kadahoka  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a  25 ans et est marié à Aline, une commerçante.
Il a sous sa charge 3 personnes membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient.

Il fait le commerce de fruits et de maïs  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de maïs   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait faire le commerce des habits.
texts.en:
Freddy is a member of the Kadahoka Group and lives in Bubanza. He is 25 years old and is married to Aline, a businesswoman.

He has three people he cares for, members of his extended family who are in school.

He has been selling fruit and corn for five years.

He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large supply of corn to resell to make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to have a clothing business.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of corn to resell.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: Luz Mery es una ama de casa, madre de dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Malambo, ella emprendió su propio negocio en el año 2007 con el apoyo de una amiga que la ayudó a incorporarse a una empresa de multinivel, así logró empezar a comercializar fragancias, accesorios, joyas, prendas de vestir y toda propuesta de artículos que exhiba el catálogo que utiliza para realizar su labor preventa.  Luz Mery diariamente está dispuesta a realizar ventas a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y sus principales clientes son sus amigos y vecinos.  Luz Mery realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar fragancias, accesorios, ropa y demás encargos de su clientela. A futuro desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a housewife and mother of two children aged 8 and 12 years old who lives with her husband in a neighborhood of the municipality of Malambo. She launched her own business endeavor in 2007 with the support of a friend who helped her to join a multi-level marketing business for which she has successfully begun selling fragrances, accessories, jewelry, clothing, and everything else available in the catalog she uses to do her work. Luz Mery makes sure she is available to do business between the hours of 8 a.m. and 8 p.m., and her primary clients are her friends and neighbors.

Luz Mery has requested a Kiva loan, an opportunity for her to connect with the financial community through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to purchase fragrances, accessories, clothing, and other catalog items for her clients. In the future she wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, accessories, clothing, and other catalog items for her clientele.

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es: Marco es un experimentado carpintero del municipio de Barranquilla que decidió continuar con el legado de su familia, él es un especialista en la elaboración de alcobas, juegos de comedor, puertas, ventanas y  cualquier tipo de mueble que le soliciten sus clientes. Sus competencias para llevar a cabo su labor con mucha calidad y perfección, la adquirió al trabajar durante años en el negocio de su familia y en el año 2003 decidió independizarse y emprender su propio taller.  En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar maderas, pinturas, sellantes y demás insumos necesarios para realizar una producción de puertas y camas que exhibirá en su taller, de este modo incrementará la venta de productos terminados. Marco es padre de cuatro hijos y reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un humilde barrio del municipio y su principal meta es incrementar su producción y con ello sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marco is an experienced carpenter in the municipality of Barranquilla who has decided to continue with his family's legacy.

He is a specialist in the production of bedroom furniture, dining room sets, doors, windows and any kind of furniture that his clients request. He acquired his ability to carry out his work with much quality and detail during years of work with his family's business. In 2003 he decided to become independent and started his own workshop.

He currently is applying for a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy wood, paint, sealant and other supplies to produce doors and beds that he will exhibit in his shop and in this way increase the sale of finished products.

Marco is the father of four children and lives in the company of his spouse in a humble neighborhood of the municipality and his main goal is to increase his production and doing so increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sealants and other supplies needed to produce doors and beds to exhibit in his shop.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mamadou est le monsieur qui  tient le bélier par sa corne sur la photo. Il est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 38 ans, marié et  Père de 06 enfants, âgés de 1 à  18 ans dont 3  sont scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Mamadou fait  l’élevage des béliers, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter des béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.  Il  exerce ce métier, il y a plus de 12 ans de cela.
Dans ses ventes, il gagne environ  10000 FCFA de profit par Béliers. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille entre autre habillement, frais médicaux et scolaires.  Mamadou est solvable depuis qu’il travaille avec le RMCR.
Dans l’avenir, Mamadou souhaite avoir un prêt  plus  élevé pour acheter beaucoup plus  de béliers afin d’accroitre son profit.
texts.en:
Mamadou is the gentleman holding the ram by the horn in the group photo. He is a Malian who has never attended school. At age 38, he is married with six children ages 1 to 18, three of them in school. His wife is a homemaker.

Mamadou raises rams. He borrows funds through RMCR to buy rams at local fairs that he later sells in the city. He has been practicing this activity for over 12 years.

Mamadou earns a profit of approximately 10,000 FCFA per head sold which helps him to cover some of his family's needs such as clothing, healthcare and tuition fees. Mamadou is a solvent client of RMCR.

In the long term, Mamadou wishes to be able to borrow larger sums in order to buy more rams and bolster his profits.

loans.use: to raise rams to sell.

loans.name: Woro En Ryeko Group

texts.en:
Milly (standing, with raised hand) is a widow. She lost her husband during the Northern Uganda insurgence. Now, she operates a mini-restaurant in a trading centre of Loro in Lira district. This business is her livelihood and pays for school fees for her four school-going children. She applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her expand her business. She is grateful to Kiva partners and funders for their support.

All the group members that appear in the photograph have signed the waiver form, though some of them are still saving and will be ready to take the loan in the next cycle.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant business

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Maimuna, who is in her early twenties, is married with no children. She has been selling honey for two and a half years. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maimuna’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to go upcountry to collect and buy the best honey to sell to many people. She has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great. She used the profit to take care of herself and her husband, to repay loan, to reinvest in her business, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of honey to meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mainuma will share this loan with her loan group Loyola, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her honey inventory to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Sabunyama Group

texts.fr:
SALIMATA  est membre du groupe sabunyuma c’est la dame qui tient la tasse de riz sur la photo. C’est une Malienne non  scolarisée, âgée de 47 ans, ménagère, veuve et mère de 08 enfants âgés de 04 à 28 ans dont 2 fréquentent l’école.  SALIMATOU fait le stockage et le commerce du riz depuis 10 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend son stock de riz dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’elle gagne la permet de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin d’accroitre son revenu. Elle se sent à l’aise dans l’exercice de ce métier car elle trouve que c’est une activité rentable. 
Ayant souvent confronté aux problèmes de mévente, son rêve est de construire une maison en dur pour ses enfants dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Salimata is a member of the Sabunyuma Group. She is the woman holding a bowl of rice in the photo. She is from Mali, has no formal education, and is 47 years old. She is a widowed homemaker and has eight children between the ages of 4 and 28, two of whom go to school.

Salimata has been stocking and selling rice for 10 years. She purchases supplies at the neighboring markets and resells her stock of rice in the same markets. The profits that she makes allow her to meet her children's needs. She is asking for the loan from RMCR to strengthen her purchasing power in order to increase her revenue. She feels at ease in this business because she has found it to be a profitable industry.

Having often been confronted with problems of poor sales, her dream is in the future to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to sell rice for seven months.

loans.name: Panaderas De Cote Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad pequeña del Estado de México se formo un grupo pequeño con el nombre de "Panaderas de Cote" porque elabora un pan muy rico y no solo algunas integrantes del pan elaboran el pan gran parte de la población es su actividad principal, ellos mismo en sus propias casas construyeron su propio horno para elaborar su propio pan. Es una comunidad tranquila lo que la caracteriza su presa enorme porque es muy grande con mucha profundidad ayuda para regar las milpas cercanas ademas de la pesca que practican algunos vecinos de la comunidad.
 Doña Olidia es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora con un gran espíritu emprendedor siempre muy preocupada por el bienestar de su familia ella tiene 29 años de edad esta casada con  Don Víctor desde hace muchos años, juntos han formado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos se encuentran estudiando, tres de ellos son patrocinados por World Visión.
 Ella desde que se caso con Don Víctor decidió ayudar con los gastos de su hogar porque su mamá siempre le aconsejo que emprender algún negocio, la cría y engorda de borregos ademas de elaborar bordados era una muy buena opción porque así no tendría que salir de casa y seguiría cuidando a sus hijos pero al mismo tiempo ayudaría a solventar gastos del hogar.
 Sus boreguitos los compra en la misma comunidad siempre trata de comprarlos pequeños para después crecerlos, criarlos y venderlos entre sus vecinos o cuando se entera que habrá algún tipo de festividad aprovecha y los ofrece con las personas de la fiesta, comenta que en casa los tiene de ocho meses a un año, para poderlos vender y obtener buenas ganancias, en su alimenticio no gasta dinero porque aprovecha del campo desde muy temprano los saca a pastar en el campo "Ahora que ha llegado la sequía es mucho mas fácil porque en los cultivos de maíz ya cosecharon y están cortando el zacate y queda mucho pasto y es lo que podemos aprovechar para los animales" comento muy contenta Olidia.
 Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida con VFMexico y KIVA porque lleva mas de un año solicitando préstamo los cuales le han ayudado hacer crecer su negocio y con sus ganancias puede solventar gastos de educación de sus hijos y en la construcción de su casa, ahora con este nuevo préstamo comprara dos borreguitos pequeños.
 Al parecer no tiene ninguna dificultad siempre trata de cuidar muy bien  a sus animalitos para que tengan un buen crecimiento y desarrollo y así pueda obtener buenas ganancias.
Los integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en becerros, Victoria, Carolina e Hilaria invertirán en pan, Ma Marcela invertirá en ropa.
 *La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín de los arcos del municipio, Doña Olidia es quien tiene la playera azul*
texts.en:
In a little community in the State of Mexico, a small group was formed called "Panaderas de Cote," because the town makes a very rich kind of bread; not just a few members bake that bread but for the great majority of the population, it is their principal activity. In their homes they construct their own ovens to make their own bread. Its a very tranquil community, characterized by its enormous dam, which is so big it can irrigate all the nearby corn fields, and it also provides fishing for some neighbors in the community.

Olidia is a very happy person, a worker with grand entrepreneurial spirit, always very preoccupied for her family's wellbeing. She is 29 years old and has been married to Victor for many years. Together they formed a family with five children; four of whom are studying, and three are sponsored by World Vision.

Since Olidia married Victor, she decided to help with household expenses because her Mother always advised her to start a business, raising and fattening sheep plus creating embroidery. This was a very good option because she would not have to leave home and could continue caring for her children, while at the same time helping cover household expenses.

Olidia buys her little lambs in the same community. She always tries to get them very young, then raise them and sell them to her neighbors, or taking advantage of some type of festival, she offers them to those who sponsor the fiesta. Olidia comments that she keeps the lambs at home between the age of eight months and a year, then she sells them for a good profit. She doesn't have to spend money to feed them since she takes advantage of the countryside. Very early, she takes them out to graze in the country. "Now that the dry period has arrived, it is much easier because with the cultivation of corn, they are harvesting and cutting down the plants and there remains lots of stalks and this is what we take advantage of for the animals," Olidia comments very contentedly.

She is very pleased and grateful for VFMexico and Kiva, because for more than a year, she has requested loans that have helped her expand her business. With her earnings, she can cover her children's educational expenses and help build her house. Now with this new loan, she will purchase two small lambs.

It seems that she will have no difficulty. Olidia always cares for her little lambs very well, so that they will grow and develop and, thus, she can obtain good earnings.

The members of the group include Teresa, who invests in young bulls; Victoria, Carolina and Hilaria, who invest in bread; and Ma Marcela, who invest in clothing.

*The photograph was taken in the municipality's Garden of the Arches. Olidia is wearing the blue blouse.

loans.use: purchase little lambs to raise, fatten, and sell.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de un año, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena personas, amigable y muy respetuosa. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Antonio’ caracterizada por encontrarse sobre la ladera oeste de la ciudad, donde las calles son empinadas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 17 grados centígrados.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hija que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; hamburguesas, sándwich de huevo, pollo frito, salchipapas (salchichas con papas ambas fritas) y otros, “inicié mi negocio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ahora mi negocio genera los ingresos suficientes para mantener a mi familia…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque ella es muy atenta y brinda buen servicio al cliente. La ventaja de su negocio es las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de muebles de comedor. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea comprar sillas para vender comida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para comprar sillas para vender comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a 31 year old woman, she lives with her husband and makes a living by selling food.

She is a good person, friendly and very respectful. She runs her business in the area called "San Antonio" , which is located on the western side of the city, where the streets are steep, the climate is cool and dry and the maximum temperature reaches 17 degrees centigrade.

Juana has a dark complexion, with long black braided hair. She wears traditional attire (hat, blanket and skirt), her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish as a rule and to conduct her business. She shares her life with her husband who makes a living in construction and with her daughter who is still not of school age. They live in a rented room made of brick with a corrugated iron roof and drinking water, electricity and a sewer system. Her business is selling food such as; hamburgers, egg sandwich, fried chicken, fried potatoes with hot dog and other items. "I started my business to help with the household expenses, now my business generates enough income to provide for my family " she says. Her business is successful because she is very dedicated and provides a good service to her customers. The advantage of her business is that her sales are daily, the disadvantage is that she lacks dining room furniture. Her dream is to open a restaurant, she wants to buy chairs so she can sell food. This is the first time that she has applied for a loan with the institution having been in this business for three years.

This is the background to Juana's request for a loan to buy chairs so that she can sell food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chairs so that she can sell food to her customers

loans.name: Hayjar

texts.en:
Hayjar is a 32-year-old married lady. She works in farming on different farms in Dair Alla, where she lives to make some income for the family. Dair Alla is considered one of the underprivileged areas of Jordan.

Hayjar recently started a small home business to earn additional income selling home products. She is applying for a loan in order to add clothing items to her inventory, as there are no clothes or home products shops in their area, so she decided to sell those items from her home.

loans.use: to begin selling clothing items in addition to her home products sales.

loans.name: Raksmi

texts.en:
Raksmi is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 18 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her 20 years old sister, her 15 years old brother, and her parents. Her brother is studying, and her sister and her parents work in the fields. Her family owns six hectares of rice fields and two hectares of cassava fields.

In 2013, Raksmi was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Raksmi makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her parents cover fees related to the fields.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and the preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.en:
Felizardo is 39 years old and married. He lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. Felizardo owns and operates a transportation service, which he has been doing for many years. He supports the family's daily needs with this business.  

Felizardo requested a loan, which he will use to repair his motorcycle and replace a set of tires. Some of the proceeds will used to buy feeds for his pigs. He plans to buy another sidecar for his motorcycle to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be crop diseases. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hannah Wambui

texts.en: Hannah is a farmer who is also employed as an assistant in a local school.  She has been looking forward to having a biogas system but her income is not enough to buy the system.  With this loan she will be able to get clean, renewable and reliable cooking energy.

loans.use: To buy a bio-digester for clean convenient cooking.

loans.name: Soroyiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
PROFIL DU GROUPE SOROYIRIWATON (1397)
SALIMATA est la Dame qui a sa main sur le sac de riz sur la photo. Elle est Malienne non scolarisée, âgée de 38 ans, ménagère, mariée et mère de 03 enfants âgés de 20 à 12 ans dont 2 fréquentent l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur.
SALIMATA exerce l’activité de stockage du riz depuis 10 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne sur le marché rural et revend ses articles dans les marchés environnant. Le profil qu’elle gagne la permet d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leur famille.
SALIMATA emprunte de l’argent avec le RMCR pour pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir d’achat de riz afin d’accroitre son revenu. Elle se sent à l’aise dans l’exercice de ce métier car c’est une activité bien rentable. SALIMATA est solvable ; elle travaille avec le RMCR depuis 9ans
Ayant souvent confronté aux problèmes de mévente, son rêve est de  construire une maison en dur pour sa famille avec le profit de son activité.
texts.en:
Profile of the Soroyiriwaton Group (1397)

Salimata is pictured with her hands on the sack of rice. She is from Mali and never went to school. She is 38 years old, married, a housewife, and the mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 20. Two of her children go to school. Her husband is a farmer.

Salimata has been storing rice for 10 years. She buys her supplies at the rural market and sells her goods in neighboring markets. The profits that she earns will allow her to help her husband meet their family's needs.

Salimata borrows money from RMCR so that she can buy more rice and grow her revenues. She feels good about working in this domain as it's rather profitable. Salimata is debt-free and has been working with RMCR for 9 years.

Having dealt with frequent slumps in sales, her dream is to build a permanent home for her family with the profits from her business.

loans.use: store rice and then sell it.

loans.name: Estela Guadalupe

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive Estela es muy humilde y sencilla, y en ella vive con su hijo de 1 año de edad al que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Ella tiene 20 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios varios, desde hace 2 años, para sacar adelante a su hijo, y tratar de brindarle lo mejor. Estela desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, el cual se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, cemento, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Estela's house is very humble and simple. She lives there with her one-year-old son, who she supports as a single mother. She is 20 years old and she has been making a living offering her services for the past two years in order to support her son and try to provide him with the best.

Estela wants to change the roof on her home, which has deteriorated. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal, cement, poles and pins to change the roof on her home.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, poles and pins to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Arlyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers for her rice retailing business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like condiments, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like condiments, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Jennifer is 18 years old, pictured next to her mother. She is the daughter of Lucila and the third of eight children in the family. Her mother Lucila supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jennifer is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in her first year of this 4-year course.

Lucila is borrowing PHP 5,300 to pay for tuition fees of her daugther for the second semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Jennifer plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Dorlyn Liv

texts.en:
Dorlyn Liv is a married woman with one child in school. She is 26 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dorlyn Liv has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines. Dorlyn Liv requested a PHP 29,000.00 loan through NWTF to buy stock of beverages to sell.
