Dorlyn Liv has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Dorlyn Liv would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of beverages to sell

loans.name: Ximena Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos Brayan de 19 años  trabaja como albañil no pudo continuar estudiando por la falta de dinero, Steven de 16 años, Alejandro de cinco estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas, Sebastián de una año permanece junto a su madre mientras ella maquila chaquetas este es el único ingreso con el cual puede alimentar a sus hijos. Isabel necesita el dinero para  comprar hilos, hilazas, cierres por mayor, bajando sus costos e incrementado sus ganancias generando mejores ingresos para poder seguir cubriendo las necesidades basicas  de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 36 years old, she is a single mother to four. Brayan is 19 years old and works as a bricklayer. He was unable to continue attending school due to lack of money. Steven is 16 years old and Alejandro is five, both attend school for free. Sebastian is one year old and he stays with his mother while she makes jackets.

This is the only income she has to feed her children. Isabel needs the money to buy thread, yarn and clasps in bulk, which will lower her costs and increase her earnings. This will generate a larger income so she can continue providing the basic necessities to her children.

loans.use: to buy thread, yarn and clasps in bulk.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is 33 years old and married with a child. The child is 6 years old and he studies in primary school. His wife is a nurse. Hamza is an IDP (İnternally Displaced Person) from Füzuli city. He now lives in Baku region with his family. He has been in the repair-construction business for 4 years and loves to do his job. Today he needs his first loan of 1,800 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy new instruments for improving his business. He wants to increase his business and earn more money for his family. In the future he wants to give his child a good education. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for helping him.

loans.use: to buy new instruments for his business.

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.en:
Bahtiniso is a capable woman. She is married and has three children. She has been busy with a farming business during some years. She grows a variety of vegetables on land that is rented.

Bahtiniso is looking for a loan to enlarge her business. She is going to use the loan for the land's rent, and to buy fertilizers and seeds.

She believes that by increasing her farming business, she will increase her income. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS with this aim. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy some seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay for the land's rent.

loans.name: Mabibo Sokoni Group

texts.en:
Regnard, who is in early 40s, is married and has five children. Two are still at school, and the rest are grown up. He has been running a butcher shop for four years. He works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Regnard's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase items in his butcher shop, and he has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great now. He used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayments, and to renovate his own house.

He will use his new loan to increase the stock of meat and to buy supportive working equipment. He dreams of expanding his business and renovating his working place.

Regnard will share this loan with his loan group, "Mabibo Sokoni," which has four members. They will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of meat and to buy supportive working equipment for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 32 years old and both her children are in school.

Maricel has a transportation business in the Philippines. Maricel has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a PHP 10,000.00 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to maintain her transport business vehicle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and 53 years old. She has three children. One of her children is still in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her business.

Marilyn has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Yedida

texts.en:
Yedida is a 57-year-old widow living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop that sells sugar, soap, sauce pans and other items, and she loves her business. As a widow she has managed to look after her family and has been in this business for over nine years. She started by saving small amounts of money from her produce store, and now dreams of starting a boutique.

She requests a loan to buy sugar, soap and clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a single lady without children. She lives in her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense are inventory stock purchases.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic retail shop business.  She faces a major challenge of having sufficient working capital in her business. Mwanamina dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics inventory,  including hair chemicals, sprays,lotions,braids and creams for resale. She really needs this loan to keep her business up and operating.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a hardworking youth who is the sales manager for a big hardware company. He also features as one of the drivers for the Hardware where he rents his vehicle to the company and he is paid both as a driver and a vehicle owner.

He partially purchased this vehicle from a friend but he still has a balance of 5,000,000 UGX to clear it fully. Andrew has therefore approached UGAFODE Microfinance for funding to complete this payment.

Due to his character and relationship with UGAFODE as a saver, he will service his loan well while also improving his standard of living. His children will survive the recurrent morning rains while going to school and Andrew will also be efficient in service delivery therefore increasing his sales.

loans.use: to pay off his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar

texts.en:
Attention to detail, dedication, and passion for her work are what drive Shamim to succeed. She is a 35-year-old woman who makes traditional woven clothing. Her husband is also involved in this work, and is a very hardworking person. She and her husband work every day for the sake of their family. They live in a community in Multan, Pakistan.

Nothing is more important to Shamim than her two children, one of whom attends school. They are why she is always seeking to develop her business. Her main source of income comes from her business, weaving traditional clothing.

In order to continue her success, she is now requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use it to buy materials such as threads, dyes in different colors and a power loom.

Shamim and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender’s and BRAC Pakistan for helping them with this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy materials such as threads, dyes in different colors, and a power loom for her husband and herself.

loans.name: Karuta

texts.en:
Karuta is married and has six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits like mangos, bananas, oranges and passion fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits like mangos, bananas, oranges and passion fruit for resale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 33 year-old widow living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She has been running an embroidery business for 5 years to meet the other household expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations her business has increased. She is brave woman.

Shabana buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. Shabana has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profits for her family.

She has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Shabana requested a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market. She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have them in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Shabana humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.
Shabana and her family will be thankful to Kiva, lender’s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw material for her business.

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Esther who is in her mid thirties is single with two schooling children. She has been running a beauty salon with cosmetics products for ten years now. She works from 8.30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
   
This will be Esther’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the salon products, started selling cosmetics and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She appreciates Kiva for supporting their group. She used the profits she earned to pay school fees, to repay her loan, to pay office and residential rents and to reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to buy first class salon products and the latest cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of having a big salon business and to go out of the country to collect salon products.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group Sungu Chini which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy first class salon products and the latest cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is managing her meat shop business. Aside from this, she also has a barbecue stand in the market, where she sells a variety of grilled meat, hot dogs and much more.

Her income from the business serves to provide their daily household expenditures. Lenita wants to expand the business to enable her to reach and serve more customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy raw meat, eggs, hot dogs and ingredients for her barbecue business.

She is doing her business to manage the business well and maintain it for a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, eggs, hot dogs and ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and married with five children. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, etc.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Aileen has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 56 años de edad de estado civil viuda, tiene 2 hijos Anderson de 28 años y Alexander de 25 años  ellos le ayudan a su madre  en su pequeño negocio ya que  no encuentran trabajo, es muy responsable desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar vendiendo papas por las diferentes calles, hace 2 años vende en el bar estudiantil alimentos que ella madruga a preparar, frutas, cereales, etc.  Este ha sido su único sustento para su hogar desde que enviudo Yolanda con el dinero comprara algunos productos que le faltan incrementando su negocio, adquiriendo ganancias para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades básicas de su familia, su mayor anhelo es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and a widow. She has two children: Anderson, who is 28, and Alexander, who is 25. They both help out their mother with her small business because they can't find work.

She is a very responsible woman. At fifteen, she started working selling potatoes around the neighborhood. Now and for the past two years, she sells food at a school cafeteria. She gets up early in order to prepare the fruit, cereal, etc. This has been her household's only source of income ever since her husband passed away.

Yolanda will use the money from this loan to buy some of the products she needs for her business. She wants her business to increase and to make higher profits so that she can continue to support her family. Her greatest desire is to own a home one day.

loans.use: to stock up on the products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Juster

texts.en:
Juster is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Juster dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, maize and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 35 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She maintains her household activities properly.

Sana has been running a beauty salon for the last four years. She is a well trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients is increasing day by day. She requires some beauty salon items such as facial creams, combs, furniture, brushes, machinery, etc. So Sana applied for the loan through Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued her a loan.

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
A resident in Kandal province, Sreyroth, aged 29, is married with a dependent son under the school-age. She grows rice and works for a garment factory to make a living. Earning about 10 USD per day, Sreyroth can manage to save about 4 USD each day. 
This is the second cycle for her with VisionFund. Her past loan has enabled her to make a better living. She decided to apply for a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes that she will get more rice yields to send her son to school and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to get more rice yields to send her son to school.

loans.name: Olivin

texts.fr: Olivin a 32 ans. Il vit en union libre et a deux enfants sous sa responsabilité. Il a une petite épicerie où il vend des produits alimentaires variés. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour acheter un stock cube d’assaisonnement.
texts.en: Olivin is 32 years old. He is in an common-law union and has two children whom he cares for. He has a small spice shop where he sells various groceries. He needs a loan to buy a supply of bouillon cubes.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bouillon cubes.

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
Atuganile, who is in her early thirties is single with one child who is in school. She has been selling clothes for three years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Atuganile’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the clothes stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group which is doing great. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy a new stock of clothes to sell during the Christmas season. She dreams of expanding her business by opening another clothing shop.

Atuganile will share this loan with her loan group, Safari, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Rosario Alicia

texts.es:
Rosario continúa con su negocio de venta de papa. El crédito anterior lo utilizó para comprar papa por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque tuvo buenas ventas. Actualmente su negocio mejoró las ventas, pudo ofertar a buen precio y eso atrajo a más clientes, “las ventas siguen buenas y espero que así continúen…” cometa. Su negocio es exitoso porque los precios son accesibles. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con nuevos clientes, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería. Su sueño es vender por mayor papa y verduras, ella desea comprar papa y verduras por mayor para mejorar las ventas de fin de año. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosario solicita un préstamo para comprar papa y verduras por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Rosario is still in business selling potatoes. She used her previous loan to buy her product wholesale. She made all of her payments on time because she made very good sales. Her business improved because she was able to offer better prices and that attracted more customers. "Sales are good and I hope things will stay that way," she says.

Her business is successful because her prices are affordable. Her main advantage is that she now has new customers, which brings about the disadvantage of not having enough product to meet their needs. For this reason, Rosario is requesting a new loan to buy wholesale potatoes and vegetables and meet the season's high demand.

Her goal is to further improve sales by the end of the year. This is her second loan through Kiva, and she has been in this business for thirty years.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Grizilda

texts.en:
Grizilda is 59 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Grizilda has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Grizilda requested a loan of 10,000PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

Grizilda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Grizilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with three children. She rents a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition, she operates a cereal selling business that earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to becoming a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Jaqueline

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su experiencia y el delicioso sabor de sus productos. Gloria vive  junto a su compañero de vida, en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años, luego de criar a sus hijos, ellos viven solos pero muy felices juntos. Gloria desea invertir en mayor cantidad de materia prima para que su panadería sea más productiva, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, entre otros productos para aumentar la producción y venta de la panadería.
texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman who works making and selling bread. She has operated this business for 15 years and has manged to get her family ahead with it, thanks to her experience and the delicious taste of her products. Gloria has lived together with her life companion in a house that she owns for a number of years. Since her children have grown they have lived there alone but very happy together.

Gloria wants to invest in a greater quantity of raw material so that her bakery is more productive. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in flour, sugar, yeast and milk amongst other products to increase the productivity and sales of her bakery.

loans.use: to invest in flour, sugar, yeast and milk amongst other products to increase production and sales at her bakery.

loans.name: Efrenita

texts.en:
Efrenita is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Efrenita requested another loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as coffee, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, juice, beers, noodles, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as coffee, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, juice, beers, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El señor tiene 51 años de edad esta separado y tiene un hijo de dieciocho años de edad, trabaja como chofer de transporte de carga.
Padece de hipermetropía, se ha realizado diferentes estudios para saber si es candidato a una cirugía para corregir este padecimiento refractivo con el cual nació, actualmente es candidato a esta cirugía sin embargo sus recursos no son suficientes para poder solventarla. Le urge este tratamiento ya que por su trabajo corre el riesgo de sufrir un accidente.
texts.en:
This man is 51 years old, is separated, and has one 18-year-old son. He works as a driver in freight transportation.

He suffers from hyperopia and has undergone different tests to see if he is a candidate for surgery to correct this refractive problem that he was born with. Currently he is a candidate for the surgery, however, he does not have the funds to be able to cover the cost. The treatment is urgent for him due to the fact that he runs the risk of getting into an accident in his work.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta Ella es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 52 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la confección de ropa.
El crédito que doña María recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para sus tejidos y en materiales para confeccionar ropa, ya que gracias a Dios doña María es bien conocida en el lugar por el buen trabajo que hace y por la atención que le da a sus clientes.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y a sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre los dos se están ayudando para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de güipiles para sus clientes asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos para vender.
texts.en:
María Antonieta comes from the town of Tecpan. She is 52 years old. In her care are her two children. She makes a living making traditional fabrics by hand, and making clothing.

Doña María used the loan she received to buy raw materials for her traditional fabrics and materials for making clothing. Thanks be to God, doña María is well know in the area for the good work that she does and for the service she provides to her customers.

Thanks to her children and to the support of her husband, she keeps going with her business. Between the two of them, they are helping each other to move forward.

Her dream is to expand her business, to offer other styles of güipiles [traditional tunics] to her customers. This way she will obtain better profits to send her children to school and buy raw materials for making traditional fabrics to sell.

loans.use: to buy provisions for the making of traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Karmel Group

texts.en:
Femina, 21, and Ariance, 40, live close. They joined the existing group named Karmel to get a loan for their business improvement. Femina (on the left side in the grey shirt) lives with her husband Antonius, 29, and a toddler, Ryan. Femina works at a bread store in the morning. She and Antonius also manage a plot of land owned by a landlord for farming corn. They have been running this for two years.

However, they also have to share the profits with the landlord from selling the harvest and reimburse money spent by the landlord to buy the seed and fertilizer. It is impacting the income they earn. Femina plans to buy more seeds and fertilizer. She is sure the loan provided by Kiva through TLM is the best chance for her business and living.

Femina and Ariance requested a loan totaling IDR 4,000,000. Just like Femina, Ariance also wants to use her portion of the loan for business and other interests.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora casada de 50 años, esta preocupada por su esposo ya que fue diagnosticado con cálculos biliares, debido a esto su esposo  sufre de fuertes dolores en la parte derecha de su abdomen, fiebre alta y su piel ya muestra un color amarillento. Le urge una operación ya que su estado de salud es complicado.
texts.en:
This 50-year-old woman who is married. She is worried about her husband as he was diagnosed as having gall stones.

As a result of this, her husband suffers intense pain on the right side of his abdomen, a high fever, and his skin has taken on a yellowish color. He needs urgently an operation as his state of health has been complicated.

loans.use: to pay for a vesicular operation.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 26 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Rhodora works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, and other groceries. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rhodora has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose Dite Benette

texts.fr: Rose a augmenté son stock de bonbons et de biscuits à l'aide du crédit précédent. Elle a légèrement augmenté ses vente pendant le début de la réouverture des classe en septembre dernier. Elle veut continuer à faire avancer son activité grâce au microcrédit.
texts.en: Rose increased her stock of candy and cookies with the help of her previous loan. She made a small increase in sales during the beginning of the new school year last September. She would like to continue to expand her business through microcredit loans.

loans.use: to buy a stock of candy and cookies.

loans.name: Zoila Consuelo

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Al Poder se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila tiene 74 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun vive con ella.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así poder salir adelante, hace mas de 30 años emprendió un negocio en su casa, allí los fines de semana vende deliciosos  ceviches de pescado o camarón platos que son muy apetecido por  personas de la localidad que visitan su local, de esta forma ella logra ganarse lo suyo que le permiten salir adelante y mas haciendo algo que a ella le encanta como lo es la cocina. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y todo lo necesario para preparar este delicioso plato. Ella lleva 8 años en  el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por el orden, puntualidad y por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son salir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Al Poder" communal bank meets every fortnight in Cascol in Pajan Canton. This canton is known as the livestock area of the province. One of its’ attractions is the Montubio rodeos that are organized at different times during the year. 

Zoila lives in this place. She is 74-years old. Her husband passed away a number of years ago and she was left a widow. But from this relationship she has four adult children. One daughter still lives with her.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn her own living to get ahead. More than 30 years ago, she started a business in her house. During the weekends, she sells delicious fish or shrimp ceviches enjoyed by people of the locality who visit her place. This is the way she managed to earn a living, allowing her to get ahead by doing something she loves such as cooking. 

This loan is for buying fish, shrimps and all that is necessary to prepare this delicious dish. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it for the order, punctuality and the benefits offered by this institution. Her dreams are to get ahead and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is a very kind and responsible woman. She has three children. For 20 years she has been in a business field. She understood that farming and animal husbandry could bring a good profit. She grows a variety of vegetables and crops on one hectare of rental land. Khosiyat works from early morning till late evening. She gets additional profit from animal husbandry.

She must pay rent for the land and that’s why she needs money. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni for this aim. She hopes with your help and your mercy she will reach her goal.

loans.use: To pay for the rental land

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a very kind and responsible woman. She was born in 1966. She is married and she has three children.

Muhabbat started working in the agricultural sphere 15 years ago. She deals with animal husbandry and farming. She sows wheat and onions. Her husband helps her in this sphere.

She wants to be able to buy the best products so that her plants will grow healthy and her harvest is good. Her short-term goal is to increase production. She wants to use the loan for buying seeds, fertilizer and other products. She needs to borrow some money so she is asking for a loan of TJS 6,000 with this aim.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Maria Librada

texts.en:
Maria Librada is a married woman with five children. She is 41 years old and four of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maria Librada has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Maria Librada requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Maria Librada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and widowed with one child. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for eight years. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years Nancy has sold clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her challenge in this business is the high cost of transportation.

Nancy decided to join Kiva's field partner Yehu so as to access loans for her business. She has applied for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more bales of clothes to sell. Her dream is to have her own shop someday.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kadyrkul

texts.ru: Кадыркул успешно погасил свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Он благодарен Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 20 овец, на ежедневной основе продает молоко. На 10,0 Га земли Кадыркул выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, он вновь обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого домашнего молока. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, он будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Kadyrkul successfully repaid his loan, using it for its designated purpose. He is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with his financing.

Currently, Kadyrkul's farm has a cow and 20 sheep, and he sells milk on a daily basis. On 10 hectares of land, Kadyrkul grows clover for on-farm use and resale.

In order to further develop and expand his business, he has once again applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase his volume of organic milk for sale. He will use the income from running his business to continue expanding it.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow to increase his amount of organic milk for sale.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Iván y su familia son originarios de la misma comunidad en donde viven, Las Piedras, y aunque se conocen de toda la vida ellos se conformaron como familia hace poco más de tres años.
Cuando Iván  tenia 18 años empezó a tener problemas de salud teniendo como consecuencia la perdida de la audición, a la fecha para poder escuchar necesita de aparatos auditivos.
Por su parte  Maricela, sufre problemas de nervios y dificultad para caminar debido a que hace 8 años cuando se dirigía a su trabajo, sufrió un accidente automovilístico, esto le impide trabajar y por determinación de la ley tuvo que ser pensionada.
Para Iván y Maricela, la posibilidad de contar con su casa propia representa una gran oportunidad de vida que les llevará a tener una vida mejor, pues a pesar de las dificultades que ambos sufren, su esfuerzo, su valor y sobre todo el amor que muestran el uno al otro están seguros  les permitirá sobrepasar cada obstáculo que se les presente.
Hace 10 meses que llegó su primer hijo y desde entonces el  objetivouna de tener casa propia se volvió prioridad.
Iván está estudiando  educación media superior (preparatoria) y espera en un tiempo no muy lejano poder tener una carrera profesional que les brinde mayores.
Ambos cuentan con el apoyo de sus familias y están seguros que lograrán hacer de sus sueños una realidad pues sus limitaciones no significan un impedimento para vivir como Dios manda.
Por ahora Maricela además de tener su ingreso por la pensión se dedica a vender productos de belleza pues cree que el tener un ingreso extra es necesario para construir su casa como la han soñado. Les gusta su comunidad por la tranquilidad y la relación familiar que guardan con la mayoría de la comunidad. Ayúdalos a construir este sueño, y brindarle a su hijo un hogar.
texts.en:
Ivan and his family are originally from the same community where they live, Las Piedras, and although they have known each other for their whole lives they became a family just over three years ago.

When Ivan was 18 he started having health problems and as a result he lost his hearing, and he now needs to use hearing aids. Maricela suffers with nerve problems and difficulty walking, because eight years ago on her way to work, she suffered a car accident. This prevents her from working and by law she had to go on pension.

To Ivan and Maricela, the possibility of having their own home represents a huge life opportunity that will allow them to have a better life. In spite of the difficulties they both suffer, they are confident that their effort, courage, and especially the love they show each other, will enable them to overcome every obstacle that comes their way.

They had their first child 10 months ago, after which home ownership became their main priority.

Ivan is studying upper secondary education (high school) and hopes in the not too distant future to have a professional career that will provide him more opportunities.

Both have support from their families and are sure that they will achieve their goals, as their limitations are not an impediment to live as God wills.

For now Maricela, in addition to her income from pensions, sells beauty products because she believes that having an extra income is needed to build her home as she has dreamed. They like their community for its tranquility and friendliness. Help them build this dream, and give their child a home.

loans.use: to give his new born a proper home full of love.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 53 years old and is married. She has four children, and only her youngest child is now attending school since three are already finished their studies.

Eva wanted to bestow her child's needs immediately and to push her child to study hard and finish the college level of education. She also wants to extend her business to gain more and to have a budget that is enough to sustain their needs.

While waiting for her customers to buy the meat, frozen foods, and rice grain that she sells, Eva thought about how to earn another source of income. She come up with the decision to raise hogs.

With this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy piglets to raise. Eva would be happy if her child will become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 48, lives in Kampong Speu province with her husband and four children, one of whom lives at home and is still in school. For the past twenty years her husband and she have been farming rice to earn a living. Garment factory work also adds to their income. The family earns about 12 USD daily and can manage to put aside about 8 USD of it each day.

Sokha has taken out and successfully repaid three previous loans through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. Her living conditions have been improving, and now she is applying for a 400 USD loan to pay for her son’s tuition. She hopes that his studies in electronics will get him a well-paid job.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her son to study electronics.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo, 26, is a friendly young woman and a careful mother of two children. Her husband deals in animal husbandry. She started farming seven years ago on three hectares of land she rented. Since then she has developed a good amount of knowledge through her work.

Shahlo has applied for an 8,000 TJS loan through Kiva's field partner Imon International. She will use it to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs as well as pay for hired workers. She wants to make sure all the work is done well. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs as well as pay for hired workers.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 42 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school and relies on her. She lives in Kampong Speu province, where growing rice and working as a government officer earn income to support a living. She earns about USD $9 per day and can save about USD $6.50 each day after daily expenses.

She has borrowed with VisionFund Cambodia three times already, and those past loans have helped her better meet family needs and buy school supplies. This time, she is asking for a loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter. She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to pursue a Bachelor of Medicine Sciences degree so that she can get a good job after graduating from university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter who is studying Bachelor of Medicine Sciences.

loans.name: Sonia Yolanda

texts.es: Sonia vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus padres y su hija de 10 años de edad, a la que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Ella tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos, además se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras por mayoreo, y para invertir en mayor cantidad de productos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en frutas y verduras por mayoreo y mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito anterior Sonia logro invertir en productos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Sonia lives in a house on her property with her parents and 10-year old daughter, who she is raising as a single mother. She is 27-years old and works selling food. She has done this job for 15 years, so she has many customers who want her products. She also works selling fruits and vegetables wholesale. To invest in a larger quantity of products, she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables and improve her business. With the previous loan, Sonia managed to buy products to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables and improve her business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a housewife, a 54-year-old young lady living with her husband and with nine children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Shamim is responsible for the daily chores of the household, while her older son is the breadwinner for the family and is very hardworking and passionate man about his work.

Her son has been running an academy for three years now. It is very well known for its results, even in faraway areas, and it is quite profitable. But due to lacking the savings he had, her son is unable to buy the furniture he needs for his academy.

That is why Shamim applied for the loan, so that the difficulty her son is facing during his classes could be resolved. Shamim is sure that her son, by merely his hard work, would be able to return the loan money. She is thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her son's academy.

loans.name: Dúo Pan Del Saber Group

texts.es: Este dúo está conformado por Angelina es originaria de Sumpango, es casada y madre de familia Angelina  es proveedora de medicina natural, además es tejedora de blusas típicas así como también de fajas típicas, las personas la llegan a buscar a su casa para poder comprarle medicina, por lo que necesita de un crédito ya que es para poder comprar mas mercadería medicina natural y compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos tipicos, ya que gracias a su negocio a sacada adelante a sus hijos, promete pagar puntualmente en cada pago ya que es el tercer crédito que solicita y en los anteriores a pagado puntualmente.
texts.en: Angelina is one of the members of this duo. She is from Sumpango, is married and a mother. Angelina is a natural medicine provider and also weaves traditional blouses and belts. People go to her house to buy medicines and she needs a loan to purchase more traditional medicines and raw materials for making traditional garments for sale. She has been able to get her children ahead thanks to her business. She promises to repay her loan on time. This is her third loan and she has repaid all of them on time.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional garments for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida,ella prepara diversos platos de comida como arroz con pollo, estofado y lomo saltado, que son comidas muy populares. Esta actividad lo realiza muchos años y sus ganas de salir adelante la impulsan a trabajar día a día por su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar carne, aceite, papa y platos.
La socia está satisfecha y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en: Maria Elena continues working in her business selling food. She prepares various dishes such as chicken and rice, stew and beef stir-fry which are very popular foods. She has done this job for many years and her desire to get ahead pushes her to work every day for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy meat, oil, potatoes, and plates. She is happy and thanks the Kiva investors for continuing to believe in her and she promises to meet her dues within the established time.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, potatoes, and plates.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil divorciada, vive con sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio y su madre  de avanzada edad, hace 20 años empezó a trabajar preparando uno de los platos típicos de la región cerdo  hornado,  el día que más vende es el día domingo desde las seis de la mañana,  esta actividad le ha permitido sacar a sus hijos adelante cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Rosa necesita el dinero para comprar vajilla, ollas a presión,  una cocina industrial que le permitirá realizar más rápido su trabajo  mejorando la atención obteniendo mayores ingresos para seguir cubriendo los principales gastos.
texts.en: Rosa is 41-years old and divorced. She lives with her two children, who help her in the business, and her elderly mother. 20 years ago she began to work preparing one of the traditional foods from the region: baked pork. She sells the most on Sundays, from 6AM. This job has allowed her to support her children and cover the basic needs of the family. Rosa needs the money to buy dishes, pressure cookers and an industrial stove which will allow her to do her job more quickly, improving the attention and getting a better income to keep covering the basic expenses.

loans.use: to buy dishes, pressure cookers and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child. She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of eggs to resell.

Virginita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Msigani Group

texts.en:
Consolata, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children. She has been running a cosmetics shop for five years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy some new, updated cosmetics and restocked her shop to meet customer demand. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is now proceeding well. She used her profit to take care of her family, repay the loan, reinvest in business, and pay school fees.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items at her cosmetics store. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale store.

Consolata will share this loan with the other member of her loan group, Msigani Group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items at her cosmetics store.

loans.name: Muhriddin

texts.en:
Muhriddin has dreamed of becoming an economist since childhood. He is reaching his goal. He is studying at the Tajik State University of law, business and politics (TSU LBP) and he is a third year student.

His parents do not work and it is hard for him to pay University fees. He is a very kind and bright boy. He is well-bread boy. He is studying very well and receiving good marks. He participates in a lot of circles.

He is asking for a loan of 3,600 Somoni. He hopes with your help and mercy he will be able to pay the University tuition and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephine is in her early 50s and married with four children, two of whom are still in school and two of them are grown up. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 4am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Josephine’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her drinks stock and to buy spirits and wine to meet her customers’ requirement. She has managed to pay back her previous loan successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to take care of her family, to repay loans and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the best selling drinks for the grocery store. She dreams of owning a food shop.

Josephine will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling drinks in the grocery store

loans.name: Maadurga Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 nine self-dependent women of Jurkabhata, Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social employment by taking loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Priyatama is the most active and energetic lady of the village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. This outstanding lady is aged about 31 years and is standing third from right with her hand raised in the photo. She is a joyful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of herself, her husband and two daughters.

For the last seven years, Priyatama has been engaged in a business of goat-rearing and selling with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs.8,500 from her business. But this income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her production through a loan. She will purchase four or five goats.

Through this loan, Priyatama hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her two daughters and re-construction of a good house.

The other eight members of the group are also engaged in various small businesses and trades such as masons, vegetable cultivation and selling, goat rearing and selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase four or five goats.

loans.name: Bije's Group

texts.en:
Bije, standing on the right hand side in the photograph, lives with her son and daughter aged 10 and 8 years. Four years back her husband passed away in an accident. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her.

In those days she was tending two cows so she managed to support her family by selling milk but that was not sufficient. Two years back she started a food stall in her house. The smell of her cuisine attracts customers to her shop. She makes delicious, mouth-watering caramel pudding and paranthas in her shop.

Bije has a plan to have a new product line by adding milk, curd, ice creams, butter, and other milk products to her inventory. Along with her group member, she has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing milk products and a freezer for keeping those milk products.

Bije wants her son to graduate from a good college and to save some money for her daughter’s marriage. Bije is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase  milk products and a freezer for keeping those milk products.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is maize farmer from Anchau Gari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdullahi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abdullahi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Em makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida, con esta actividad está logrando salir adelante junto con su familia, por eso ella necesita seguir produciendo más para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.La socia Erika pertenece al banco comunal "Santo Domingo".
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar papa, arroz, aceite y pollo.
La socia esta agradecida infinitamente con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito que le otorgaron y asegura que pagara sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Erika continues to dedicate herself to her business selling food. With this work, she is successfully getting ahead with her family. For this reason, she needs to continue producing more in order to have a better quality of life. She is a member of the "Santo Domingo" communal bank.

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy potatoes, rice, cooking oil and chicken.

She is infinitely grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan being provided to her, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, cooking oil and chicken.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de jugos, ella se dedica muchos años a esta actividad con mucho esfuerzo y  empeño sale adelante y a su negocio le va muy bien.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar papaya, plátanos, mangos, leche y naranjas.
La socia esta feliz y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y su trabajo, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to dedicate herself to her business selling juices. She has done this work for many years, with great energy and dedication, so that she is getting ahead and her business is going very well.

She is requesting the loan to buy papayas, bananas, mangos, oranges and milk.

She is happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for their continued confidence in her and her work. For that reason she is committed to being punctual with her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy papayas, bananas, mangos, oranges and milk.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Jesusa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jesusa has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en: Jane is a farmer who love trees and would like to have biogas in order to stop the use of firewood as her main source of fuel.  With this loan she will be able to get a bio-digester and help in conserving trees.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean renewable cooking fuel.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jagannath Group

texts.en:
Jagannath Group started in the year 2015 at Mandel village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. These are nine active self-dependent women with an intention for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own trade and business.

Sabita is one who has played a great role for her own development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing third person from the left in the photo, wearing spectacles. She is about 32 years old and lives with her small family: her husband and two children.

Sabita has been engaged in a grocery business in her own home for the last six years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income, it is very difficult to support her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So Sabita formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc. Sabita hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for purchase another house and to provide better education to her children.

The other eight members of the group are also smart at their work and also actively engaged with different businesses such as vegetable vending, carpentry, grocery business, cloth business, a Tea and Tiffin stall, animal trading, and a mobile repair center. With this loan, they all hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is presently enjoying his business. He is married, and has three children attending school. His wife is engaged in a direct selling business.

Through his business selling soft drinks, Danilo is able to provide his family with basic needs. Danilo patiently delivers soft drinks to his regular customers. Sometimes his stocks are insufficient to supply all his costumers. Hence, he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more soft drinks to sell.

He is hoping for the growth of the business while managing it.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tikeswari's Group

texts.en:
Tikeswari, standing on the right hand side in the photograph, is a older widowed lady living with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, and a son aged 8. She is engaged in making table cloths, sweaters, dolls, wall hangings, hand bags etc. She sells these items to dealers of handicrafts and in exhibitions. After her husband’s death she wanted to help her father-in-law financially, so she started making items prepared from wool. She has three years of experience in this business. She also knows to stitch dresses.

She has a plan to enhance her business by making these items in greater amounts and to purchase a sewing machine for preparing dresses. She wants to start a small training school where she can give training to the women of her village for preparing items made of wool and for stitching dresses .

Tikeswari, along with her group member, has requested for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing sewing machine and raw materials like wool, thread, and glue in bulk from wholesalers.

She has a dream to provide the best education to her son and save some money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials like wool, thread and glue in bulk from wholesalers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for 19 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a hardworking young man who helps his father in supporting their family of six members by working as a photographer.

In addition to his job, Mohammad is a university student, who is majoring in Plant Production and Protection, as he chose this major to help his father who is a farmer, in reviving their own land, because his father can’t do it by himself because of his age.

Now Mohammad is a third year student requesting a loan in order to help him pay the rest of his next semester fees in hopes that he can graduate as soon as possible to start working with his father.

loans.use: to help pay the his next semester fees for a BSc. in Plant Production and Protection

loans.name: Sonia

texts.fr: Sonia, 33 ans, vit en union libre et mère de deux enfants qui sont scolarisés. Pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle revend des grains alimentaires par sac. Son stock est constitué de haricot, maïs, petit-mil, cacahouète, etc. Elle demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Sonia is 33 and lives in a common-law marriage. She is the mother of two children who are enrolled in school. To take care of her family, Sonia resells food-quality grains by the sack. Her stock consists of dried beans, maize, pearl millet, peanuts, etc. She is asking for this loan to grow her stock of cereals.

loans.use: to expand her stock of cereals that she sells by the sack.

loans.name: Atek Irwot Group

texts.en:
Kilara (seated with a raised arm) is a hardworking single mother with five school going children. She is a market vendor selling fish to derive her livelihood and pay school fees for her children. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 to help her buy stock of fish so that she can expand her business, sales and profit. She is so grateful to Kiva funders through UGAFODE for the financial support.

The extra members have signed the waiver form but are still saving to get the loan next cycle.

loans.use: to add stock.

loans.name: Prisca's Group

texts.en:
Prisca who is in her mid 20's is married with one child who is still small. She has been selling fabrics door to door for four years now. She works from 6am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Prisca’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to travel outside the country and bought the best selling fabrics. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is moving forward. She also used the profit to take care of her child, to repay loan, to pay rent, reinvest in business, bought a TV set, a radio and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the fabrics stock and meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Prisca will share this loan with her loan group Madona which has three members who will hold each other account table for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on her fabrics stock and meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda works hard to support her family. Belinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Belinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia is a 41-year-old married woman with two children. Both of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Rosenia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Eldandia

texts.en:
Eldandia is 58 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Eldandia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eldandia has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eldandia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies
